" Well , to be sure ! Still , [he]3135-a churchman may make [her]3132-each one [a good husband]3136-a good husband . "[134-mrs. hankey] " [He]3135-a churchman may or [he]3135-a churchman may not ; [you]102-elisabeth never can tell . It seems to [me]134-mrs. hankey that [husbands]3137-husbands are like new boots — [you]102-elisabeth ca n't tell where [they]3137-husbands 're going to pinch [you]102-elisabeth till it 's too late to change 'em . And as for creaking , why , the boots that are quietest in [the shop]3138-the shop are just the ones that fairly disgrace [you]102-elisabeth when [you]102-elisabeth come into [chapel]373-chapel late on a Sunday morning , and think to slip in quietly during the first prayer ; and it is pretty much the same with [husbands]3137-husbands — [those that are the meekest in the wooing]3141-those that are the meekest in the wooing are [the most masterful to live with]3142-the most masterful to live with . [I]134-mrs. hankey can not stand them at any price , and so [I]134-mrs. hankey 'm forever telling [[his]140-tom wilkins wife]3146-his wife . "[134-mrs. hankey] " Dear [me]134-mrs. hankey ! "[134-mrs. hankey] " Would [you]134-mrs. hankey believe it , [he]140-tom wilkins do n't hold with [the good old Methodist]3147-the good old methodist habit of telling out loud what [the Lord]2978-the lord has done for [your]134-mrs. hankey soul ? [He]140-tom wilkins says religion should be acted up to and not talked about ; but , for [my]123-mrs. bateson part , [I]123-mrs. bateson ca n't abide such closeness . "[123-mrs. bateson] " Nor [I]123-mrs. bateson , "[123-mrs. bateson] agreed [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson warmly ; " [I]123-mrs. bateson do n't approve of treating [the Lord]2978-the lord like [a poor relation]3150-a poor relation , as [some folks]3151-some folks seem to do . "[123-mrs. bateson] " Just so ; and that 's [Tom Wilkins]140-tom wilkins to the life . [He]140-tom wilkins 's [a good husband]3136-a good husband and [a regular church - goer]3154-a regular church - goer ; but as for the word that edifieth , [you]3155-you might as well look for it from [a naked savage]3156-a naked savage as from [him]140-tom wilkins . ' And so [she]3146-his wife will , [I]123-mrs. bateson 'll be bound ; and the sooner [she]3146-his wife knows it the better . "[123-mrs. bateson] [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson sighed at the gloomy prospect opening out before [young Mrs. Wilkins]141-young mrs. wilkins ; then [she]123-mrs. bateson asked : " How did [the last daughter]3161-the last daughter 's wedding go off ? "[123-mrs. bateson] " [She]3161-the last daughter did , [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson ; and a better match [no mother]3163-no mother could wish for [[her]3163-no mother daughter]3164-her daughter , not even [a duchess born]3165-a duchess born ; [he]3162-a methodist 's [a chapel - steward]3166-a chapel - steward and [a master - painter]3167-a master - painter , and has [six men]3168-six men under [him]3162-a methodist . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [You]3171-you do indeed ; there 's no denying that . "[123-mrs. bateson] " That 's true , especially if [they]3106-folks happen to be [men]445-men . "[134-mrs. hankey] " Why do [men]445-men think about mischief more than [women]446-women do ? ' "[600-her hostess] " And quite right , [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson ; it 's often a wonder to [me]600-her hostess that [the Lord]2978-the lord has patience with [men]445-men , seeing that [[their]445-men own wives]3227-their own wives have n't . "[600-her hostess] " And to [me]134-mrs. hankey , too . With [her]102-elisabeth , to pity was to love ; and it was difficult for [her]102-elisabeth ever to love where [she]102-elisabeth did not pity . [Christopher]135-christopher did not understand this , and was careful not to appeal to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's sympathy for fear of depressing [her]102-elisabeth . Herein , both as [boy]602-boy and [man]603-man , [he]135-christopher made a great mistake . It was not as easy to depress [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth as it was to depress [him]135-christopher ; and , moreover , it was sometimes good for [her]102-elisabeth to be depressed . But [he]135-christopher did unto [her]102-elisabeth as [he]135-christopher would [she]102-elisabeth should do unto [him]135-christopher ; and , when all is said and done , it is difficult to find a more satisfactory rule of conduct than this . On the way [home]399-home , after the tea - party was over , [Christopher]135-christopher remarked : " [Old Mother Bateson]147-old mother bateson is n't a bad sort ; but [I]135-christopher ca n't stand [Mother Hankey]148-mother hankey . "[134-mrs. hankey] " Well , [I]135-christopher think [she]148-mother hankey is [an old cat]3279-an old cat , "[135-christopher] persisted [Christopher]135-christopher . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]135-christopher think [they]3280-they do , "[135-christopher] agreed [Christopher]135-christopher ; " but [nobody]409-nobody except [you]102-elisabeth would ever have thought of saying it . [You]102-elisabeth have a knack of saying what [everybody else]3282-everybody else is thinking ; and that is what makes [you]102-elisabeth so amusing . "[135-christopher] " [I]102-elisabeth 'm glad [you]102-elisabeth think [I]102-elisabeth 'm amusing ; but [I]102-elisabeth ca n't see much funniness in just saying what is true . "[102-elisabeth] " Well , [I]135-christopher ca n't explain why it is funny ; but [you]102-elisabeth really are simply killing sometimes , "[135-christopher] said [Christopher]135-christopher graciously . The next day , and on many succeeding ones , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth duly visited [Jemima Stubbs]145-jemima and [the invalid boy]605-the invalid boy , although [Christopher]135-christopher entreated [her]102-elisabeth not to worry [herself]102-elisabeth about [them]606-them , and offered to go in [[her]102-elisabeth place]607-her place . But [he]135-christopher failed to understand that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was goaded by no depressing sense of duty , as [he]135-christopher would have been in similar circumstances ; [she]102-elisabeth went because pity was a passion with [her]102-elisabeth , and therefore [she]102-elisabeth was always absorbingly interested in [any one whom [she]102-elisabeth pitied]608-any one whom she pitied . Strength and success and such - like attributes never appealed to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , possibly because [she]102-elisabeth [herself]102-elisabeth was strong , and possessed all the qualities of [the successful person]609-the successful person ; but weakness and failure were all - powerful in enlisting [her]102-elisabeth sympathy and interest and , through these , [her]102-elisabeth love . As [Christopher]135-christopher grew older [he]135-christopher dreamed dreams of how in the future [he]135-christopher should raise [himself]135-christopher from being only [the nephew of [[Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth 's manager]611-miss farringdon 's manager]610-the nephew of miss farringdon 's manager to a position of wealth and importance ; and how [he]135-christopher should finally bring all [his]135-christopher glories and honours and lay them at [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's feet . [His]135-christopher eyes were not opened to see that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth would probably turn with careless laughter from all such honours thus manufactured into [her]102-elisabeth pavement ; but if [he]135-christopher came to [her]102-elisabeth bent and bruised and brokenhearted , crushed with failure instead of crowned with success , [her]102-elisabeth heart would never send [him]135-christopher empty away , but would go out to [him]135-christopher with a passionate longing to make up to [him]135-christopher for all that [he]135-christopher had missed in life . A few days after [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson 's tea - party [he]135-christopher said to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , for about the twentieth time : " [I]135-christopher say , [I]135-christopher wish [you]102-elisabeth would n't tire [yourself]102-elisabeth with going to read to [that Stubbs brat]3283-that stubbs brat . "[135-christopher] " Tire [myself]135-christopher ? What rubbish ! nothing can tire [me]135-christopher . [I]135-christopher never felt tired in [my]135-christopher life ; but [I]135-christopher should n't mind it just once , to see what it feels like . "[135-christopher] " It feels distinctly unpleasant , [I]135-christopher can tell [you]102-elisabeth . But [I]135-christopher really do wish [you]102-elisabeth 'd take more care of [yourself]102-elisabeth , or else [you]102-elisabeth 'll get ill , or have headaches or something — [you]102-elisabeth will indeed . "[135-christopher] " No , [I]135-christopher sha n't ; [I]135-christopher never had a headache . That 's another of the things that [I]135-christopher do n't know what they feel like ; and yet [I]135-christopher want to know what everything feels like — even disagreeable things . "[135-christopher] " [You]102-elisabeth 'll know fast enough , [I]135-christopher 'm afraid , "[135-christopher] replied [Christopher]135-christopher ; " but even if it does n't tire [you]102-elisabeth , [you]102-elisabeth would enjoy playing in [the garden]3284-the garden more than reading to [Johnnie Stubbs]146-johnnie stubbs — [you]102-elisabeth know [you]102-elisabeth would ; and [I]135-christopher can go and read to [the little chap]3285-the little chap , if [you]102-elisabeth are set on [his]3285-the little chap being read to . "[135-christopher] " But [you]102-elisabeth would much rather play in [the garden]3284-the garden than read to [him]3285-the little chap ; and especially as it is [your]102-elisabeth holidays , and [your]102-elisabeth own reading - time will soon begin . "[135-christopher] " Oh ! [I]135-christopher do n't matter . But it riles [me]135-christopher to see [you]102-elisabeth worrying and overdoing [yourself]102-elisabeth . "[135-christopher] " [You]102-elisabeth do n't understand , [Chris]125-chris ; [you]102-elisabeth really are awfully stupid about understanding things . "[135-christopher] But [Christopher]135-christopher did not understand , and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth could not make [him]135-christopher do so . The iron of duty had entered into [his]135-christopher childish soul ; and , unconsciously , [he]135-christopher was always trying to come between it and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , and to save [her]102-elisabeth from the burden of obligation which lay so heavily upon [his]135-christopher spirit . [He]135-christopher was [a religious boy]612-a religious boy , but [his]135-christopher religion was of too stern a cast to bring much joy to [him]135-christopher ; and [he]135-christopher was passionately anxious that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth should not be distressed in like manner . [His]135-christopher desire was that [she]102-elisabeth should have sufficient religion to insure [heaven]415-heaven , but not enough to spoil [earth]614-earth — a not uncommon desire on behalf of [[their]615-their dear ones among [poor , ignorant human beings]617-poor , ignorant human beings , whose love for [[their]615-their neighbour]618-their neighbour will surely atone in some measure for [their]615-their injustice toward [God]105-god]616-their dear ones among poor , ignorant human beings , whose love for their neighbour will surely atone in some measure for their injustice toward god . " [You]135-christopher see , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth continued , " there is nothing that makes [you]135-christopher so fond of [people]2982-people as being sorry for [them]2982-people . [The people that are strong and happy]3289-the people that are strong and happy do n't want [your]135-christopher fondness , so it is no use giving it to [them]3289-the people that are strong and happy . "[102-elisabeth] " But [I]135-christopher do n't , "[135-christopher] replied [Christopher]135-christopher , who was always inclined to argue a point ; " when [I]135-christopher like [people]2982-people , [I]135-christopher should like [them]2982-people just the same as if [they]2982-people went about yelling Te Deums at the top of [their]2982-people voices ; and when [I]135-christopher do n't like [them]2982-people , it would n't make [me]135-christopher like [them]2982-people to see [them]2982-people dressed from head to foot in sackcloth and ashes . "[102-elisabeth] " It always vexes [me]102-elisabeth , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth said thoughtfully , " to read about tournaments , because [I]102-elisabeth think it was so horrid of [the Queen of Beauty]3293-the queen of beauty to give the prize to [the knight who won]3294-the knight who won . "[102-elisabeth] [Christopher]135-christopher laughed with masculine scorn . " What nonsense ! Who else could [she]3293-the queen of beauty have given it to ? "[135-christopher] " Why , to [the knight who lost , of course]3295-the knight who lost , of course . [I]102-elisabeth often make up a tale to [myself]102-elisabeth that [I]102-elisabeth am [the Queen of Beauty at a tournament]3296-the queen of beauty at a tournament ; and when [the victorious knight]3297-the victorious knight rides up to [me]102-elisabeth with [his]3297-the victorious knight visor raised , [I]102-elisabeth just laugh at [him]3297-the victorious knight , and say , ' [You]3297-the victorious knight can have the fame and the glory and the cheers of [the crowd]3298-the crowd ; that 's quite enough for [you]3297-the victorious knight ! ' And then [I]102-elisabeth go down from [[my]102-elisabeth daïs]3299-my daïs , right into the arena where [the unhorsed knight is lying wounded]3300-the unhorsed knight is lying wounded , and take off [his]3297-the victorious knight helmet , and lay [his]3297-the victorious knight head on [my]102-elisabeth lap , and say , ' [You]3297-the victorious knight shall have the prize , because [you]3297-the victorious knight have got nothing else ! ' So then [that knight]3301-that knight becomes [[my]102-elisabeth knight]3302-my knight , and always wears [my]102-elisabeth colours ; and that makes up to [him]3301-that knight for having been beaten at the tournament , do n't [you]135-christopher see ? "[102-elisabeth] " It would have been a rotten sort of tournament that was carried on in that fashion ; and [your]135-christopher prize would have been no better than a booby - prize , "[135-christopher] persisted [Christopher]135-christopher . " How silly [you]135-christopher are ! [I]135-christopher 'm glad [I]135-christopher 'm not [a boy]3048-a boy ; [I]135-christopher would n't have been as stupid as [a boy]3048-a boy for anything ! "[135-christopher] " Do n't be so cross ! [You]135-christopher must see that [the knight who wins]3305-the knight who wins is [the best knight]3306-the best knight ; [chaps that are beaten]3307-chaps that are beaten are not up to much . "[102-elisabeth] " Well , they are the sort [I]149-whereupon elisabeth like best ; and if [you]135-christopher had any sense [you]135-christopher 'd like them best , too . "[149-whereupon elisabeth] [Whereupon Elisabeth]149-whereupon elisabeth removed the light of [her]619-her offended countenance from [Christopher]135-christopher , and dashed off in a royal rage . As for [him]135-christopher , [he]135-christopher sighed over the unreasonableness of the weaker sex , but accepted it philosophically as one of the rules of the game ; and [Chris]125-chris played games far too well to have anything but contempt for [any one who rebelled against the rules of any game whatsoever]620-any one who rebelled against the rules of any game whatsoever . It was [a man]310-a man 's business , [he]135-christopher held , not to argue about the rules , but to play the game according to them , and to win ; or , if that was out of [his]135-christopher power , to lose pluckily and never complain . When [Elisabeth]149-whereupon elisabeth was sixteen [her]149-whereupon elisabeth noonday was turned into night by the death of [[her]149-whereupon elisabeth beloved]622-her beloved Cousin [Anne]120-cousin anne . For some time the younger [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth had been in failing health ; but it was [her]102-elisabeth rôle to be delicate , and so [nobody]409-nobody felt anxious about [her]102-elisabeth until it was too late for anxiety to be of any use . [She]102-elisabeth glided out of life as gracefully as [she]102-elisabeth had glided through it , trusting that the sternness of [her]102-elisabeth principles would expiate the leniency of [her]102-elisabeth practice ; and was probably surprised at the discovery that it was the leniency of [her]102-elisabeth practice which finally expiated the sternness of [her]102-elisabeth principles . [She]102-elisabeth left a blank , which was never quite filled up , in the lives of [[her]149-whereupon elisabeth sister]624-her sister [Maria]100-cousin maria and [[her]149-whereupon elisabeth small cousin]625-her small cousin [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . [The former]626-the former bore [her]149-whereupon elisabeth sorrow better , on the whole , than did [the latter]524-the latter , because [she]149-whereupon elisabeth had acquired the habit of bearing sorrow ; but [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth mourned with all the hopeless misery of youth . " It is no use trying to make [me]102-elisabeth interested in things , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth sobbed in response to [Christopher]135-christopher 's clumsy though well - meant attempts to divert [her]102-elisabeth . " [I]102-elisabeth shall never be interested in anything again — never . Everything is different now that [Cousin Anne]120-cousin anne is gone away . "[102-elisabeth] " Not quite everything , "[135-christopher] said [Christopher]135-christopher gently . " Yes ; everything . Why , the very trees do n't look the same as they used to look , and the view is n't a bit what it used to be when [she]120-cousin anne was [here]3308-here . All the ordinary things seem queer and altered , just as they do when [you]3309-you see them in a dream . "[135-christopher] " [Poor little girl]3310-poor little girl ! "[102-elisabeth] " And now it does n't seem worth while for anything to look pretty . [I]135-christopher used to love the sunsets , but now [I]135-christopher hate them . What is the good of [their]3311-their being so beautiful and filling the sky with red and gold , if [she]120-cousin anne is n't here to see them ? And what is the good of trying to be good and clever if [she]120-cousin anne is n't here to be pleased with [me]135-christopher ? Oh dear ! oh dear ! Nothing will ever be any good any more . "[135-christopher] [Christopher]135-christopher laid an awkward hand upon [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's dark hair , and began stroking it the wrong way . " [I]135-christopher say , [I]135-christopher wish [you]102-elisabeth would n't fret so ; it 's more than [I]135-christopher can stand to see [you]102-elisabeth so wretched . "[102-elisabeth] moaned poor little [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , with the selfishness of absorbing grief . " Well , anyway , [I]102-elisabeth am as fond of [you]102-elisabeth as [she]102-elisabeth was , for [nobody]409-nobody could be fonder of [anybody]376-anybody than [I]102-elisabeth am of [you]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] " That does n't help . "[102-elisabeth] " Oh yes , [you]102-elisabeth will , [I]135-christopher expect , "[135-christopher] replied [Christopher]135-christopher , who even then knew [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth better than [she]102-elisabeth knew [herself]102-elisabeth . " No — [I]135-christopher sha n't ; and [I]135-christopher should hate [myself]135-christopher if [I]135-christopher did . "[135-christopher] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth fretted so terribly after [[her]102-elisabeth Cousin]451-her cousin [Anne]120-cousin anne that [she]102-elisabeth grew paler and thinner than ever ; and [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth was afraid that [the girl]629-the girl would make [herself]629-the girl really ill , in spite of [her]629-the girl wiry constitution . After much consultation with [many friends]630-many friends , [she]102-elisabeth decided to send [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth to [school]2997-school , for it was plain that [she]102-elisabeth was losing [her]102-elisabeth vitality through lack of an interest in life ; and [school]2997-school — whatever it may or may not supply — invariably affords an unfailing amount of new interests . So [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth went to [Fox How]25-fox how — [a well - known girls ' school not a hundred miles from [London]15-london]633-a well - known girls ' school not a hundred miles from london — so called in memory of [Dr. Arnold]150-dr. arnold , according to whose principles [the school]634-the school was founded and carried on . It would be futile to attempt to relate the history of [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth without telling in some measure what [her]102-elisabeth school - days did for [her]102-elisabeth ; and it would be equally futile to endeavour to convey to the uninitiated any idea of what [that particular school]635-that particular school meant — and still means — to [all [its]635-that particular school daughters]636-all its daughters . When [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had left [her]102-elisabeth girlhood far behind [her]102-elisabeth , the mere mention of the name , [Fox How]25-fox how , never failed to send thrills all through [her]102-elisabeth , as [God]105-god save [the Queen]637-the queen , and [Home]399-home , sweet Home have a knack of doing ; and for [any one]639-any one to have ever been [a pupil at [Fox How]25-fox how]640-a pupil at fox how , was always a sure and certain passport to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's interest and friendliness . [The school]634-the school was [an old , square , white house]642-an old , square , white house , standing in [a walled garden]643-a walled garden ; and those walls enclosed all the multifarious interests and pleasures and loves and rivalries and heart - searchings and soul - awakenings which go to make up the feminine life from twelve to eighteen , and which are very much the same in their essence , if not in their form , as those which go to make up the feminine life from eighteen to eighty . In addition to these , the walls enclosed [two lawns]644-two lawns and [an archery - ground]645-an archery - ground , [a field]646-a field and [a pond overgrown with water - lilies]647-a pond overgrown with water - lilies , a high mound covered with grass and trees , and [a kitchen - garden filled with all manner of herbs and pleasant fruits]648-a kitchen - garden filled with all manner of herbs and pleasant fruits — in short , it was [a wonderful and extensive garden]649-a wonderful and extensive garden , such as one sees now and then in [some old - fashioned suburb]650-some old - fashioned suburb , but which [people]2982-people have neither the time nor the space to lay out nowadays . [It]649-a wonderful and extensive garden also contained a long , straight walk , running [its]649-a wonderful and extensive garden whole length and shaded by impenetrable greenery , where [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth used to walk up and down , pretending that [she]102-elisabeth was [a nun]652-a nun ; and some delightful swings and see - saws , much patronized by the said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , which gave [her]102-elisabeth a similar physical thrill to that produced in later years by the mention of [[her]102-elisabeth old school]653-her old school . The gracious personality which ruled over [Fox How]25-fox how in the days of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had mastered the rarely acquired fact that the word educate is derived from educo , to draw out , and not ( as is generally supposed ) from addo , to give to ; so [the pupils there]654-the pupils there were trained to train [themselves]654-the pupils there , and learned how to learn — a far better equipment for life and its lessons than any ready - made cloak of superficial knowledge , which covers all individualities and fits none . There was no cramming or forcing at [Fox How]25-fox how ; the object of [the school]634-the school was not to teach [girls]519-girls how to be [scholars]657-scholars , but rather how to be [themselves]519-girls — that is to say , the best selves which [they]519-girls were capable of becoming . High character rather than high scholarship was the end of education [there]658-there ; and good breeding counted for more than correct knowledge . Not that learning was neglected , for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth and [[her]102-elisabeth schoolfellows]659-her schoolfellows worked at [their]660-their books for eight good hours every day ; but it did not form the first item on the programme of life . And who can deny that the system of Fox How was the correct system of education , at any rate , as far as [girls]519-girls are concerned ? Unless [a woman]469-a woman has to earn [her]469-a woman living by teaching , what does it matter to [her]469-a woman how much hydrogen there is in a drop of rain - water , or in what year [Hannibal]152-hannibal crossed [the Alps]26-the alps ? But it will matter to [her]469-a woman infinitely , for the remainder of [her]469-a woman mortal existence , whether [she]469-a woman is one of [those graceful , sympathetic beings]663-those graceful , sympathetic beings , whose pathway is paved by the love of [Man]603-man and the friendship of [Woman]153-woman ; or [one of [that much - to - be - blamed , if somewhat - to - be - pitied , sisterhood]666-that much - to - be - blamed , if somewhat - to - be - pitied , sisterhood , who are unloved because [they]667-they are unlovely , and unlovely because [they]667-they are unloved]665-one of that much - to - be - blamed , if somewhat - to - be - pitied , sisterhood , who are unloved because they are unlovely , and unlovely because they are unloved . It is not good for [man]603-man , [woman]669-woman , or [child]670-child to be alone ; and the companionship of [girls of [her]469-a woman own age]671-girls of her own age did much toward deepening and broadening [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's character . The easy give - and - take of perfect equality was beneficial to [her]102-elisabeth , as it is to [everybody]3055-everybody [She]102-elisabeth did not forget [[her]102-elisabeth Cousin]451-her cousin [Anne]120-cousin anne — the art of forgetting was never properly acquired by [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ; but new friendships and new interests sprang up out of the grave of [the old one]674-the old one , and changed its resting - place from [a cemetery]675-a cemetery into [a garden]676-a garden . [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth could not be happy — could not exist , in fact — without some absorbing affection and interest in life . There are [certain women to whom " the trivial round "[3316-certain women to whom " the trivial round " and " the common task "] and " the common task "]3316-certain women to whom " the trivial round " and " the common task "[3316-certain women to whom " the trivial round " and " the common task "] are all - sufficing who ask nothing more of life than that [they]667-they shall always have a dinner to order or [a drawing - room]677-a drawing - room to dust , and to whom the delinquencies of [the cook]678-the cook supply a drama of never - failing attraction and a subject of never - ending conversation ; but [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was made of other material ; vital interests and strong attachments were indispensable to [her]102-elisabeth well - being . The death of [Anne Farringdon]103-anne farringdon had left a cruel blank in the young life which was none too full of human interest to begin with ; but this blank was to a great measure filled up by [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's adoration for [the beloved personage who ruled over [Fox How]25-fox how]679-the beloved personage who ruled over fox how , and by [her]102-elisabeth devoted friendship for [Felicia Herbert]154-felicia . In after years [she]102-elisabeth often smiled tenderly when [she]102-elisabeth recalled the absolute worship which [the girls at [Fox How]25-fox how]680-the girls at fox how offered to [[their]680-the girls at fox how " [Dear Lady]3318-dear lady]3317-their " dear lady , "[102-elisabeth] as [they]680-the girls at fox how called [her]102-elisabeth , and of which [the " Dear Lady]3319-the " dear lady "[102-elisabeth] [herself]102-elisabeth was supremely unconscious . It was a feeling of loyalty stronger than any ever excited by crowned heads ( unless , perhaps , by [the Pope]681-the pope [himself]681-the pope ) , as [she]102-elisabeth represented to [their]680-the girls at fox how girlish minds the embodiment of all that was right , as well as of all that was mighty — and represented it so perfectly that through all [their]680-the girls at fox how lives [[her]102-elisabeth pupils]682-her pupils never dissociated [herself]682-her pupils from the righteousness which [she]102-elisabeth taught and upheld and practised . And this attitude was wholly good for [girls born in a century when it was the fashion to sneer at hero - worship and to scoff at authority when the word obedience in the Marriage Service]683-girls born in a century when it was the fashion to sneer at hero - worship and to scoff at authority when the word obedience in the marriage service was accused of redundancy , and the custom of speaking evil of dignities was mistaken for self - respect . As for [Felicia Herbert]154-felicia , [she]154-felicia became for a time the very mainspring of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's life . [She]154-felicia was [a beautiful girl , with fair hair and clear - cut features]684-a beautiful girl , with fair hair and clear - cut features ; and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth adored [her]154-felicia with the adoration that is freely given , as a rule , to [the girl who has beauty by [the girl who has not]686-the girl who has not]685-the girl who has beauty by the girl who has not . [She]154-felicia was , moreover , gifted with a sweet and calm placidity , which was very restful to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's volatile spirit ; and [the latter]524-the latter consequently greeted [her]154-felicia with that passionate and thrilling friendship which is so satisfying to [the immature female soul]688-the immature female soul , but which is never again experienced by [the woman who has once been taught by [a man the nature of real love]690-a man the nature of real love]689-the woman who has once been taught by a man the nature of real love . [Felicia]154-felicia was much more religious than [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , and much more prone to take serious views of life . The training of [Fox How]25-fox how made for seriousness , and in that respect [Felicia]154-felicia entered into the spirit of [the place]691-the place more profoundly than [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was capable of doing ; for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was always tender rather than serious , and broad rather than deep . " [I]154-felicia shall never go to balls when [I]154-felicia leave [school]2997-school , "[154-felicia] said [Felicia]154-felicia to [[her]154-felicia friend]692-her friend one day of [their]693-we last term at [Fox How]25-fox how , as [the two]340-the two were sitting in [the arbour]695-the arbour at the end of the long walk . " [I]154-felicia do n't think it is right to go to balls . "[154-felicia] " Why not ? There can be no harm in enjoying [oneself]3321-oneself , and [I]154-felicia do n't believe that [God]105-god ever thinks there is . "[154-felicia] " Not in enjoying [oneself]3321-oneself in a certain way ; but the line between [religious people]3322-religious people and [worldly people]3323-worldly people ought to be clearly marked . [I]154-felicia think that dancing is a regular worldly amusement , and that [good people]3324-good people should openly show [their]3324-good people disapproval of it by not joining in it . "[154-felicia] " But [God]105-god wants [us]693-we to enjoy [ourselves]693-we , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth persisted . " And [He]105-god would n't really love [us]693-we if [He]105-god did n't . "[102-elisabeth] " [God]105-god wants [us]693-we to do what is right , and it does n't matter whether [we]693-we enjoy [ourselves]693-we or not . "[154-felicia] " But it does ; it matters awfully . [We]693-we ca n't really be good unless [we]693-we are happy . "[154-felicia] [Felicia]154-felicia shook [her]154-felicia head . " [We]693-we ca n't really be happy unless [we]693-we are good ; and if [we]693-we are good [we]693-we shall ' love not [the world]301-the world , ' but shall stand apart from it . "[154-felicia] " But [I]154-felicia must love [the world]301-the world ; [I]154-felicia ca n't help loving [the world]301-the world , it is so grand and beautiful and funny . [I]154-felicia love the whole of [it]301-the world : all the trees and [the fields]3328-the fields , and [the towns]3329-the towns and [the cities]3330-the cities , and [the prim old people]3331-the prim old people and [the dear little children]3332-the dear little children . [I]154-felicia love [the places]3333-the places — [the old places]3334-the old places because [I]154-felicia have known [them]3334-the old places so long , and [the new places]3335-the new places because [I]154-felicia have never seen [them]3334-the old places before ; and [I]154-felicia love [the people]3030-the people best of all . [I]154-felicia adore [people]2982-people , [Felicia]154-felicia ; do n't [you]154-felicia ? "[154-felicia] " No ; [I]154-felicia do n't think that [I]154-felicia do . Of course [I]154-felicia like [the people that [I]154-felicia like]3338-the people that i like ; but the others seem to [me]154-felicia dreadfully uninteresting . "[154-felicia] " But [they]3338-the people that i like are not ; [they]3338-the people that i like are all frightfully interesting when once [you]3339-you get to know [them]3338-the people that i like , and see what [they]3338-the people that i like really are made of inside . Outsides may seem dull ; but insides are always engrossing . That 's why [I]154-felicia always love [people]2982-people when once [I]154-felicia 've seen [them]2982-people cry , because when [they]2982-people cry [they]2982-people are [themselves]2982-people , and not any make - ups . "[154-felicia] " How queer to like [people]2982-people because [you]154-felicia have seen [them]2982-people cry ! "[154-felicia] " Well , [I]154-felicia do . [I]154-felicia 'd do anything for [a person that [I]154-felicia had seen cry]3342-a person that i had seen cry ; [I]154-felicia would really . "[154-felicia] [Felicia]154-felicia opened [her]154-felicia large hazel eyes still wider . " What a strange idea ! It seems to [me]154-felicia that [you]154-felicia think too much about feelings and not enough about principles . "[154-felicia] " But thinking about feelings makes [you]154-felicia think about principles ; feelings are the only things that ever make [me]154-felicia think about principles at all . "[154-felicia] After a few minutes ' silence [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth asked suddenly : " What do [you]154-felicia mean to do with [your]154-felicia life when [you]154-felicia leave [here]3308-here and take it up ? "[102-elisabeth] " [I]154-felicia do n't know . [I]154-felicia suppose [I]154-felicia shall fall in love and get married . [Most girls]3344-most girls do . And [I]154-felicia hope it will be with [a clergyman]3345-a clergyman , for [I]154-felicia do so love parish work . "[154-felicia] " [I]102-elisabeth do n't think [I]102-elisabeth want to get married , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth slowly , " not even to [a clergyman]3345-a clergyman . "[102-elisabeth] " How queer of [you]154-felicia ! Why not ? "[154-felicia] " Because [I]154-felicia want to paint pictures and to become [a great artist]3347-a great artist . [I]154-felicia feel there is such a lot in [me]154-felicia that [I]154-felicia want to say , and that [I]154-felicia must say ; and [I]154-felicia can only say it by means of pictures . It would be dreadful to die before [you]154-felicia had delivered the message that [you]154-felicia had been sent into [the world]301-the world to deliver , do n't [you]154-felicia think ? "[154-felicia] " It would be more dreadful to die before [you]154-felicia had found [one man to whom [you]154-felicia would be everything , and who would be everything to [you]154-felicia]3349-one man to whom you would be everything , and who would be everything to you , "[154-felicia] replied [Felicia]154-felicia . " Oh ! [I]102-elisabeth mean to fall in love , because [everybody]3055-everybody does , and [I]102-elisabeth hate to be behindhand with things ; but [I]102-elisabeth shall do it just as an experience , to make [me]102-elisabeth paint better pictures . [I]102-elisabeth read in a book the other day that [you]154-felicia must fall in love before [you]154-felicia can become [a true artist]3351-a true artist ; so [I]102-elisabeth mean to do so . But it wo n't be as important to [me]102-elisabeth as [my]102-elisabeth art , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , who was as yet young enough to be extremely wise . " Still , it must be lovely to know there is one person in [the world]301-the world to whom [you]154-felicia can tell all [your]154-felicia thoughts , and who will understand them , and be interested in them . "[102-elisabeth] " It must be far lovelier to know that [you]154-felicia have the power to tell all [your]154-felicia thoughts to [the whole world]3353-the whole world , and that [the world]301-the world will understand them and be interested in them , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth persisted . " [I]102-elisabeth do n't think so . [I]102-elisabeth should like to fall in love with [a man who was so much better than [I]102-elisabeth , that [I]102-elisabeth could lean on [him]3355-a man who was so much better than i , that i could lean on him and learn from him in everything and learn from [him]3355-a man who was so much better than i , that i could lean on him and learn from him in everything in everything]3355-a man who was so much better than i , that i could lean on him and learn from him in everything ; and [I]102-elisabeth should like to feel that whatever goodness or cleverness there was in [me]102-elisabeth was all owing to [him]3355-a man who was so much better than i , that i could lean on him and learn from him in everything , and that [I]102-elisabeth was nothing by [myself]102-elisabeth , but everything with [him]3355-a man who was so much better than i , that i could lean on him and learn from him in everything . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth should n't . [I]102-elisabeth should like to feel that [I]102-elisabeth was so good and clever that [I]102-elisabeth was helping [the man]3356-the man to be better and cleverer even than [he]3355-a man who was so much better than i , that i could lean on him and learn from him in everything was before . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]154-felicia should like all [my]154-felicia happiness and all [my]154-felicia interest to centre in [that one particular man]3357-that one particular man , "[154-felicia] said [Felicia]154-felicia ; " and to feel that [he]3357-that one particular man was [a fairy prince]3358-a fairy prince , and that [I]154-felicia was [a poor beggar - maid]3359-a poor beggar - maid , who possessed nothing but [his]3357-that one particular man love . "[154-felicia] " Oh ! [I]102-elisabeth should n't . And as for whether [he]3357-that one particular man 'd lost or won in the wars , [I]102-elisabeth should n't care a rap , as long as [I]102-elisabeth was sure that [he]3357-that one particular man could n't be happy without [me]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] " [You]102-elisabeth and [I]154-felicia never think alike about things , "[154-felicia] said [Felicia]154-felicia sadly . " [[You]102-elisabeth old darling]3362-you old darling ! What does it matter , as long as [we]3363-we agree in being fond of [each other]3364-each other ? "[154-felicia] At eighteen [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth said farewell to [Fox How]25-fox how with many tears , and came back to live at [the Willows]8-the willows with [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth . While [she]102-elisabeth had been at [school]2997-school , [Christopher]135-christopher had been first in [Germany]28-germany and then in [America]29-america , learning how to make iron , so that [they]697-they had never met during [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's holidays ; therefore , when [he]135-christopher beheld [her]102-elisabeth transformed from [a little girl]3044-a little girl into [a full - blown young lady]699-a full - blown young lady , [he]135-christopher straightway fell in love with [her]102-elisabeth . [He]135-christopher was , however , sensible enough not to mention the circumstance , even to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth [herself]102-elisabeth , as [he]135-christopher realized , as well as [anybody]376-anybody , that [the nephew of [Richard Smallwood]104-richard smallwood]473-the nephew of richard smallwood would not be considered [a fitting mate for [a daughter of the house of Farringdon]703-a daughter of the house of farringdon]702-a fitting mate for a daughter of the house of farringdon ; but the fact that [he]135-christopher did not mention the circumstance in no way prevented [him]135-christopher from dwelling upon it in [his]135-christopher own mind , and deriving much pleasurable pain and much painful pleasure therefrom . In short , [he]135-christopher dwelt upon it so exclusively and so persistently that it went near to breaking [his]135-christopher heart ; but that was not until [his]135-christopher heart was older , and therefore more capable of being broken past mending again . [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth and [the people of [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill]704-the people of sedgehill were alike delighted to have [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth among [them]705-them once more ; [she]102-elisabeth was [a girl with a strong personality]706-a girl with a strong personality ; and [people with strong personalities]707-people with strong personalities have a knack of making [themselves]707-people with strong personalities missed when [they]707-people with strong personalities go away . " It 's nice , and so it is , to have [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth back again , "[123-mrs. bateson] remarked [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson to [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey ; " and it makes it so much cheerfuller for [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth , too . "[123-mrs. bateson] " Maybe it 'll only make it the harder for [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth when the time comes for [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth to be removed by death or by marriage ; and which'll be the best for [her]102-elisabeth — [poor young lady!—the Lord]3365-poor young lady!—the lord must decide , for [I]123-mrs. bateson 'm sure [I]123-mrs. bateson could n't pass an opinion , only having tried one , and that nothing to boast of . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [I]123-mrs. bateson wonder if [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth will leave [her]102-elisabeth [her]102-elisabeth fortune , "[123-mrs. bateson] said [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson , who , in common with the rest of [[her]123-mrs. bateson class]708-her class , was consumed with an absorbing curiosity as to all testamentary dispositions . " [She]102-elisabeth may , and [she]102-elisabeth may not ; there 's no prophesying about wills . [I]123-mrs. bateson 'm pleased to say [I]123-mrs. bateson can generally foretell when [folks]3106-folks is going to die , having done a good bit of sick - nursing in [my]123-mrs. bateson time afore [I]123-mrs. bateson married [Hankey]134-mrs. hankey ; but as to foretelling how [they]3106-folks 're going to leave [their]3106-folks money , [I]123-mrs. bateson can no more do it than [the babe unborn]3367-the babe unborn ; nor [nobody]409-nobody can , as ever [I]123-mrs. bateson heard tell on . "[123-mrs. bateson] " That 's so , [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey . [Wills]155-wills seem to [me]123-mrs. bateson to have been invented by [the devil]3369-the devil for the special upsetting of the corpse 's memory . Why , [some of [the peaceablest folks as [I]123-mrs. bateson 've ever known]3371-the peaceablest folks as i 've ever known]3370-some of the peaceablest folks as i 've ever known — [folks as would n't have scared [a lady]3373-a lady - cow in [their]3370-some of the peaceablest folks as i 've ever known lifetime]3372-folks as would n't have scared a lady - cow in their lifetime — have left wills as have sent all [[their]3370-some of the peaceablest folks as i 've ever known relations]3374-their relations to the right - about , ready to bite [one another]3051-one another 's noses off . [Bateson]123-mrs. bateson often says to [me]123-mrs. bateson , ' [Kezia]126-kezia , ' [he]3376-he says , ' call [no man]521-no man honest till [his]521-no man will 's read . ' And [I]123-mrs. bateson 'll be bound [he]521-no man 's in the right . Still , it would be hard to see [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth begging [her]102-elisabeth bread after the way [she]102-elisabeth 's been brought up , and [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth would never have the conscience to let [her]102-elisabeth do it . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [Folks]3106-folks leave [their]3106-folks consciences behind with [their]3106-folks bodies , "[134-mrs. hankey] said [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey ; " and [I]134-mrs. hankey 've lived long enough to be surprised at nothing where [wills]3379-wills are concerned . "[134-mrs. hankey] " That is quite true , "[123-mrs. bateson] replied [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson . " Now take [Miss Anne]108-miss anne , for instance : [she]108-miss anne seemed so set on [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth that [you]3380-you 'd have thought [she]108-miss anne 'd have left [her]108-miss anne a trifle ; but not [she]108-miss anne ! All [she]108-miss anne had went to [[her]108-miss anne sister]624-her sister , [Miss Maria]156-miss maria , who 'd got quite enough already . [Miss Anne]108-miss anne was as sweet and gentle a lady as [you]3380-you 'd wish to see ; but [her]108-miss anne will was as hard as the nether millstone . "[123-mrs. bateson] " There 's nothing like a death for showing up what [a family]3382-a family is made of . "[123-mrs. bateson] " There is n't . Now [Mr. William Farringdon]98-william 's will was a very cruel one , according to [my]123-mrs. bateson ideas , leaving everything to [[his]98-william niece]354-his niece and nothing to [[his]98-william son]3384-his son . True , [Mr. George]157-mr. george was but [[a barber]3385-a barber 's block with no work in [him]157-mr. george]3386-a barber 's block with no work in him , and [I]123-mrs. bateson 'm the last to defend that ; and then [he]98-william did n't want to marry [[his]98-william cousin]343-his cousin , [Miss Maria]156-miss maria , for which [I]123-mrs. bateson should n't blame [him]98-william so much ; if [a man]310-a man ca n't choose [[his]310-a man own wife]3389-his own wife and [his]310-a man own newspaper , what can [he]310-a man choose?—certainly not [his]310-a man own victuals , for [he]310-a man is n't fit . But if [folks]3106-folks only leave [their]3106-folks money to [them]3106-folks that have followed [their]3106-folks advice in everything , most wills would be nothing but a blank sheet of paper . "[123-mrs. bateson] " And if [they]3106-folks were , it would n't be a bad thing , [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson ; there would be less sorrow on some sides , and less crape on others , and far less unpleasantness all round . For [my]123-mrs. bateson part , [I]123-mrs. bateson doubt if [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth will leave [her]102-elisabeth fortune to [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , and [[her]102-elisabeth only [a cousin]3392-a cousin 's child]3391-her only a cousin 's child ; for when all is said and done , [cousins]3393-cousins are but elastic relations , as [you]3394-you may say . "[123-mrs. bateson] " Well , let 's hope that [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth will marry , and have [a husband]3236-a husband to work for [her]102-elisabeth when [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth is dead and gone . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [Husbands]3137-husbands are as uncertain as [wills]3379-wills , [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson , and more sure to give offence to [them]3137-husbands that trust in [them]3137-husbands ; besides , [I]123-mrs. bateson doubt if [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth is handsome enough to get [a husband]3236-a husband . "[123-mrs. bateson] [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson took up the cudgels on [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's behalf . " [She]102-elisabeth may n't be exactly handsome — [I]123-mrs. bateson do n't pretend as [she]102-elisabeth is ; but [she]102-elisabeth has a wonderful way of dressing [herself]102-elisabeth , and looking for all [the world]301-the world like a fashion - plate ; and [some men]3406-some men have a keen eye for clothes . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [I]123-mrs. bateson wish [she]3411-the woman 'd marry [Mr. Christopher]135-christopher ; [he]135-christopher worships the very ground [she]3411-the woman walks on , and [she]3411-the woman could n't find [a better man]3412-a better man if [she]3411-the woman swept out all the corners of [the earth]466-the earth looking for one . [I]123-mrs. bateson always say that [men]445-men are the same as [kittens]3415-kittens — [you]3416-you should take ['em]3417-'em straight from [[their]445-men mothers]3418-their mothers , or else not take 'em at all ; for , if [you]3416-you do n't , [you]3416-you never know what bad habits [they]445-men may have formed or what queer tricks [they]445-men will be up to . But [he]135-christopher 's wonderful fond of [her]3420-the manager 's nephew , [Mr. Christopher]135-christopher is ; and there 's nothing like love for smoothing things over when the oven ai n't properly heated , and the meat is done to a cinder on one side and all raw on the other . [You]3416-you find that out when [you]3416-you 're married . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [You]3416-you find a good many things out when [you]3416-you 're married , [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson , and one is that [this world]3177-this world is a wilderness of care . But as for love , [I]123-mrs. bateson do n't rightly know much about it , since [Hankey]134-mrs. hankey would always rather have had [[my]123-mrs. bateson sister]3173-my sister [Sarah]143-sarah than [me]123-mrs. bateson , and only put up with [me]123-mrs. bateson when [she]3420-the manager 's nephew gave [him]135-christopher the pass - by , being set on marrying [one of [the family]3116-the family]3425-one of the family . "[123-mrs. bateson] " Well , love 's a fine thing ; take [my]123-mrs. bateson word for it . It keeps [the men]3428-the men from grumbling when nothing else will ; except , of course , the grace of [God]105-god , "[123-mrs. bateson] added [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson piously , " though even that do n't always seem to have much effect , when things go wrong with [their]3428-the men dinners . "[123-mrs. bateson] " That 's because [they]3428-the men have n't enough of it ; [they]3428-the men have n't much grace in [their]3428-the men hearts , as a rule , have n't [men]445-men , even the best of [them]3428-the men ; and the best of [them]3428-the men do n't often come [my]123-mrs. bateson way . But as for [Miss Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , [she]102-elisabeth is n't a regular [Farringdon]30-farringdon , as [you]3430-you may say — not [the real daughter of [the works]353-the works]3431-the real daughter of the works ; and so [she]102-elisabeth should n't take too much upon [herself]102-elisabeth , expecting [dukes]3433-dukes and [ironmasters]3434-ironmasters and [the like]3435-the like to come begging to [her]102-elisabeth on [their]3428-the men bended knees . [She]102-elisabeth is only [[Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth 's adopted daughter]3436-miss farringdon 's adopted daughter , at best ; and [I]123-mrs. bateson do n't hold with [adopted children]3437-adopted children , [I]123-mrs. bateson do n't ; [I]123-mrs. bateson think it is better and more natural to be born of [[your]3430-you own parents]3438-your own parents , like [most folk]3439-most folk are . "[123-mrs. bateson] " So do [I]123-mrs. bateson , "[123-mrs. bateson] agreed [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson ; " [I]123-mrs. bateson 'd never have adopted [a child]3440-a child [myself]123-mrs. bateson . [I]123-mrs. bateson should always have been expecting to see [its parents]3441-its parents ' faults coming out in it — so different from the peace [you]3430-you have with [your]3430-you own flesh and blood . "[123-mrs. bateson] [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey groaned . " [Your]134-mrs. hankey own flesh and blood may take after [[their]3437-adopted children father]361-their father ; [you]134-mrs. hankey never can tell . "[123-mrs. bateson] [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson looked sympathetic . " That 's bad for [you]123-mrs. bateson , [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey ! [You]123-mrs. bateson know what [a feeble creature]3454-a feeble creature [Hankey]134-mrs. hankey is — never doing the right thing ; and , when [he]3454-a feeble creature does , doing it at the wrong time ; well , [Peter]158-peter is just such another . Only the other day [he]158-peter was travelling by rail , and what must [he]158-peter do but get an attack of the toothache ? [Those helpless sort of folks]3455-those helpless sort of folks are always having the toothache , if [you]123-mrs. bateson notice . "[123-mrs. bateson] " So [they]3455-those helpless sort of folks are . "[123-mrs. bateson] " [Peter]158-peter 's toothache was so bad that [he]158-peter must needs take a dose of some sleeping - stuff or other — [I]123-mrs. bateson forget the name — and fell so sound asleep that [he]158-peter never woke at [the station]3456-the station , but was put away with [the carriage]3457-the carriage into [a siding]3458-a siding . "[123-mrs. bateson] " Well , to be sure ! "[123-mrs. bateson] " So it appears , "[134-mrs. hankey] agreed [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey . " Well , there lay [Peter]158-peter fast asleep in [the siding]3461-the siding , with [his]158-peter handkerchief over [his]158-peter face . And [one of [the porters]3463-the porters]3462-one of the porters happens to come by , and sees [him]158-peter , and jumps to the conclusion that there 's been a murder in [the train]3459-the train , and that [[our]3465-our [Peter]158-peter]3466-our peter is the corpse . "[123-mrs. bateson] [Sedgehill High Street]16-sedgehill high street is nothing but a part of the great high road which leads from [Silverhampton]245-lady silverhampton to [Studley]31-studley and [Slipton]32-slipton and [the other towns of [the Black Country]715-the black country]714-the other towns of the black country ; but [it]16-sedgehill high street calls [itself]16-sedgehill high street [Sedgehill High Street]16-sedgehill high street as it passes through [the place]691-the place , and so identifies [itself]16-sedgehill high street with [its]16-sedgehill high street environment , after the manner of caterpillars and polar bears and [other similarly wise and adaptable beings]717-other similarly wise and adaptable beings . At the point where [this road]718-this road adopts the pseudonym of [the High Street]719-the high street , close by [Sedgehill Church]33-sedgehill church , [a lane]720-a lane branches off from [it]16-sedgehill high street at right angles , and runs down a steep slope until [it]16-sedgehill high street comes to a place where [it]16-sedgehill high street evidently experiences a difference of opinion as [to which is the better course to pursue]721-to which is the better course to pursue — an experience not confined to [lanes]722-lanes . But in this respect [lanes]722-lanes are happier than [men]445-men and [women]446-women , in that [they]722-lanes are able to pursue both courses , and so learn for [themselves]722-lanes which is [the wiser one]725-the wiser one , as is the case with [this particular lane]726-this particular lane . One course leads headlong down [another steep hill]727-another steep hill — so steep that [unwary travellers]728-unwary travellers usually descend from [[their]728-unwary travellers carriages]729-their carriages to walk up or down it , and thus are enabled to ensure relief to [their]728-unwary travellers horses and a chill to [themselves]728-unwary travellers at the same time ; for it is hot work walking up or down that sunny precipice , and the cold winds of [Mershire]2-mershire await [one with equal gusto at the top and at the bottom]730-one with equal gusto at the top and at the bottom . At the foot of [the hill]731-the hill stretches [a breezy common]732-a breezy common , wide enough to make [one]543-one think " long , long thoughts "[543-one] ; and if [the traveller]734-the traveller looks backward when [he]734-the traveller has crossed [this common]735-this common , [he]734-the traveller will see [Sedgehill Church]33-sedgehill church , crowning and commanding [the vast expanse]736-the vast expanse , and pointing heavenward with [its]33-sedgehill church slender spire to remind [him]734-the traveller , and [all other wayfaring men]737-all other wayfaring men , that the beauty and glory of [this present world]738-this present world is only an earnest and a foretaste of something infinitely fairer . [The second course of [the irresolute lane]740-the irresolute lane]739-the second course of the irresolute lane is less adventurous , and wanders peacefully through [Badgering Woods]741-badgering woods , [a dark and delightful spot]742-a dark and delightful spot , once mysterious enough to be a fitting hiding - place for the age - long slumbers of [some sleeping princess]743-some sleeping princess . As a matter of fact , so it was ; [the princess]744-the princess was black but comely , and [her]744-the princess name was [Coal]159-coal . [There]658-there [she]744-the princess had slept for a century of centuries , until [Prince Iron]160-prince iron needed and sought and found [her]744-the princess , and awakened [her]744-the princess with the noise of [his]160-prince iron kisses . So now [the wood]746-the wood is not asleep any more , but is filled with the tramping of [[the prince]747-the prince 's men]748-the prince 's men . [The old people]749-the old people wring [their]749-the old people hands and mourn that the former things are passing away , and that [Mershire]2-mershire 's youthful beauty will soon be forgotten ; but [the young people]750-the young people laugh and are glad , because [they]750-the young people know that life is greater than beauty , and that it is by [[her]744-the princess black coalfields]751-her black coalfields , and not by [[her]744-the princess green woodlands]752-her green woodlands , that [Mershire]2-mershire will save [[her]744-the princess people]753-her people from poverty , and will satisfy [her]744-the princess poor with bread . When [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth was [a girl]3047-a girl , [the princess]744-the princess was still asleep in [the heart of the wood]756-the heart of the wood , and [no prince]757-no prince had yet attempted to disturb [her]102-elisabeth ; and [the lane]758-the lane passed through [a forest of silence]759-a forest of silence until it came to [a dear little brown stream]760-a dear little brown stream , which , by means of a dam , was turned into a moat , encircling one of [the most ancient houses in [England]3-england]761-the most ancient houses in england . [The Moat House]762-the moat house had been vacant for some time , as [the owner]763-the owner was [a delicate man who preferred to live abroad]764-a delicate man who preferred to live abroad ; and great was the interest at [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill when , a year or two after [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth left [school]2997-school , it was reported that [a stranger]766-a stranger , [Alan Tremaine]161-alan by name , had taken [the Moat House]34-the moat house for the sake of the hunting , which was very good in [that part of [Mershire]2-mershire]767-that part of mershire . So [Alan]161-alan settled [there]658-there , and became one of the items which went to the making of [[Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's world]769-elisabeth 's world . "[524-the latter] " Then [I]524-the latter could n't have taught [them]3519-them . "[524-the latter] " But [you]524-the latter did ; that is where [your]524-the latter genius comes in . "[524-the latter] " [I]162-elisabeth really am tremendously quick in judging character , "[162-elisabeth] repeated [Elisabeth]162-elisabeth thoughtfully ; " if [I]162-elisabeth met [you]162-elisabeth for the first time [I]162-elisabeth should know in five minutes that [you]162-elisabeth were [a man with plenty of head , and heaps of soul , and very little heart]3520-a man with plenty of head , and heaps of soul , and very little heart . "[162-elisabeth] " That would show wonderful penetration on [your]162-elisabeth part . "[524-the latter] " [You]162-elisabeth may laugh , but [I]524-the latter should . "[524-the latter] " Exactly ; it would only be distinctly careless of [you]162-elisabeth if [you]162-elisabeth did not . "[524-the latter] " Of course it would ; but [I]524-the latter do . [I]524-the latter could draw a map of [your]162-elisabeth mind with [my]524-the latter eyes shut , [I]524-the latter know it so well . "[524-the latter] " [I]524-the latter wish [you]162-elisabeth would . [I]524-the latter should value it even if it were drawn with [your]162-elisabeth eyes open , though possibly in that case it might be less correct . "[524-the latter] " [I]524-the latter will , if [you]162-elisabeth will give [me]524-the latter a pencil and a sheet of paper . "[524-the latter] [Christopher]162-elisabeth produced a pencil , and tore a half - sheet off a note that [he]781-he had in [his]781-he pocket . [The two]340-the two were walking through the wood at [the Willows]328-the willows at that moment , and [Elisabeth straightway]162-elisabeth sat down upon a felled tree that happened to be lying there , and began to draw . [The young man]784-the young man watched [her]162-elisabeth with amusement . " An extensive outline , "[784-the young man] [he]784-the young man remarked ; " this is gratifying . "[784-the young man] " Oh yes ! [you]162-elisabeth have plenty of mind , such as it is ; [nobody]409-nobody could deny that . "[784-the young man] " But why is [the coast - line]3522-the coast - line all irregular , with such a lot of bays and capes and headlands ? "[784-the young man] " To show that [you]162-elisabeth are [an undecided person]3523-an undecided person , and given to split hairs , and do n't always know [your]162-elisabeth own opinion . First [you]162-elisabeth think [you]162-elisabeth 'll do a thing because it is nice ; and then [you]162-elisabeth think [you]162-elisabeth wo n't do it because it is wrong ; and in the end [you]162-elisabeth drop between two stools , like [Mahomet]164-mahomet 's coffin . "[784-the young man] " [I]784-the young man see . And please what are the mountain - ranges that [you]162-elisabeth are drawing now ? "[784-the young man] " These , "[162-elisabeth] replied [Elisabeth]162-elisabeth , covering [her]162-elisabeth map with herring - bones , " are [your]784-the young man scruples . Like [all other mountain - ranges]3524-all other mountain - ranges they hinder commerce , make pleasure difficult , and render life generally rather uphill work . "[162-elisabeth] " Do n't [I]784-the young man sound exactly as if [I]784-the young man was taking a geography class ? "[784-the young man] " Or conducting an Inquisition , "[162-elisabeth] added [Christopher]162-elisabeth . " [I]162-elisabeth thought an Inquisition was a Spanish thing that hurt . "[162-elisabeth] " So [certain ignorant people]3525-certain ignorant people say ; but it was originally invented , [I]784-the young man believe , to eradicate error and to maintain truth . "[784-the young man] " [I]784-the young man am going on with [my]784-the young man geography class , so do n't interrupt . These represent [your]784-the young man feelings . "[784-the young man] " Very ingenious of [you]162-elisabeth ! And what is that enormous blotch right in [the middle of [the country]3528-the country]3529-the middle of the country , which looks like [London]15-london and [[its]15-london environs]3531-its environs ? "[162-elisabeth] " That is [your]784-the young man conscience ; [[its]15-london outlying suburbs]3532-its outlying suburbs cover nearly [the whole country]3533-the whole country , [you]784-the young man will perceive . But finally [he]790-his had submitted contentedly to the inevitable , because — in spite of all [his]790-his hopes and ambitions — [his]790-his boyish love for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth held [him]790-his fast ; and now [his]790-his manly love for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth held [him]790-his faster still . But even the chains which love had rivetted are capable of galling [us]793-we sometimes ; and although [we]793-we would not break them , even if [we]793-we could , [we]793-we grumble at them occasionally — that is to say , if [we]793-we are merely human , as is the case with so many of [us]793-we . " It is a great pity , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth went on , " that [you]3551-you deliberately narrow [yourself]3551-you down to such a small world and such petty interests . " [You]3551-you laugh at [me]797-the preacher as long as [I]797-the preacher am funny and [I]797-the preacher amuse [you]3551-you ; but the minute [I]797-the preacher begin to talk about serious subjects — such as feelings and sentiments and emotions — [you]3551-you lose [your]3551-you interest at once , and turn everything into a joke . " [Elisabeth]162-elisabeth laughed again as [she]162-elisabeth patted [his]803-nice old boy arm in a sisterly fashion . "[803-nice old boy] [Nice old boy]803-nice old boy !
