" And [he]121-christopher turned on [his]121-christopher heel and left [her]102-elisabeth . As [she]102-elisabeth watched [his]121-christopher retreating figure , one spasm of remorse shot through [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's heart ; but it was speedily stifled by the recollection that , for the first time in [her]102-elisabeth life , [Christopher]121-christopher had failed [her]102-elisabeth , and had shown [her]102-elisabeth plainly that there were , in [his]121-christopher eyes , more important matters than [Miss Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth and [her]102-elisabeth whims and fancies . And what [woman]669-woman , worthy of the name , could extend mercy to [a man who had openly displayed so flagrant a want of taste and discernment as this]4076-a man who had openly displayed so flagrant a want of taste and discernment as this ? Certainly not [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , nor any other fashioned after [her]102-elisabeth pattern . [She]102-elisabeth felt that [she]102-elisabeth had as much right to be angry as had [the prophet]4077-the prophet , when [Almighty Wisdom]219-almighty wisdom saw fit to save [the great city in which [he]121-christopher was not particularly interested , and to destroy the gourd in which [he]121-christopher was]4078-the great city in which he was not particularly interested , and to destroy the gourd in which he was . And so , probably , [she]102-elisabeth had . For several days after this [she]102-elisabeth kept clear of [Christopher]121-christopher , nursing [her]102-elisabeth anger in [her]102-elisabeth heart ; and [he]121-christopher was so hurt and sore from the lashing which [her]102-elisabeth tongue had given [him]121-christopher , that [he]121-christopher felt no inclination to come within the radius of that tongue 's bitterness again . But one day , when [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was sitting on the floor of [the Moat House drawing - room]4079-the moat house drawing - room , playing with [the baby]4033-the baby and discussing new gowns with [Felicia]154-felicia between times , [Alan]161-alan came in and remarked — "[0-i] It was wise of [you]1874-you to give up [your]1874-you excursion to [Coulson 's circus]1858-coulson 's circus last week , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ; as it has turned out it was chiefly a scare , and the case was greatly exaggerated ; but it might have made [you]1874-you feel uncomfortable if [you]1874-you had gone . [I]0-i suppose [you]1874-you saw the notice of the outbreak in that morning 's paper , and so gave it up at the last moment . " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ceased from [her]102-elisabeth free translation of [the baby]4033-the baby 's gurglings and [her]102-elisabeth laudable endeavours suitably to reply to the same , and gave [her]102-elisabeth whole attention to [[the baby]4033-the baby 's father]4083-the baby 's father . "[1874-you] [I]0-i do n't know what [you]0-i mean . What scare and what outbreak are [you]0-i talking about ? " "[0-i] Did n't [you]1874-you see , " replied [Alan]161-alan , "[1874-you] that there was an outbreak of cholera at [[Coulson]218-coulson 's circus]1858-coulson 's circus , and a frightful scare all through [Burlingham]62-burlingham in consequence ? Of course the newspapers greatly exaggerated the danger , and so increased the scare ; and [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i blame [them]1877-them for that . [I]0-i am not sure that the sensational way in which the press announces possible dangers to [the community]1878-the community is not a safeguard for [the community at large]1879-the community at large . To be alive to a danger is nine times out of ten to avoid a danger ; and it is far better to be more frightened than hurt than to be more hurt than frightened — certainly for [communities]1880-communities if not for [individuals]1881-individuals . " "[0-i] But tell [me]0-i about it . [I]0-i never saw any account in the papers ; and [I]0-i 'm glad [I]0-i did n't , for it would have frightened [me]0-i out of [my]0-i wits . " "[0-i] It broke out among [a troupe of acrobats who had just come straight from [the South of [France]60-france]4058-the south of france]1882-a troupe of acrobats who had just come straight from the south of france , and evidently brought the infection with [them]1882-a troupe of acrobats who had just come straight from the south of france . [They]1882-a troupe of acrobats who had just come straight from the south of france were at once isolated , and such prompt and efficient measures were taken to prevent the spread of the disease , that there have been no more cases , either in [the circus]1884-the circus or in [the town]314-the town . Now , [I]0-i should imagine , all danger of its spreading is practically over ; but , of course , it made [everybody in the neighbourhood]1886-everybody in the neighbourhood , and [everybody who had been to the circus]1887-everybody who had been to the circus , very nervous and uncomfortable for a few days . [The local authorities]1888-the local authorities , however , omitted no possible precaution which should assist [them]1888-the local authorities in stamping out the epidemic , should those few cases have started an epidemic — which was , of course , possible , though hardly likely . " And then [Alan]161-alan proceeded to expound [his]161-alan views on the matter of sanitary authorities in general and of those of [Burlingham]62-burlingham in particular , to which [Felicia]154-felicia listened with absorbing attention and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth did not listen at all . Soon after this [she]154-felicia took [her]154-felicia leave ; and all along the homeward walk through [Badgering Woods]47-badgering woods [she]154-felicia was conscious of feeling ashamed of [herself]154-felicia — a very rare sensation with [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , and by no means an agreeable one . [She]154-felicia was by nature so self - reliant and so irresponsible that [she]154-felicia seldom regretted anything that [she]154-felicia had done ; if [she]154-felicia had acted wisely , all was well ; and if [she]154-felicia had not acted wisely , it was over and done with , and what was the use of bothering any more about it ? This was [her]154-felicia usual point of view , and it proved as a rule a most comfortable one . But now [she]154-felicia could not fail to see that [she]154-felicia had been in the wrong — hopelessly and flagrantly in the wrong — and that [she]154-felicia had behaved abominably to [Christopher]121-christopher into the bargain . [She]154-felicia had to climb down , as [other ruling powers]4084-other ruling powers have had to climb down before now ; and the act of climbing down is neither a becoming nor an exhilarating form of exercise to [ruling powers]4085-ruling powers . But at the back of [her]154-felicia humble contrition there was a feeling of gladness in the knowledge that [Christopher]121-christopher had not really failed [her]154-felicia after all , and that [[her]154-felicia kingdom]4086-her kingdom was still [her]154-felicia own as it had been in [her]154-felicia childish days ; and there was also a nobler feeling of higher joy in the consciousness that — quite apart from [his]121-christopher attitude toward [her]154-felicia — [Christopher]121-christopher was still [the Christopher that [she]154-felicia had always in [her]154-felicia inmost soul]4087-the christopher that she had always in her inmost soul believed [him]121-christopher to be ; that [she]154-felicia was not wrong in the idea [she]154-felicia had formed of [him]121-christopher long ago . It is very human to be glad on [our]4088-us own account when [people]2982-people are as fond of [us]4088-us as [we]4088-us expected [them]2982-people to be ; but it is divine to be glad , solely for [their]2982-people sakes , when [they]2982-people act up to [their]2982-people own ideals , quite apart from [us]4088-us . And there was a touch of divinity in [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's gladness just then , though the rest of [her]102-elisabeth was extremely human — and feminine at that . On [her]154-felicia way [home]399-home [she]154-felicia encountered [Caleb Bateson]127-caleb going back to work after dinner , and [she]154-felicia told [him]127-caleb to ask [Mr. Thornley]199-felicia to come up to [the Willows]8-the willows that afternoon , as [she]154-felicia wanted to see [him]127-caleb . [She]154-felicia preferred to send a verbal message , as by so doing [she]154-felicia postponed for a few hours that climbing - down process which [she]154-felicia so much disliked ; although it is frequently easier to climb down by means of one 's pen than by means of [one]543-one 's tongue . [Christopher]121-christopher felt no pleasure in receiving [her]154-felicia message . [He]121-christopher was not angry with [her]154-felicia , although [he]121-christopher marvelled at the unreasonableness and injustice of a sex that thinks more of a day 's pleasure than a life 's devotion ; [he]121-christopher did not know that it was over the life 's devotion and not the day 's pleasure that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had fought so hard that day ; but [his]121-christopher encounter with [her]154-felicia had strangely tired [him]121-christopher , and taken the zest out of [his]121-christopher life , and [he]121-christopher had no appetite for any more of such disastrous and inglorious warfare . But [he]121-christopher obeyed [her]154-felicia mandate all the same , having learned the important political lesson that the fact of [a Government]4092-a government 's being in the wrong is no excuse for not obeying the orders of [that Government]4093-that government ; and [he]121-christopher waited for [her]154-felicia in [the drawing - room at [the Willows]328-the willows]4094-the drawing - room at the willows , looking out toward the sunset and wondering how hard upon [him]121-christopher [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was going to be . And [his]121-christopher thoughts were so full of [her]154-felicia that [he]121-christopher did not hear [her]154-felicia come into [the room]3736-the room until [she]154-felicia clasped both [her]154-felicia hands round [his]121-christopher arm and looked up into [his]121-christopher gloomy face , saying — "[125-chris] Oh ! [Chris]125-chris , [I]0-i 'm so dreadfully ashamed of [myself]0-i . " The clouds were dispelled at once , and [Christopher]121-christopher smiled as [he]121-christopher had not smiled for a week . "[0-i] Never mind , " [he]121-christopher said , patting the hands that were on [his]121-christopher arm ; "[0-i] it 's all right . " But [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , having set out upon the descent , was prepared to climb down handsomely . "[0-i] It is n't all right ; it 's all wrong . [I]0-i was simply fiendish to [you]125-chris , and [I]0-i shall never forgive [myself]0-i — never . " "[125-chris] Oh , yes ; [you]125-chris will . And for goodness ' sake do n't worry over it . [I]0-i 'm glad [you]125-chris have found out that [I]0-i was n't quite the selfish brute that [I]0-i seemed ; and that 's the end of the matter . " "[0-i] Dear [me]0-i ! no ; it is n't . It is only the beginning . [I]0-i want to tell [you]125-chris how dreadfully sorry [I]0-i am , and to ask [you]125-chris to forgive [me]0-i . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 've nothing to forgive . " "[0-i] Yes , [you]125-chris have ; lots . " And [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was nearer the mark than [Christopher]121-christopher . "[0-i] [I]0-i have n't . Of course [you]125-chris were angry with [me]0-i when [I]0-i seemed so disagreeable and unkind ; [any girl]1889-any girl would have been , " replied [Chris]125-chris , forgetting how very unreasonable [her]102-elisabeth anger had seemed only five minutes ago . But five minutes can make such a difference — sometimes . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth cheerfully caught at this straw of comfort ; [she]102-elisabeth was always ready to take a lenient view of [her]102-elisabeth own shortcomings . If [Christopher]121-christopher had been wise [he]121-christopher would not have encouraged such leniency ; but who is wise and in love at the same time ? "[125-chris] Of course it did seem rather unkind of [you]125-chris , " [she]102-elisabeth admitted ; "[125-chris] [you]125-chris see , [I]0-i thought [you]125-chris had thrown [me]0-i over just for the sake of some tiresome business arrangement , and that [you]125-chris did n't care about [me]0-i and [my]0-i disappointment a bit . " To [Christopher]121-christopher remorse for wrong done would always be an agony ; [he]125-chris had yet to learn that to some temperaments , whereof [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's was one , it partook of the nature of a luxury — the sort of luxury which tempts one to pay half a guinea to be allowed to swell up one 's eyes and redden [one]543-one 's nose over imaginary woes in [a [London]15-london theatre]4099-a london theatre . "[125-chris] Did [you]125-chris mind very much when [I]0-i was so cross ? " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth asked thoughtfully . " During the following winter [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth gave unmistakable signs of that process known as "[0-i] breaking - up . " [She]102-elisabeth had fought a good fight for many years , and the time was fast coming for [her]102-elisabeth to lay down [her]102-elisabeth arms and receive [her]102-elisabeth reward . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , with [her]102-elisabeth usual light - heartedness , did not see the Shadow stealing nearer day by day ; but [Christopher]121-christopher was more accustomed to shadows than [she]102-elisabeth was — [his]121-christopher path had lain chiefly among them — and [he]121-christopher knew what was coming , and longed passionately and in vain to shield [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth from the inevitable . [He]121-christopher had played the part of [Providence]136-providence to [her]102-elisabeth in one matter : [he]121-christopher had stood between [her]102-elisabeth and [himself]121-christopher , and had prevented [her]102-elisabeth from drinking of that mingled cup of sweetness and bitterness which [men]445-men call Love , thinking that [she]102-elisabeth would be [a happier woman]4102-a happier woman if [she]102-elisabeth left untasted the only form of the beverage which [he]121-christopher was able to offer [her]102-elisabeth . And possibly [he]121-christopher was right ; that [she]102-elisabeth would be also [a better woman]4103-a better woman in consequence , was quite another and more doubtful side of the question . But now the part of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's Providence was no longer cast for [Christopher]121-christopher to play ; [he]121-christopher might prevent Love with [his]121-christopher sorrows from coming nigh [[her]102-elisabeth dwelling]4104-her dwelling , but [Death]220-death defied [his]121-christopher protecting arm . It was good for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth to be afflicted , although [Christopher]121-christopher would willingly have died to save [her]102-elisabeth a moment 's pain ; and it is a blessed thing for [us]4105-us after all that Perfect Wisdom and Almighty Power are one . As usual [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was so busy straining [her]102-elisabeth eyes after the ideal that [the real]4106-the real escaped [her]102-elisabeth notice ; and it was therefore a great shock to [her]102-elisabeth when [[her]102-elisabeth Cousin]451-her cousin [Maria]100-cousin maria went to sleep one night in [a land whose stones are of iron]4108-a land whose stones are of iron , and awoke next morning in [a country]4109-a country whose pavements are of gold . For a time [the girl]629-the girl was completely stunned by the blow ; and during that period [Christopher]121-christopher was very good to [her]102-elisabeth . Afterward — when [he]121-christopher and [she]102-elisabeth had drifted far apart — [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth sometimes recalled [Christopher]121-christopher 's sheltering care during the first dark days of [her]102-elisabeth loneliness ; and [she]102-elisabeth never did so without remembering the words , "[0-i] As [the mountains]3846-the mountains are round about [Jerusalem]64-jerusalem " ; they seemed to express all that [he]121-christopher was to [her]102-elisabeth just then . When [Maria Farringdon]101-maria farringdon 's will was read , it was found that [she]101-maria farringdon had left to [[her]101-maria farringdon cousin]451-her cousin and [adopted daughter]4112-adopted daughter , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , an annuity of five hundred a year ; also the income from [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth and [the Willows]328-the willows until such time as [the real owner of [these estates]4115-these estates]4114-the real owner of these estates should be found . The rest of [[her]101-maria farringdon property]4116-her property — together with [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth and [the Willows]8-the willows — [she]101-maria farringdon bequeathed upon trust for [the eldest living son]4117-the eldest living son , if any , of [[her]101-maria farringdon late cousin]4118-her late cousin [George Farringdon]99-george farringdon ; and [she]101-maria farringdon appointed [Richard Smallwood]104-richard smallwood and [[his]104-richard smallwood nephew]4001-his nephew to be [[her]101-maria farringdon trustees]4120-her trustees and [executors]4121-executors . [The trustees]4122-the trustees were required to ascertain whether [George Farringdon]99-george farringdon had left [any son]4123-any son , and whether [that son]4124-that son was still alive ; but if , at the expiration of ten years from the death of [the testator]4125-the testator , [no such son]4126-no such son could be discovered , the whole of [[Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth 's estate]4127-miss farringdon 's estate was to become the absolute property of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . " "[1948-it] [It]1948-it 's having been engaged to [Mr. George]157-mr. george all [them]1949-them years ago that set [her]102-elisabeth up to it . "[3106-folks] Well , that beats [me]0-i , [I]0-i 'm fain to confess . ' And so it did . " On the afternoon of that very Sunday [Christopher]135-christopher took [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth for a walk in [Badgering Woods]47-badgering woods . The winter was departing , and a faint pink flush on the bare trees heralded the coming of spring ; and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , being made of material which is warranted not to fret for long , began to feel that life was not altogether dark , and that it was just possible [she]102-elisabeth might — at the end of many years — actually enjoy things again . Further , [Christopher]135-christopher suited [her]102-elisabeth perfectly — how perfectly [she]102-elisabeth did not know as yet — and [she]102-elisabeth spent much time with [him]135-christopher just then . Those of [us]4134-we who have ever guessed [the acrostics in a weekly paper]4135-the acrostics in a weekly paper , have learned that sometimes [we]4134-we find a solution to one of the lights , and say , "[0-i] This will do , if nothing better turns up before post - time on Monday " ; and at other times [we]4134-we chance upon an answer which [we]4134-we know at once , without further research , to be indisputably the right one . It is so with other things than acrostics : there are friends whom [we]4134-we feel will do very well for [us]4134-we if [nobody]409-nobody — or until [somebody — better turns up]4137-somebody — better turns up ; and there are [others whom [we]4134-we know to be just [the right people]4139-the right people for the particular needs of [our]4134-we souls]4138-others whom we know to be just the right people for the particular needs of our souls at that time . [They]4140-they are the right answers to the questions which have been perplexing [us]4134-we — the correct solutions to the problems over which [we]4134-we have been puzzling [our]4134-we brains . So it was with [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth : [Christopher]135-christopher was the correct answer to life 's current acrostic ; and as long as [she]102-elisabeth was with [Christopher]135-christopher [she]102-elisabeth was content . "[1967-you] Do n't [you]1967-you get very tired of [people who have never found the fourth dimension]1968-people who have never found the fourth dimension ? " [she]102-elisabeth asked [him]135-christopher , as [they]4141-they sat upon a stile in [Badgering Woods]47-badgering woods . "[1967-you] What do [you]1967-you mean by the fourth dimension ? There are length and breadth and thickness , and what comes next ? " [Christopher]135-christopher was pleased to find [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth facing life 's abstract problems again ; it proved that [she]102-elisabeth was no longer overpowered by its concrete ones . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what its name is , " [she]102-elisabeth replied , looking dreamily through the leafless trees ; "[0-i] perhaps eternity would do as well as any other . But [I]0-i mean the dimension which comes after length and breadth and thickness , and beyond them , and all round them , and which makes them seem quite different , and much less important . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i know what [you]1967-you are driving at . [You]1967-you mean a new way of looking at things and of measuring them — a way which makes things which [ordinary people]941-ordinary people call small , large ; and things which [ordinary people]941-ordinary people call large , small . " "[1967-you] Yes . [People who have never been in the fourth dimension]1971-people who have never been in the fourth dimension bore [me]0-i , do [you]1967-you know ? [I]0-i daresay it would bore squares to talk to straight lines , and cubes to talk to squares ; there would be so many things [the one]1343-the one would understand and the other would n't . The line would n't know what the square meant by the word across , and [the square]1973-the square would n't know what the cube meant by the word above ; and in the same way [the three - dimension people]1974-the three - dimension people do n't know what [we]1975-we are talking about when [we]1975-we use such words as religion and art and love . " "[1974-the three - dimension people] [They]1974-the three - dimension people think [we]1975-we are talking about going regularly to [church]1322-church , and supporting picture - galleries , and making brilliant matches , " suggested [Christopher]135-christopher . "[1974-the three - dimension people] Yes ; that 's exactly what [they]1974-the three - dimension people do think ; and it makes talking to [them]1974-the three - dimension people so difficult , and so dull . " "[1974-the three - dimension people] When [you]1967-you use the word happiness [they]1974-the three - dimension people imagine [you]1967-you are referring to an income of four or five thousand a year ; and by success [they]1974-the three - dimension people mean the permission to stand in the backwater of a fashionable [London]15-london evening party , looking at [the mighty and noble]1977-the mighty and noble , and pretending afterward that [they]1974-the three - dimension people have spoken to the same . " "[1974-the three - dimension people] [They]1974-the three - dimension people do n't speak [our]1975-we language or think [our]1975-we thoughts , " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth said ; "[1974-the three - dimension people] and the music of [their]1974-the three - dimension people whole lives is of a different order from that of the lives of [the fourth - dimension people]1978-the fourth - dimension people . " "[1974-the three - dimension people] Distinctly so ; all the difference between a Sonata of [Beethoven]225-beethoven and a song out of a pantomime . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have n't much patience with [the three - dimension people]1974-the three - dimension people ; have [you]1980-you ? " asked [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . "[1980-you] No — [I'm]0-i afraid not ; but [I]0-i 've a good deal of pity for [them]1974-the three - dimension people . [They]1974-the three - dimension people miss so much . [I]0-i always fancy that [people who call pictures pretty and music sweet]1981-people who call pictures pretty and music sweet must have a dreary time of it all round . But [we]1975-we 'd better be getting on , do n't [you]1980-you think ? It is rather chilly sitting out - of - doors , and [I]0-i do n't want [you]1980-you to catch cold . " And while [he]0-i turned up the fur collar of [her]1980-you coat and hooked the highest hook and eye , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth thought how nice it was to be petted and taken care of ; and as [she]1980-you walked homeward by [Christopher]135-christopher 's side , [she]1980-you felt like [a good little girl]4142-a good little girl again . [Even reigning monarchs]4143-even reigning monarchs now and then like to have [their]4143-even reigning monarchs ermine tucked round [them]4143-even reigning monarchs , and to be patted on [their]4143-even reigning monarchs crowns by a protecting hand . As the weeks rolled on and the spring drew nearer , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth gradually took up the thread of human interest again . Fortunately for [her]102-elisabeth [she]102-elisabeth was very busy with plans for the benefit of [the work - people at [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth]4144-the work - people at the osierfield . [She]102-elisabeth started [a dispensary]4145-a dispensary ; [she]102-elisabeth opened [an institute]4146-an institute ; [she]102-elisabeth inaugurated courses of lectures and entertainments for keeping [the young men]4147-the young men out of [the public - houses]4148-the public - houses in the evenings ; [she]102-elisabeth gave to [the Wesleyan Conference]226-the wesleyan conference [a House of Rest]4149-a house of rest — [a sweet little house , looking over [the fields]3328-the fields toward the sunset — where [tired ministers]4152-tired ministers might come and live at ease for a time to regain health and strength]4150-a sweet little house , looking over the fields toward the sunset — where tired ministers might come and live at ease for a time to regain health and strength ; and in [Sedgehill Church]4153-sedgehill church [she]102-elisabeth put up a beautiful east window to the memory of [Maria Farringdon]101-maria farringdon , and for a sign - post to [all such pilgrims as were in need of one]4154-all such pilgrims as were in need of one , as the east window in [St. Peter 's]203-st. peter had once been a sign - post to [herself]102-elisabeth showing [her]102-elisabeth the way to [Zion]66-zion . In all these undertakings [Christopher]135-christopher was [her]102-elisabeth right hand ; and while [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth planned and paid for them , [he]135-christopher carefully carried them out — the hardest part of the business , and the least effective one . When [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had set afoot all these improvements for the benefit of [[her]102-elisabeth work - people]4155-her work - people , [she]102-elisabeth turned [her]102-elisabeth attention to the improving of [herself]102-elisabeth ; and [she]102-elisabeth informed [Christopher]135-christopher that [she]102-elisabeth had decided to go up to [London]15-london , and fulfil the desire of [her]102-elisabeth heart by studying art at [the Slade School]67-the slade school . " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth grew rather pale ; that there would ever come a day when [Christopher]135-christopher would not be there to fall back upon was a contingency which until now had never occurred to [her]102-elisabeth . "[0-i] To see if [I]0-i can find [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son , of course . " "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [he]1997-george farringdon 's son had been advertised for in both English and Australian papers , and had failed to answer the advertisements . " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's lip trembled ; [she]102-elisabeth felt that a hemisphere uninhabited by [Christopher]135-christopher would be a very dreary hemisphere indeed . "[0-i] Oh ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want to go , [Betty]102-elisabeth ; [I]0-i hate the mere idea of going . [I]0-i 'd give a thousand pounds , if [I]0-i could , to stop away . " "[102-elisabeth] Oh ! [Chris]125-chris , do n't go . [I]0-i ca n't spare [you]125-chris . " And [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth stretched out two pleading hands toward [him]125-chris . "[0-i] [I]0-i say , [Betty]102-elisabeth , please do n't cry , " and [his]125-chris voice shook ; "[0-i] it makes it so much harder for [me]0-i ; and it is hard enough as it is — confoundedly hard ! " "[0-i] Then why do it ? " "[0-i] Because [I]0-i must . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see that ; it is pure Quixotism . " "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to goodness [I]0-i could think that ; but [I]0-i ca n't . It appears to [me]0-i a question about which there could not be two opinions . " The tears dried on [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's lashes . The old feeling of being at war with [Christopher]135-christopher , which had laid dormant for so long , now woke up again in [her]102-elisabeth heart , and inclined [her]102-elisabeth to defy rather than to plead . If [he]125-chris cared for duty more than for [her]102-elisabeth , [he]125-chris did not care for [her]102-elisabeth much , [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth ; and [she]102-elisabeth was far too proud [a woman]469-a woman ever to care for [a man]310-a man — even in the way of friendship — who obviously did not care for [her]102-elisabeth . Still , [she]102-elisabeth condescended to further argument . "[2004-you] If [you]2004-you really liked [me]0-i and were [[my]0-i friend]2005-my friend , " [she]102-elisabeth said , "[2004-you] not only would n't [you]2004-you wish to go away and leave [me]0-i , but [you]2004-you would want [me]0-i to have the money , instead of rushing all over [the world]301-the world in order to give it to [some tiresome young man [you]2004-you 'd never heard of six months ago]2007-some tiresome young man you 'd never heard of six months ago . " "[2004-you] Do n't [you]2004-you understand that it is just because [I]0-i like [you]2004-you and am [[your]2004-you friend]813-your friend , that [I]0-i ca n't bear [you]2004-you to profit by anything which has a shade of dishonour connected with it ? [They]2009-bugbears bored [me]0-i as [a child]3440-a child , and [they]2009-bugbears bore [me]0-i now . " [Christopher]135-christopher winced ; the nightmare of [his]135-christopher life had been the terror of boring [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , for [he]135-christopher was wise enough to know that [a woman]469-a woman may love [a man with whom [she]469-a woman is angry , but never one by whom [she]469-a woman is bored]4160-a man with whom she is angry , but never one by whom she is bored . "[2009-bugbears] It is just like [you]2004-you , " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth continued , tossing [her]102-elisabeth head , "[2004-you] to be so busy saving [your]2004-you own soul and laying up for [yourself]2004-you a nice little nest - egg in [heaven]415-heaven , that [you]2004-you have n't time to consider [other people]2980-other people and [their]2980-other people interests and feelings . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]2013-you do [me]0-i an injustice , " replied [Christopher]135-christopher quietly . [He]135-christopher was puzzled to find [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth so bitter against [him]135-christopher on a mere question of money , as [she]102-elisabeth was usually [a most unworldly young person]4161-a most unworldly young person ; again [he]135-christopher did not understand that [she]102-elisabeth was not really fighting over the matter at issue , but over the fact that [he]135-christopher had put something before [his]135-christopher friendship for [her]102-elisabeth . Once [she]102-elisabeth had quarrelled with [him]135-christopher because [he]135-christopher seemed to think more of [his]135-christopher business than of [her]102-elisabeth ; now [she]102-elisabeth was quarrelling with [him]135-christopher because [he]135-christopher thought more of [his]135-christopher duty than of [her]102-elisabeth ; for the truth that [he]135-christopher could not have loved [her]102-elisabeth so much had [he]135-christopher not loved honour more , had not as yet been revealed to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . "[2013-you] [I]0-i do n't want to be money - grubbing , " [she]102-elisabeth went on , "[2013-you] or to cling on to things to which [I]0-i have no right ; though , of course , it will be rather poor fun for [me]0-i to have to give up all this , " and [she]102-elisabeth waved [her]102-elisabeth hand in a sweep , supposed to include [the Willows]8-the willows and [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth and all that appertained thereto , "[2013-you] and to drudge along at the rate of five hundred a year , with yesterday 's dinner and last year 's dress warmed up again to feed and clothe [me]0-i . But [I]0-i ask [you]2014-you to consider whether [the work - people at [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth]4144-the work - people at the osierfield are n't happier under [my]0-i régime , than under the rule of [some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself income upon [himself]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself , and go to the dogs as [[his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself father]338-his father did before [him]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself . " [Christopher]135-christopher was cut to the quick ; [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had hit the nail on the head . After all , it was not [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself own interests that [he]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself felt bound to sacrifice to the claims of honour , but [hers]102-elisabeth ; and it was this consideration that made [him]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself feel the sacrifice almost beyond [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself power . [He]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself knew that it was [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself duty to do everything [he]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself could to fulfil the conditions of [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth 's will ; [he]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself also knew that [he]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself was compelled to do this at [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's expense and not at [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself own ; and the twofold knowledge well - nigh broke [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself heart . [His]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself misery was augmented by [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself perception of how completely [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth misunderstood [him]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself , and of how little of the truth all those years of silent devotion had conveyed to [her]102-elisabeth mind ; and [his]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself face was white with pain as [he]2016-some good - for - nothing young man , who will probably spend all his income upon himself answered — "[2018-you] There is no need for [you]2018-you to say such things as that to [me]0-i , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ; [you]2018-you know as well as [I]0-i do that [I]0-i would give [my]0-i life to save [you]2018-you from sorrow and to ensure [your]2018-you happiness ; but [I]0-i can not be guilty of a shabby trick even for this . Ca n't [you]2018-you see that the very fact that [I]0-i care for [you]2018-you so much , makes it all the more impossible for [me]0-i to do anything shady in [your]2018-you name ? " "[0-i] Bosh ! " rudely exclaimed [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . "[0-i] As for [the work - people]1681-the work - people , " [he]0-i went on , ignoring [her]102-elisabeth interruption , "[0-i] of course [no one]3126-no one will ever do as much for [them]1681-the work - people as [you]2018-you are doing . But that is n't the question . The fact that [one man]2021-one man would make a better use of money than [another]2022-another would n't justify [me]0-i in robbing [Peter]203-st. peter to increase [Paul]129-saint paul 's munificence . Now would it ? " "[203-st. peter] That 's perfectly different . It is all right for [you]2018-you to go on advertising for [that Farringdon man]2023-that farringdon man in agony columns , and [I]0-i should n't be so silly as to make a fuss about giving up the money if [he]2023-that farringdon man turned up . [You]2018-you know that well enough . But it does seem to [me]0-i to be over - conscientious and hyper - disagreeable on [your]2018-you part to go off to [Australia]10-australia — just when [I]0-i am so lonely and want [you]2018-you so much — in search of [the man who is to turn [me]0-i out of [[my]0-i kingdom]2025-my kingdom and reign in [my]0-i stead]2024-the man who is to turn me out of my kingdom and reign in my stead . [I]0-i ca n't think how [you]2018-you can want to do such a thing ! " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was fighting desperately hard ; the full power of [her]102-elisabeth strong will was bent upon making [Christopher]135-christopher do what [she]102-elisabeth wished and stay with [her]102-elisabeth in [England]3-england ; not only because [she]102-elisabeth needed [him]135-christopher , but because [she]102-elisabeth felt that this was a [Hastings]70-hastings or [Waterloo]71-waterloo between [them]4162-them , and that if [she]102-elisabeth lost this battle , [her]102-elisabeth ancient supremacy was gone forever . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want to go and do it , heaven knows ! [I]0-i hate and loathe doing anything which [you]2018-you do n't wish [me]0-i to do . But there is no question of wanting in the matter , as far as [I]0-i can see . It is a simple question between right and wrong — between honour and dishonour — and so [I]0-i really have no alternative . " "[0-i] Then [you]2018-you have made up [your]2018-you mind to go out to [Australia]10-australia and turn up every stone in order to find [this [George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]2026-this george farringdon 's son ? " For one wild moment [Christopher]135-christopher felt that [he]135-christopher must tell [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth how passionately [he]135-christopher would woo [her]102-elisabeth , should [she]102-elisabeth lose [her]102-elisabeth fortune ; and how [he]135-christopher would spend [his]135-christopher life and [his]135-christopher income in trying to make [her]102-elisabeth happy , should [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son be found and [she]102-elisabeth cease to be [one of [the greatest heiresses in [the Midlands]4166-the midlands]4165-the greatest heiresses in the midlands]4164-one of the greatest heiresses in the midlands . But [he]135-christopher held [himself]135-christopher back by the bitter knowledge of how cruelly appearances were against [him]135-christopher . [He]135-christopher had made up [his]135-christopher mind to do the right thing at all costs ; at least , [he]135-christopher had not exactly made up [his]135-christopher mind — [he]135-christopher saw the straight path , and the possibility of taking any other never occurred to [him]135-christopher . But if [he]135-christopher succeeded in this hateful and ( to [a man of [his]135-christopher type]4167-a man of his type ) inevitable quest , [he]135-christopher would not only sacrifice [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's interests , [he]135-christopher would also further [his]135-christopher own by making it possible for [him]135-christopher to ask [her]102-elisabeth to marry [him]135-christopher — a thing which [he]135-christopher felt [he]135-christopher could never do as long as [she]102-elisabeth was [one of [the wealthiest women in [Mershire]2-mershire]4169-the wealthiest women in mershire]4168-one of the wealthiest women in mershire , and [he]135-christopher was only [the manager of [her]102-elisabeth works]4170-the manager of her works . Duty is never so difficult to [certain men]4171-certain men as when it wears the garb and carries with it the rewards of self - interest ; others , on the contrary , find that [a joint - stock company , composed of the Right and the Profitable]4172-a joint - stock company , composed of the right and the profitable , supplies [[its]4172-a joint - stock company , composed of the right and the profitable passengers]4173-its passengers with a most satisfactory permanent way whereby to travel through life . There is no doubt that [these latter]4174-these latter have by far the more comfortable journey ; but whether [they]4174-these latter are equally contented when [they]4174-these latter have reached that journey 's end , [none of [them]4174-these latter]4175-none of them have as yet returned to tell [us]4176-us . "[2018-you] If [somebody]901-somebody must go to [Australia]10-australia after [that tiresome young man]2029-that tiresome young man , why need it be [you]2029-that tiresome young man ? " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth rose from [her]102-elisabeth seat and drew [herself]102-elisabeth up to [her]102-elisabeth full height , as became [a dethroned and offended queen]4177-a dethroned and offended queen . "[0-i] Then that is the end of the matter as far as [I]0-i am concerned , and it is a waste of time to discuss it further ; but [I]0-i must confess that there is nothing in [the world]301-the world [I]0-i hate so much as [a prig]2034-a prig , " [she]102-elisabeth said , as [she]102-elisabeth swept out of [the room]3736-the room . It was [her]102-elisabeth final shot , and it told . [She]102-elisabeth could hardly have selected one more admirably calculated to wound , and it went straight through [Christopher]135-christopher 's heart . It was now obvious that [she]102-elisabeth did not love [him]135-christopher , and never could have loved [him]135-christopher , [he]135-christopher assured [himself]135-christopher , or [she]102-elisabeth would not have misjudged [him]135-christopher so cruelly , or said such hard things to [him]135-christopher . [He]135-christopher did not realize that [an angry woman]4179-an angry woman says not what [she]4179-an angry woman thinks , but what [she]4179-an angry woman thinks will most hurt [the man with whom [she]4179-an angry woman is angry]4180-the man with whom she is angry . [He]135-christopher also did not realize — what [man]603-man does?—how difficult it is for [any woman]820-any woman to believe that [a man]310-a man can care for [her]4179-an angry woman and disagree with [her]4179-an angry woman at the same time , even though the disagreement be upon a purely impersonal question . Naturally , when the question happens to be personal , the strain on feminine faith is still greater — in the majority of cases too great to be borne . Thus [Christopher]135-christopher and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth came to the parting of the ways . [She]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth , "[2035-he] [He]2035-he does n't love [me]0-i because [he]2035-he wo n't do what [I]0-i want , regardless of [his]2035-he own ideas of duty . " And [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i , "[2035-he] If [I]0-i fail to do what [I]0-i consider is [my]0-i duty , [I]0-i am unworthy — or , rather , more unworthy than [I]0-i am in any case — to love [her]2036-her . " Thus [they]4184-they moved along parallel lines ; and parallel lines never meet — except in infinity . [Christopher]135-christopher went to [Australia]10-australia in search of [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son , and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth stayed in [England]3-england and cherished bitter thoughts in [her]102-elisabeth heart concerning [him]0-i . That imagination of [hers]102-elisabeth — which was always prone to lead [her]102-elisabeth astray — bore most terribly false witness against [Christopher]135-christopher just then . [It]4186-it portrayed [him]135-christopher as [a hard , self - righteous man , ready to sacrifice the rest of [mankind]3785-mankind to the Moloch of what [he]135-christopher considered to be [his]135-christopher own particular duty and spiritual welfare , and utterly indifferent as to how severe was the suffering entailed on [the victims of this sacrifice]4189-the victims of this sacrifice]4187-a hard , self - righteous man , ready to sacrifice the rest of mankind to the moloch of what he considered to be his own particular duty and spiritual welfare , and utterly indifferent as to how severe was the suffering entailed on the victims of this sacrifice . And , as [Christopher]135-christopher was not at hand to refute the charges of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's libellous fancy by [his]135-christopher own tender and unselfish personality , [the accuser]4190-the accuser took advantage of [his]135-christopher absence to blacken [him]135-christopher more and more . It was all in a piece with the rest of [his]0-i character , [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth ; [he]0-i had always been cold and hard and self - contained . When [[his]0-i house]3152-his house had been left unto [him]0-i desolate by the stroke which changed [[his]0-i uncle]775-his uncle from [a wise and kindly companion]4193-a wise and kindly companion into [a helpless and peevish child]4194-a helpless and peevish child , [she]102-elisabeth had longed to help and comfort [him]0-i with [her]102-elisabeth sympathy ; and [he]0-i had thrown it back in [her]102-elisabeth face . [He]0-i was too proud and too superior to care for human affection , [she]102-elisabeth supposed ; and now [he]0-i felt no hesitation in first forsaking [her]102-elisabeth , and then reducing [her]102-elisabeth to poverty , if only by so doing [he]0-i could set [himself]0-i still more firmly on the pedestal of [his]0-i own virtue . So did [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's imagination traduce [Christopher]135-christopher ; and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth listened and believed . At first [she]102-elisabeth was haunted by memories of how good [he]0-i had been to [her]102-elisabeth when [[her]102-elisabeth cousin]451-her cousin [Maria]101-maria farringdon died , and many a time before ; and [she]102-elisabeth used to dream about [him]0-i at night with so much of the old trust and affection that it took all the day to stamp out the fragrance of tenderness which [her]102-elisabeth dreams had left behind . But after a time these dreams and memories grew fewer and less distinct , and [she]102-elisabeth persuaded [herself]102-elisabeth that [Christopher]135-christopher had never been [the true and devoted friend [she]102-elisabeth had once imagined [him]0-i to be]4196-the true and devoted friend she had once imagined him to be , but that [the kind and affectionate Chris of olden days]4197-the kind and affectionate chris of olden days had been merely a creature of [her]102-elisabeth own invention . There was [no one]3126-no one to plead [his]0-i cause for [him]0-i , as [he]0-i was far away , and appearances were on the side of [[his]0-i accuser]4199-his accuser ; so [he]0-i was tried in [the court of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's merciless young judgment]4200-the court of elisabeth 's merciless young judgment , and sentenced to life - long banishment from the circle of [her]102-elisabeth interests and affections . [She]102-elisabeth forgot how [he]0-i had comforted [her]102-elisabeth in the day of [her]102-elisabeth adversity . If [he]0-i had allowed [her]102-elisabeth to comfort [him]0-i , [she]102-elisabeth would have remembered it forever ; but [he]0-i had not ; and in [this world]3177-this world [men]445-men must be prepared to take the consequences of [their]445-men own mistakes , even though those mistakes be made through excess of devotion to [another person]3077-another person . In certain cases it may be necessary to pluck out the right eye and cut off the right hand ; but there is no foundation for supposing that the operation will be any the less painful because of the righteous motive inducing it . And so [Christopher Thornley]121-christopher learned by bitter experience , when , after many days , [he]0-i returned from a fruitless search for [the missing heir]4204-the missing heir , to find the countenance of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth utterly changed toward [him]0-i . [She]102-elisabeth was quite civil to [him]0-i — quite polite ; [she]102-elisabeth never attempted to argue or quarrel with [him]0-i as [she]102-elisabeth had done in the old days , and [she]102-elisabeth listened patiently to all the details of [his]0-i doings in [Australia]10-australia ; but with gracious coldness [she]102-elisabeth quietly put [him]0-i outside the orbit of [her]102-elisabeth life , and showed [him]0-i plainly that [he]0-i was now nothing more to [her]102-elisabeth than [[her]102-elisabeth trustee]2001-her trustee and [the general manager of [her]102-elisabeth works]4206-the general manager of her works . It was hard on [Christopher]121-christopher — cruelly hard ; yet [he]0-i had no alternative but to accept the position which [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , in the blindness of [her]102-elisabeth heart , assigned to [him]0-i . Sometimes [he]0-i felt the burden of [his]0-i lot was almost more than [he]0-i could bear ; not because of its heaviness , as [he]0-i was [a brave man]4207-a brave man and [a patient one]4208-a patient one , but because of the utter absence of any joy in [his]0-i life . [Men]445-men and [women]446-women can endure much sorrow if [they]445-men have much joy as well ; it is when sorrow comes and there is no love to lighten it , that the Hand of [God]105-god lies heavy upon [them]445-men ; and It lay heavy upon [Christopher]121-christopher 's soul just then . Sometimes , when [he]0-i felt weary unto death of the dreary routine of work and the still drearier routine of [[[his]0-i uncle]775-his uncle 's sick - room]4212-his uncle 's sick - room , [he]0-i recalled with a bitter smile how [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth used to say that the gloom and smoke of the furnaces was really a pillar of cloud to show how [God]105-god was watching over [the people at [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth]4213-the people at the osierfield as [He]0-i watched over [them]4213-the people at the osierfield in [the wilderness]3028-the wilderness . Because [she]102-elisabeth had forgotten to be gracious to [him]0-i , [he]0-i concluded that [God]105-god had forgotten to be gracious to [him]0-i also — a not uncommon error of human wisdom ; but though [his]0-i heart was wounded and [his]0-i days darkened by [her]102-elisabeth injustice toward [him]0-i , [he]0-i never blamed [her]102-elisabeth , even in [his]0-i inmost thoughts . [He]0-i was absolutely loyal to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . One grim consolation [he]0-i had — and that was the conviction that [he]0-i had not won , and never could have won , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's love ; and that , therefore , poverty or riches were matters of no moment to [him]0-i . Had [he]0-i felt that temporal circumstances were the only bar between [him]0-i and happiness , [his]0-i position as [[her]102-elisabeth paid manager]4215-her paid manager would have been unendurable ; but now [she]102-elisabeth had taught [him]0-i that it was [he]0-i [himself]0-i , and not any difference in [their]4216-their respective social positions , which really stood between [herself]102-elisabeth and [him]0-i ; and , that being so , nothing else had any power to hurt [him]0-i . Wealth , unshared by [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , would have been no better than want , [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i ; success , uncrowned by [her]102-elisabeth , would have been equivalent to failure . When [Christopher]121-christopher was in [Australia]10-australia [he]121-christopher succeeded in tracing [George Farringdon]99-george farringdon as far as [Broken Hill]72-broken hill , and there [he]121-christopher found poor [George]99-george farringdon 's grave . [He]0-i learned that [George]99-george farringdon had left [a widow]346-a widow and [one son]4218-one son , who had left [the place]691-the place immediately after [George]99-george farringdon 's death ; but [no one]3126-no one could give [him]0-i any further information as to what had subsequently become of [these two]3850-these two . And [he]0-i was obliged at last to abandon the search and return to [England]3-england , without discovering what had happened to [the widow]4222-the widow and [child]670-child . Some years after [[his]121-christopher nephew]4001-his nephew 's fruitless journey to [Australia]10-australia [Richard Smallwood]104-richard smallwood died ; and though [the old man]3445-the old man had been nothing but a burden during the last few years of [his]3445-the old man life , [Christopher]121-christopher missed [him]3445-the old man sorely when [he]3445-the old man was gone . It was something even to have [a childish old man]4226-a childish old man to love [him]121-christopher , and smile at [his]121-christopher coming ; now there was [nobody]409-nobody belonging to [him]121-christopher , and [he]121-christopher was utterly alone . But the years which had proved so dark to [Christopher]121-christopher had been full of brightness and interest to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth had fulfilled [her]102-elisabeth intention of studying at [the Slade School]1140-the slade school , and [she]102-elisabeth had succeeded in [her]102-elisabeth work beyond [her]102-elisabeth wildest expectations . [She]102-elisabeth was already recognised as [an artist of no mean order]4229-an artist of no mean order . Now and then [she]102-elisabeth came down to [the Willows]8-the willows , bringing [Grace Cobham]227-grace with [her]102-elisabeth ; and [the young women]4230-the young women filled [the house]596-the house with [company]4232-company . Now and then [they]4230-the young women two went abroad together , and satisfied [their]4230-the young women souls with the beauty of the art of [other lands]4233-other lands . But principally [they]4230-the young women lived in [London]15-london , for the passion to be near the centre of things had come upon [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ; and when once that comes upon any one , [London]15-london is the place in which to live . [People]2982-people wondered that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth did not marry , and blamed [her]102-elisabeth behind [her]102-elisabeth back for not making suitable hay while it was as yet summer with [her]102-elisabeth . But [the artist - woman]4235-the artist - woman never marries for the sake of being married — or rather for the sake of not being unmarried — as so many of [[her]102-elisabeth more ordinary sisters]4236-her more ordinary sisters do ; [her]102-elisabeth art supplies [her]102-elisabeth with that necessary interest in life , without which [most women]4237-most women become either [invalids]4238-invalids or shrews , and — unless [she]102-elisabeth happens to meet [the right man]4239-the right man — [she]102-elisabeth can manage very well without [him]4239-the right man . [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son had never turned up , in spite of all the efforts to discover [him]1997-george farringdon 's son ; and by this time [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had settled down into the belief that [the Willows]8-the willows and [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth were permanently [hers]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth had long ago forgiven [Christopher]121-christopher for setting [her]102-elisabeth and [her]102-elisabeth interests aside , and going off in search of [the lost heir]4128-the lost heir — at least [she]102-elisabeth believed that [she]102-elisabeth had ; but there was always an undercurrent of bitterness in [her]102-elisabeth thoughts of [him]4239-the right man , which proved that the wound [he]4239-the right man had then dealt [her]102-elisabeth had left a scar . [Several men]4242-several men had wanted to marry [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , but [they]4242-several men had not succeeded in winning [her]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth enjoyed flirting with [them]4242-several men , and [she]102-elisabeth rejoiced in [their]4242-several men admiration , but when [they]4242-several men offered [her]102-elisabeth [their]4242-several men love [she]102-elisabeth was frightened and ran away . Consequently [the world]301-the world called [her]102-elisabeth cold ; and as the years rolled on and [no one]3126-no one touched [her]102-elisabeth heart , [she]102-elisabeth began to believe that [the world]301-the world was right . "[2036-her] There are three great things in life , " [Grace Cobham]227-grace said to [her]102-elisabeth one day , "[2036-her] art and love and religion . [They]2037-they really are all part of the same thing , and none of [them]2037-they is perfected without the others . [You]2038-you have got two , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ; but [you]2038-you have somehow missed the third , and without it [you]2038-you will never attain to [your]2038-you highest possibilities . [You]2038-you are [a good woman]3726-a good woman , and [you]2038-you are [a true artist]3351-a true artist ; but , until [you]2038-you fall in love , [your]2038-you religion and [your]2038-you art will both lack something , and will fall short of perfection . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm afraid [I]0-i 'm not [a falling - in - love sort of person]2041-a falling - in - love sort of person , " replied [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth meekly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm extremely sorry , but such is the case . " "[0-i] It is a pity ! But [you]0-i may fall in love yet . " "[0-i] It 's too late , [I]0-i fear . [You]0-i see [I]0-i am over thirty ; and if [I]0-i have n't done it by now , [I]0-i expect [I]0-i never shall do it . It is tiresome to have missed it , [I]0-i admit ; and especially as [you]0-i think it would make [me]0-i paint better pictures . " "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i do . [You]0-i paint so well now that it is a pity [you]0-i do n't paint still better . [I]0-i do not believe that [any artist]2042-any artist does [his]2043-his or [her]2044-her best work until [his]2043-his or [her]2044-her nature is fully developed ; and [no woman]2045-no woman 's nature is fully developed until [she]2045-no woman has been in love . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have never been in love ; [I]0-i do n't even know what it is like inside , " said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth sadly ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i dreadfully want to know , because — looked at from the outside — it seems interesting . " [Grace]227-grace gazed at [her]102-elisabeth thoughtfully . "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder if it is that [you]0-i are too cold to fall in love , or whether it only is that [the right person]2046-the right person has n't appeared . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i did . What do [you]0-i think it feels like ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i know what it feels like — and that is like nothing else this side heaven . " "[0-i] It seems funny to get worked up in that sort of way over [an ordinary man]1633-an ordinary man — turning [him]1633-an ordinary man into [a revival - service or a national anthem]2048-a revival - service or a national anthem , or something equally thrilling and inspiring ! Still , [I]0-i 'd do it if [I]0-i could , just from pure curiosity . [I]0-i should really enjoy it . [I]0-i 've seen [stupid girls]2049-stupid girls light up like a turnip with a candle inside , simply because [some plain young man]2050-some plain young man did the inevitable , and came up into [the drawing - room]1850-the drawing - room after dinner ; and [I]0-i 've seen [clever women]2052-clever women go to pieces like a linen button at the wash , simply because [some ignorant man]2053-some ignorant man did the inevitable , and preferred [a more foolish and better - looking woman]2054-a more foolish and better - looking woman to [themselves]2053-some ignorant man . " "[102-elisabeth] Have [you]0-i really never been in love , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ? " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth pondered for a moment . "[102-elisabeth] No ; [I]0-i 've sometimes thought [I]0-i was , but [I]0-i 've always known [I]0-i was n't . " "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder at that ; because [you]0-i really are affectionate . " "[0-i] That is quite true ; but [no one]3126-no one has ever seemed to want as much as [I]0-i had to give , " said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , the smile dying out of [her]102-elisabeth eyes ; "[3126-no one] [I]0-i do so long to be necessary to [somebody]901-somebody — to feel that it is in [my]0-i power to make [somebody]901-somebody perfectly happy ; but [nobody]409-nobody has ever asked enough of [me]0-i . " "[409-nobody] [You]0-i could have made [the men happy who wanted to marry [you]0-i]2059-the men happy who wanted to marry you , " suggested [Grace]227-grace . "[0-i] No ; [I]0-i could have made [them]2059-the men happy who wanted to marry you comfortable , and that 's not the same thing . " As [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth sat alone in [[her]102-elisabeth own room]4246-her own room that night , [she]102-elisabeth thought about what [Grace]227-grace had said , and wondered if [she]102-elisabeth were really too cold ever to experience that common yet wonderful miracle which turns [earth]614-earth into heaven for [most people]374-most people once in [their]374-most people lives . [She]102-elisabeth had received much love and still more admiration in [her]102-elisabeth time ; but [she]102-elisabeth had never been allowed to give what [she]102-elisabeth had to give , and [she]102-elisabeth was essentially of [the type of woman to whom it is more blessed to give than to receive]4249-the type of woman to whom it is more blessed to give than to receive . [She]102-elisabeth had never craved to be loved , as [some women]4250-some women crave ; [she]102-elisabeth had only asked to be allowed to love as much as [she]102-elisabeth was capable of loving , and the permission had been denied [her]102-elisabeth . As [she]102-elisabeth looked back over [her]102-elisabeth past life , [she]102-elisabeth saw that it had always been the same . [She]102-elisabeth had given the adoration of [her]102-elisabeth childhood to [Anne Farringdon]103-anne farringdon , and [Anne]103-anne farringdon had not wanted it ; [she]102-elisabeth had given the devotion of [her]102-elisabeth girlhood to [Felicia]199-felicia , and [Felicia]199-felicia had not wanted it ; [she]102-elisabeth had given the truest friendship of [[her]102-elisabeth womanhood]4251-her womanhood to [Christopher]121-christopher , and [Christopher]121-christopher had not wanted it . As for [the men who had loved [her]102-elisabeth]4252-the men who had loved her , [she]102-elisabeth had known perfectly well that [she]102-elisabeth was not essential to [them]4252-the men who had loved her ; had [she]102-elisabeth been , [she]102-elisabeth would have married [them]4252-the men who had loved her ; but [they]4252-the men who had loved her could be happy without [her]102-elisabeth — and [they]4252-the men who had loved her were . For [Grace]227-grace [she]102-elisabeth had the warmest sense of comradeship ; but [Grace]227-grace 's life was so full on its own account , that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth could only be one of many interests to [her]227-grace . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was so strong and so tender , that [she]102-elisabeth could have given much to [any one to whom [she]102-elisabeth was absolutely necessary]4253-any one to whom she was absolutely necessary ; but [she]102-elisabeth felt [she]102-elisabeth could give of [her]102-elisabeth best to [no man who desired it only as a luxury]4254-no man who desired it only as a luxury — it was too good for that . "[0-i] It seems rather a waste of force , " [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth , with a whimsical smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i feel like [Niagara]230-niagara , spending its strength on empty splashings , when it might be turning [thousands of electric engines]2060-thousands of electric engines and lighting millions of electric lights , if only its power were turned in the right direction and properly stored . [I]0-i could be so much to anybody who really needed [me]0-i — [I]0-i feel [I]0-i could ; but [nobody]409-nobody seems to need [me]0-i , so it 's no use bothering . Anyway , [I]0-i have [my]0-i art , and that more than satisfies [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i will spend [my]0-i life in giving forth [my]0-i strength to [the world]301-the world at large , in the shape of pictures which shall help [the world]301-the world to be better and happier . At least [I]0-i hope so . " And with this reflection [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth endeavoured to console [herself]102-elisabeth for the non - appearance of [that fairy prince , who , in [her]102-elisabeth childish dreams , had always been wounded in the tournament of life , and had turned to [her]102-elisabeth for comfort]4255-that fairy prince , who , in her childish dreams , had always been wounded in the tournament of life , and had turned to her for comfort . The years which had passed so drearily for [Christopher]121-christopher , had cast their shadows also over the lives of [Alan]161-alan and [Felicia Tremaine]231-felicia . When [Willie]215-willie was [a baby]480-a baby , [[his]215-willie nurse]4257-his nurse accidentally let [him]215-willie fall ; and the injury [he]215-willie then received was so great that , as [he]215-willie grew older , [he]215-willie was never able to walk properly , but had to punt [himself]215-willie about with a little crutch . This was a terrible blow to [Alan]161-alan ; and became all the greater as time went on , and [Felicia]231-felicia had [no other children]4258-no other children to share [his]215-willie devotion . [Felicia]231-felicia , too , felt it sorely ; but [she]231-felicia fretted more over the sorrow it was to [[her]231-felicia husband]490-her husband than on [her]231-felicia own account . There was a great friendship between [Willie]215-willie and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . Weakness of any kind always appealed to [her]102-elisabeth , and [he]215-willie , [poor child]3675-poor child ! was weak indeed . So when [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was at [the Willows]8-the willows and [Willie]215-willie at [the Moat House]762-the moat house , [the two]340-the two spent much time together . [He]215-willie never wearied of hearing about the things that [she]102-elisabeth had pretended when [she]102-elisabeth was [a little girl]3044-a little girl ; and [she]102-elisabeth never wearied of telling [him]215-willie about them . "[0-i] And so [the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces]2064-the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces , followed the pillar of cloud till it led [them]2064-the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces to [the country on the other side of the hills]2065-the country on the other side of the hills , " said [Willie]215-willie one day , as [he]215-willie and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth were sitting on the old rustic seat in [the Willows ' garden]4264-the willows ' garden . " "[2069-the other people] Perhaps ; but what made [them]2064-the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces so happy was that [they]2064-the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces loved [the other people]2069-the other people and were kind to [them]2069-the other people . There was n't room for it , or time for it . But in [the country]3528-the country over [the hills]2074-the hills there was plenty of room and plenty of time ; in fact , there was n't any room or any time for anything else . " "[2064-the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces] What did [they]2064-the people , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces have to eat ? " [Willie]215-willie asked . " [She]102-elisabeth put [her]102-elisabeth strong arm round [him]215-willie and held [him]215-willie close . "[2087-a princess] Once upon a time , " [she]102-elisabeth began , "[2087-a princess] there was [a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces]2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces . That was the only rare thing about [her]2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces ; otherwise [she]2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces was quite [a common princess]2089-a common princess . " "[2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces] What did [she]2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces do with the heart ? " asked [Willie]215-willie . "[2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces] [She]2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces wanted to give it to [somebody]901-somebody ; but the strange thing was that [nobody]409-nobody would have it . [Several people]2092-several people asked [her]2088-a princess , who lived among the smoke and the furnaces for it before [they]2092-several people knew it was made of real gold ; but when [they]2092-several people found that out , [they]2092-several people began to make excuses . [One]543-one said that [he]543-one 'd no place in [[his]543-one house]3152-his house for such a first - class article ; it would merely make the rest of the furniture look shabby , and [he]543-one should n't refurnish in order to please [anybody]376-anybody . [Another]2022-another said that [he]543-one was n't going to bother [himself]543-one with looking after a real gold heart , when a silver - gilt one would serve [his]543-one purpose just as well . And [a third]2097-a third said that solid gold plate was n't worth the trouble of cleaning and keeping in order , as it was sure to get scratched or bent in the process , the precious metals being too soft for everyday use . " "[2097-a third] It is difficult not to scratch when [you]2098-you 're cleaning plate , " [Willie]215-willie observed . So [I]0-i have to clean it over and over again . But go on about [the princess]744-the princess . " "[744-the princess] Well , then [she]744-the princess offered [her]744-the princess gold heart to [a woman who seemed lonely and desolate]2100-a woman who seemed lonely and desolate ; but [the woman]3411-the woman only cared for the hearts of [men]445-men , and threw back [the princess]744-the princess 's in [her]3411-the woman face . And then [somebody]901-somebody advised [her]744-the princess to set it up for auction , to go to [the highest bidder]2105-the highest bidder , as that was generally considered the correct thing to do with regard to [well - regulated women]2106-well - regulated women 's hearts ; but [she]744-the princess did n't like that suggestion at all . At last [the poor princess]2107-the poor princess grew tired of offering [her]2107-the poor princess treasure to [people who did n't want it]2108-people who did n't want it , and so [she]2107-the poor princess locked it up out of sight ; and then [everybody]3055-everybody said that [she]2107-the poor princess had n't a heart at all , and what a disgrace it was for [a young woman to be without one]2110-a young woman to be without one . " "[3055-everybody] That was n't fair ! " "[3055-everybody] Not at all fair ; but [people]2982-people are n't always fair on [this side of [the hills]2074-the hills]2112-this side of the hills , [darling]1703-darling . So [the princess]744-the princess decided to leave the smoke and the furnaces , and to go to [the country]3528-the country on [the other side of the hills]2117-the other side of the hills . " "[744-the princess] And what did [she]744-the princess find when [she]744-the princess got [there]658-there ? " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's eyes grew dreamy . "[744-the princess] [She]744-the princess found [a fairy prince]3358-a fairy prince standing on [the very borders of [that country]3033-that country]2123-the very borders of that country , and [he]3358-a fairy prince said to [her]744-the princess , ' [You]744-the princess 've come at last ; [I]0-i 've been such a long time waiting for [you]744-the princess . ' And [the princess]744-the princess asked [him]3358-a fairy prince , ' Do [you]3358-a fairy prince happen to want such a thing as a heart of real gold ? ' ' And [I]0-i was beginning to be afraid that [I]0-i was never going to find [anybody]376-anybody to give it to , ' replied [the princess]744-the princess . So [she]744-the princess gave [him]3358-a fairy prince [her]744-the princess heart , and [he]3358-a fairy prince took it ; and then [they]2129-they looked into [each other]3364-each other 's eyes and smiled .
