"[409-nobody] What was [the fairy prince]2133-the fairy prince like to look at ? " [he]0-i inquired . "[2133-the fairy prince] [I]0-i do n't know , [darling]1703-darling ; [I]0-i 've often wondered . " And [Willie]215-willie had to be content with this uncertain state of affairs . So had [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . For some time now [she]102-elisabeth had been making small bonfires of [the Thames]50-the thames ; but the following spring [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth set [the river]1149-the river on fire in good earnest by [her]102-elisabeth great Academy picture , The Pillar of Cloud . It was the picture of the year ; and it supplied [[its]4268-its creator]4269-its creator with a copious draught of that nectar of the gods which [men]445-men call fame . It was a fine picture , strongly painted , and was a representation of [the Black Country]715-the black country , with [its]715-the black country mingled gloom and glare , and [its]715-the black country pillar of smoke always hanging over [it]715-the black country . In the foreground were figures of [men]445-men and [women]446-women and [children , looking upward to the pillar of cloud]4274-children , looking upward to the pillar of cloud ; and , by the magic spell of [the artist]393-the artist , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had succeeded in depicting on [their]445-men faces , for [such who had eyes to see it]4276-such who had eyes to see it , the peace of [those who knew that [God]105-god was with [them]445-men in [their]445-men journey through [the wilderness]3028-the wilderness]4277-those who knew that god was with them in their journey through the wilderness . [They]445-men were worn and weary and toil - worn , as [they]445-men dwelt in the midst of the furnaces ; but , through it all , [they]445-men looked up to the overshadowing cloud and were lightened , and [their]445-men faces were not ashamed . In the far distance there was a glimpse of the sun setting behind [a range of hills]4279-a range of hills ; and one felt , as [one]543-one gazed at the picture and strove to understand its meaning , that the pillar of cloud was gradually leading [the people]3030-the people nearer and nearer to [the far - off hills]3807-the far - off hills and [the land beyond the sunset]4283-the land beyond the sunset ; and that there [they]3030-the people would find an abundant compensation for the suffering and poverty that had blighted [their]3030-the people lives as [they]3030-the people toiled here for [their]3030-the people daily bread . Even [those who could not understand the underlying meaning of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's picture]4284-those who could not understand the underlying meaning of elisabeth 's picture , marvelled at the power and technical skill whereby [she]102-elisabeth had brought the weird mystery of [the Black Country]18-the black country into [the heart of [London]15-london]4285-the heart of london , until [one]543-one almost felt the breath of the furnaces as [one]543-one gazed entranced at [her]102-elisabeth canvas ; and [those who did understand the underlying meaning]4288-those who did understand the underlying meaning , marvelled still more that [so young a woman]4289-so young a woman should have learned so much of life 's hidden mysteries — forgetting that art is no intellectual endowment , but a revelation from [God]105-god [Himself]105-god , and that [the true artist]4290-the true artist does not learn but knows , because [God]105-god has whispered to [him]4290-the true artist . There was another picture that made a sensation in that year 's Academy ; it was the work of [an unknown artist]4291-an unknown artist , [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil by name , and was noted in the catalogue as [The Daughters of Philip]234-philip . It represented [the "[0-i] four daughters , [virgins]2135-virgins , which did prophesy " of [[Philip]234-philip of [Cæsarea]73-cæsarea]4293-philip of cæsarea]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea ; but it did not set [them]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea forth in the dress and attitude of [inspired sibyls]4294-inspired sibyls . Instead of this it showed [them]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea as [they]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea were in [[their]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea own home]4295-their own home , when the Spirit of [the Lord]2978-the lord was not upon [them]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea , but when [they]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea were [ordinary girls]4297-ordinary girls , with [ordinary girls]4297-ordinary girls ' interests and joys and sorrows . [One of [them]4292-the " four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy " of philip of cæsarea]4299-one of them was braiding [her]4299-one of them magnificent black hair in front of a mirror ; and another was eagerly perusing a letter with the love - light in [her]4299-one of them eyes ; a third was weeping bitterly over a dead dove ; and a fourth — [the youngest]4300-the youngest — was playing merrily with a monkey . It was a dazzling picture , brilliant with rich Eastern draperies and warm lights ; and [shallow spectators]4301-shallow spectators wondered what [the artist]393-the artist meant by painting [the prophetesses]4303-the prophetesses in such frivolous and worldly guise ; but [the initiated]4304-the initiated understood how [he]393-the artist had fathomed the tragedy underlying the lives of [most women who are set apart from [[their]4305-most women who are set apart from their fellows by the gift of genius fellows]966-their fellows by the gift of genius]4305-most women who are set apart from their fellows by the gift of genius . When the Spirit is upon [them]2137-them [they]2137-them prophesy , by means of pictures or poems or stories or songs ; and [the world]301-the world says , "[0-i] These are not as [other women]1535-other women ; [they]2137-them command [our]2138-our admiration , but [they]2137-them do not crave [our]2138-our love : let [us]2138-our put [them]2137-them on the top of pinnacles for high days and holidays , and not trouble [them]2137-them with the petty details of everyday life . " [The world]301-the world forgets that the gift of genius is a thing apart from [the woman]3411-the woman [herself]3411-the woman , and that [these women at heart]4310-these women at heart are [very women]4311-very women , as entirely as [[their]4310-these women at heart less gifted sisters]4312-their less gifted sisters are , and have [the ordinary woman]4313-the ordinary woman 's longing for love and laughter , and for all the little things that make life happy . A pinnacle is a poor substitute for a hearthstone , from the feminine point of view ; and laurel wreaths do not make half so satisfactory a journey 's end as [lovers]456-lovers ' meetings . All of which it is difficult for [a man]310-a man to understand , since fame is more to [him]310-a man than it is to [a woman]469-a woman , and love less ; therefore the knowledge of this truth proved [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil to be [a true artist]3351-a true artist ; while the able manner in which [he]233-cecil had set it forth showed [him]233-cecil to be also [a highly gifted one]4318-a highly gifted one . And [the world]301-the world is always ready to acknowledge real merit when it sees it , and to do homage to the same . [The Daughters of Philip]234-philip carried a special message to the heart of [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth had been placed on [her]102-elisabeth pinnacle , and had already begun to find how cold was the atmosphere up there , and how much more human [she]102-elisabeth was than [people]2982-people expected and allowed for [her]102-elisabeth to be . [She]102-elisabeth felt like a statue set up in [the market - place]4321-the market - place , that hears [the children piping and mourning]4322-the children piping and mourning , and longs to dance and weep with [them]4322-the children piping and mourning ; but [they]4322-the children piping and mourning did not ask [her]102-elisabeth to do either — did not want [her]102-elisabeth to do either — and if [she]102-elisabeth had come down from [her]102-elisabeth pedestal and begged to be allowed to play with [them]4322-the children piping and mourning or comfort [them]4322-the children piping and mourning , [they]4322-the children piping and mourning would only have been frightened and run away . But here at last was [a man who understood what [she]102-elisabeth was feeling]4323-a man who understood what she was feeling ; to whom [she]102-elisabeth could tell [her]102-elisabeth troubles , and who would know what [she]102-elisabeth meant ; and [she]102-elisabeth made up [her]102-elisabeth mind that before that season was over , [she]102-elisabeth and [the unknown artist , who had painted [The Daughters of Philip]234-philip]4324-the unknown artist , who had painted the daughters of philip , should be [friends]3544-friends . It was the night of [the Academy soirée]4326-the academy soirée in the year of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's triumph ; [she]102-elisabeth was being petted and fêted on all sides , and passed through [the crowded rooms]4327-the crowded rooms in a sort of royal progress , surrounded by an atmosphere of praise and adulation . Of course [she]102-elisabeth liked it — what [woman]669-woman would not?—but [she]102-elisabeth was conscious of a dull ache of sadness , at the back of all [her]102-elisabeth joy , that there was [no one]3126-no one to share [her]102-elisabeth triumph with [her]102-elisabeth ; [no one to whom [she]102-elisabeth could say , "[0-i] [I]0-i care for all this , chiefly because it makes [me]0-i stronger to help [you]2139-you and worthier to be loved by [you]2139-you]4330-no one to whom she could say , " i care for all this , chiefly because it makes me stronger to help you and worthier to be loved by you ; " [no one who would be made happy]4331-no one who would be made happy by [her]102-elisabeth whisper , "[0-i] [I]0-i have set the Thames ablaze in order to make warm [your]2139-you fireside . " It was as yet early in the evening when [the President]4332-the president turned for a moment from [his]0-i duties as "[0-i] official receiver " to say to [her]102-elisabeth , "[102-elisabeth] [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth , [I]0-i want to present [Farquhar]233-cecil to [you]102-elisabeth . [He]233-cecil is [a rising man]2140-a rising man , and [a very good fellow]2141-a very good fellow into the bargain , and [I]0-i know [he]233-cecil is most anxious to be introduced to [you]102-elisabeth . " And then the usual incantation was gone through , which constitutes an introduction in [England]3-england — namely , the repetition of two names , whereof [each person]4333-each person hears only [his]4334-his or [her]4335-her own ( an item of information by no means new or in any way to be desired ) , while the name of [the other contracting party]4336-the other contracting party remains shrouded in impenetrable mystery ; and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth found [herself]102-elisabeth face to face with [the man whom [she]102-elisabeth specially desired to meet]4337-the man whom she specially desired to meet . [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil was [a remarkably handsome man , nearer forty than thirty years of age]4338-a remarkably handsome man , nearer forty than thirty years of age . [He]233-cecil was tall and graceful , with golden hair and the profile of a Greek statue ; and , in addition to these palpable charms , [he]233-cecil possessed the more subtle ones of a musical voice and a fascinating manner . [He]233-cecil treated [every woman]3071-every woman , with whom [he]233-cecil was brought into contact , as if [she]3071-every woman were [a compound of a child]4340-a compound of a child and [a queen]4341-a queen ; and [he]233-cecil had a way of looking at [her]3071-every woman and speaking to [her]3071-every woman as if [she]3071-every woman were [the one woman in [the world]301-the world for whom [he]233-cecil had been waiting all [his]233-cecil life]4342-the one woman in the world for whom he had been waiting all his life . That [women]446-women were taken in by this half - caressing , half - worshipping manner was not altogether [their]446-women fault ; perhaps it was not altogether [his]233-cecil . [Very attractive people]4345-very attractive people fall into the habit of attracting , and are frequently unconscious of , and therefore irresponsible for , [their]4345-very attractive people success . "[233-cecil] It is so good of [you]2142-you to let [me]0-i be presented to [you]2142-you , " [he]0-i said to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , as [they]4346-they walked through [the crowded rooms]4327-the crowded rooms in search of a seat ; "[2142-you] [you]2142-you do n't know how [I]0-i have longed for it ever since [I]0-i first saw pictures of [yours]2142-you on these walls . " [Farquhar]233-cecil laughed , and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth thought [he]233-cecil had the most beautiful teeth [she]102-elisabeth had ever seen . " "[445-men] Still it annoys [you]2247-you when [men]445-men say the same of [you]2247-you , and suggest that an ordinary lump of sugar would have sweetened [Antony]242-antony 's vinegar more successfully than did [Cleopatra]243-cleopatra 's pearl . " "[2258-that lovely girl on the other side of him] [She]2258-that lovely girl on the other side of him is indeed — [a most beautiful creature]2260-a most beautiful creature . Now if [Lord Wrexham]239-lord wrexham had broken [his]239-lord wrexham heart over [her]2258-that lovely girl on the other side of him , [I]0-i could have understood and almost commended [him]239-lord wrexham . " "[239-lord wrexham] Well , but [he]239-lord wrexham did n't , [you]0-i see . " "[0-i] [I]0-i fancy that the breakableness is in the nature of the heart itself , and not of the iconoclast , " said [Cecil]233-cecil . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth looked up quickly . "[0-i] Oh ! [I]0-i do n't . [I]0-i think that [the person who breaks the heart of another person]2264-the person who breaks the heart of another person must have an immense capacity for commanding love . " "[0-i] Not at all ; [the person whose heart is broken]2265-the person whose heart is broken has an immense capacity for feeling love . Take [your]0-i Lord Wrexham , for instance : it was not because [Miss Carnaby]241-miss carnaby was strong , but because [he]239-lord wrexham was strong , that [his]239-lord wrexham heart was broken in the encounter between [them]2266-them . [You]0-i can see that in [their]2266-them faces . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't agree with [you]0-i . " "[0-i] [You]0-i are very modern , in spite of [your]0-i assertion to the contrary , and therefore very subjective . " "[0-i] [You]0-i mean that [I]0-i am too self - willed and domineering ? " laughed [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . ' " "[248-the apostle] Yes ; [I]0-i understand that . " [Farquhar]233-cecil cultivated the distinguished [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth assiduously , and the friendship between [them]4350-them grew apace . [Each]1646-each had a certain attraction for [the other]4352-the other ; and , in addition , [they]4350-them enjoyed that wonderful freemasonry which exists among [all followers of the same craft]4353-all followers of the same craft , and welds these together in a bond almost as strong as the bond of relationship . [The artist in [Farquhar]233-cecil]4354-the artist in farquhar was of far finer fibre than [the man]3356-the man , as is sometimes the case with complex natures ; so that one side of [him]4354-the artist in farquhar gave expression to thoughts which the other side of [him]4354-the artist in farquhar was incapable of comprehending . [He]4354-the artist in farquhar did not consciously pretend that [he]4354-the artist in farquhar was better than [he]4354-the artist in farquhar was , and [he]4354-the artist in farquhar really believed the truths which [he]4354-the artist in farquhar preached ; but when [the gods]336-the gods serve [their]336-the gods nectar in earthen vessels , [the vessels]4357-the vessels are apt to get more credit than [they]4357-the vessels deserve , and [the gods]336-the gods less . To [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , [Cecil]233-cecil was extremely interesting ; and [she]102-elisabeth understood — better than [most women]4237-most women would have done — the difference between [himself]4354-the artist in farquhar and [his]4354-the artist in farquhar art , and how the one must not be measured by the other . "[2334-confessor] What have [you]0-i been doing ? " [she]102-elisabeth asked gently . "[0-i] It is n't so much what [I]0-i have been doing as what [I]0-i have been feeling . Help [me]0-i to be as [I]0-i was then , [dear friend]2339-dear friend . " "[0-i] How can [I]0-i ? " "[0-i] By simply being [yourself]2337-you and letting [me]0-i watch [you]2337-you . "[2337-you] No ; [I]0-i have never felt like that . " "[0-i] Oh ! [I]0-i can . [I]0-i can imagine doing a thing , and despising [one]543-one 's self at the time for doing it , and yet not being able to help doing it . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have heard [other people]2980-other people say that , and [I]0-i ca n't understand it . "[2337-you] Yes , [I]0-i am complex ; but not at the same moment . [I]0-i have two distinct natures , but the two are never on the stage at once . [I]0-i do n't in the least know what [St. Paul]252-st. paul meant when [he]252-st. paul said that the evil [he]252-st. paul would not that [he]252-st. paul did . [I]0-i can quite understand doing the evil on Tuesday morning that [I]0-i would not on Monday afternoon ; but [I]0-i could never do anything and disapprove of it at the same minute . " "[0-i] That is because [you]2337-you are so good — and so cold . " "[0-i] Am [I]0-i ? " "[0-i] Yes , dear [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth ; and so amiable . [You]2337-you never do things in a temper . " "[2337-you] But [I]0-i do ; [I]0-i really have got a temper of [my]0-i own , though nowadays [people]2982-people seem to find difficulty in believing it . [I]0-i have frequently done things in a temper before now ; but as long as the temper lasts [I]0-i am pleased that [I]0-i have done them , and feel that [I]0-i do well to be angry . When the temper is over , [I]0-i sometimes think differently ; but not till then . As [I]0-i have told [you]2345-you before , [my]0-i will is so strong that it and [I]0-i are never at loggerheads with each other ; it always rules [me]0-i completely . " [Farquhar]233-cecil sighed . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were as strong as [you]2345-you are ; but [I]0-i am not . And do [you]2345-you mean to tell [me]0-i that there is no worldly side to [you]2345-you , either ; no side that hankers after fleshpots , even while [the artist within [you]2345-you]2346-the artist within you is being fed with manna from heaven ? " "[2345-you] No ; [I]0-i do n't think there is , " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth replied slowly . "[0-i] [I]0-i really do not like [people]2982-people any the better for having money and titles and things like that , and it is no use pretending that [I]0-i do . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i did n't , but [I]0-i ca n't help it . It is only [you]2345-you who can help [me]0-i to look at life from the ideal point of view — [you]2345-you whose feet are still wet with the dew of [Olympus]38-olympus , and in whom the Greek spirit is as fresh as it was three thousand years ago . " "[2345-you] Oh ! [I]0-i 'm not as perfect as all that ; far from it ! [I]0-i do n't despise [people]2982-people for not having rank or wealth , since rank and wealth do n't happen to be the things that interest [me]0-i . But there are things that do interest [me]0-i — genius and wit and culture and charm , for instance — and [I]0-i am quite as hard on [the people who lack these gifts]2349-the people who lack these gifts , as ever [you]2345-you are on [the impecunious nobodies]2350-the impecunious nobodies . [I]0-i confess [I]0-i am often ashamed of [myself]0-i when [I]0-i realize how frightfully [I]0-i look down upon [stupid men]1366-stupid men and [dull women]2352-dull women , and how utterly indifferent [I]0-i am as to what becomes of [them]2353-them . So [I]0-i really am as great [a snob]2354-a snob as [you]2345-you are , though [I]0-i wear [my]0-i snobbery — like [my]0-i rue — with a difference . " "[2354-a snob] Not [a snob]2354-a snob , [dear lady]3318-dear lady — never [a snob]2354-a snob ! There never existed [a woman with less snobbery in [her]2358-a woman with less snobbery in her composition composition]2358-a woman with less snobbery in her composition than [you]2345-you have . That [you]2345-you are impatient of the dull and unattractive , [I]0-i admit ; but so [you]2345-you ought to be — [your]2345-you own wit and charm give [you]2345-you the right to despise [them]2353-them . " "[2353-them] But [they]2353-them do n't ; that 's where [you]2345-you make a mistake . It is as unjust to look down on [a man]310-a man for not making a joke as for not making a fortune . Though it is n't so much [the people who do n't]2360-the people who do n't make jokes that irritate [me]0-i , as [the people who make poor ones]2361-the people who make poor ones . Do n't [you]2345-you know [the sort?—would - be wits who quote a remark out of a bound Punch]2362-the sort?—would - be wits who quote a remark out of a bound punch , and think [they]2362-the sort?—would - be wits who quote a remark out of a bound punch have been brilliant ; and who tell an anecdote crusted with antiquity , which [men]445-men learned at [[their]445-men mother]2364-their mother 's knees , and say that it actually happened to [a friend of theirs the week before last]2365-a friend of theirs the week before last . " "[0-i] [I]0-i never know whether to laugh at [their]2353-them laboured jokes or not . Of course , it is pretty manners to do so , be the wit never so stale ; but on the other hand it encourages [them]2353-them in [their]2353-them evil habits , and seems to [me]0-i as doubtful a form of hospitality as offering a brandy - and - soda to [a confirmed drunkard]2366-a confirmed drunkard . " "[2339-dear friend] [Dear friend]2339-dear friend , let [us]2368-us never try to be funny ! " "[2339-dear friend] Amen ! And , above all things , let [us]2368-us flee from humorous recitations , " added [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . "[2368-us] There are few things in [the world]301-the world more heart - rending than a humorous recitation — with action . As for [me]0-i , it unmans [me]0-i completely , and [I]0-i quietly weep in a remote corner of [the room]3736-the room until [the carriage]3457-the carriage comes to take [me]0-i [home]399-home . Therefore , [I]0-i avoid such ; as [no woman]2045-no woman 's eyelashes will stand a long course of humorous recitation without being the worse for wear . " "[252-st. paul] It seems to [me]0-i after all , " [Cecil]233-cecil remarked , "[252-st. paul] that the evil that [you]2374-you would not , that [you]2374-you do , like [St. Paul]252-st. paul and [myself]0-i and [sundry others]2375-sundry others , if [you]2374-you despise [stupid people]2376-stupid people , and know that [you]2374-you ought n't to despise [them]2376-stupid people , at the same time . Do n't [you]102-elisabeth know how [you]102-elisabeth are always coming upon [lovers]456-lovers in [country lanes]2480-country lanes , and how hard [they]456-lovers try to look as if [they]456-lovers were n't [there]658-there , and how badly [they]456-lovers succeed ? [I]0-i should dress [them]456-lovers entirely in green , faintly relieved by brown ; and then [they]456-lovers 'd look as if they were only part of the hedges and stiles . " "[2482-the lovers of the future] How [the lovers of the future]2482-the lovers of the future will bless [you]102-elisabeth ! " exclaimed [Lord Bobby]257-lord bobby . "[0-i] [I]0-i only regret that [my]0-i love - making days are over before [your]102-elisabeth patent costumes come out . " "[102-elisabeth] [I]0-i came upon [two young people]2487-two young people in [a lane]720-a lane not long ago , " said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , "[2487-two young people] and the minute [they]2487-two young people saw [me]0-i [they]2487-two young people began to walk in the ditches , one on one side of [the road]2489-the road and [one on the other]2490-one on the other . " "[2492-your mother - in - law] Ah ! " "[0-i] Except , perhaps , one coffee - cup in [the drawing - room]1850-the drawing - room the morning after a dinner party , " suggested [Farquhar]233-cecil . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth demurred . "[102-elisabeth] And suddenly there came over [her]102-elisabeth the memory of how , long years ago , [she]102-elisabeth used to dream that dream nearly every night . It was at the time when [she]102-elisabeth was first estranged from [Christopher]121-christopher , and when the wound of [his]121-christopher apparent indifference to [her]102-elisabeth was still fresh . Which of [us]2531-us has not experienced that strange dream - tenderness — often for [the most unlikely people]2532-the most unlikely people — which hangs about [us]2531-us for days after the dream has vanished , and invests the objects of it with an interest which [their]2530-their living presence never aroused ? In that old dream of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's [her]102-elisabeth affection for [Christopher]121-christopher was so great that when [he]121-christopher went away [she]102-elisabeth followed after [him]121-christopher , and sought [him]121-christopher for a long time in vain ; and when at last [she]102-elisabeth found [him]121-christopher [he]121-christopher was no longer the same Christopher that [he]121-christopher used to be , but there was an impassable barrier between [them]2530-their which [she]102-elisabeth fruitlessly struggled to break through . The agony of the fruitless struggle always awakened [her]102-elisabeth , so that [she]102-elisabeth never knew what the end of the dream was going to be . It was years since [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had dreamed this dream — years since [she]102-elisabeth had even remembered it — but [Cecil]233-cecil 's remark brought it all back to [her]102-elisabeth , as the scent of certain flowers brings back the memory of half - forgotten summer days ; and once again [she]102-elisabeth felt [herself]102-elisabeth drawn to [him]233-cecil by that bond of similarity which was so strong between [them]2530-their , and which is the most powerfully attractive force in [the world]301-the world — except , perhaps , the attractive force of contrast . [They]4405-these grand people do n't show it , and [we]4438-we do n't show it : [we]4438-we are all too well - mannered ; but [we]4438-we can not help knowing that [they]4405-these grand people are [not artists]4441-not artists any more than [they]4405-these grand people can help knowing that [we]4438-we are [not aristocrats]4442-not aristocrats . "[102-elisabeth] " Then are n't [you]102-elisabeth ever afraid of being looked down upon ? Of course [they]2980-other people would look down upon [me]102-elisabeth and make fun of [me]102-elisabeth if [I]102-elisabeth pretended to be one of [them]2980-other people , and [I]102-elisabeth should richly deserve it ; just as [we]4450-we look down upon and make fun of Philistines who cover [their]4451-their walls with paper fans and then pretend that [they]4451-their are [artists]4452-artists . Pretence is always vulgar and always ridiculous ; but [I]102-elisabeth know of nothing else that is either . "[102-elisabeth] " How splendid [you]102-elisabeth are ! "[2542-cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind] exclaimed [Cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind]2542-cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind always appealed , even if it was too high for [him]2542-cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind to attain to it . " Therefore [you]102-elisabeth will not despise [me]2542-cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind for being so inferior to [you]102-elisabeth — [you]102-elisabeth will only help [me]2542-cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind to grow more like [you]102-elisabeth , wo n't [you]102-elisabeth ? "[2542-cecil , to whose artistic sense fineness of any kind] And because [Cecil]233-cecil possessed the indefinable gift which [the world]301-the world calls charm , [Elisabeth straightway]102-elisabeth overlooked [his]233-cecil shortcomings , and set [herself]102-elisabeth to assist [him]233-cecil in correcting [them]2544-them . Perhaps there are few things in life more unfair than the certain triumph of [these individuals who have the knack of gaining the affection of [[their]2545-these individuals who have the knack of gaining the affection of their fellows fellows]966-their fellows]2545-these individuals who have the knack of gaining the affection of their fellows ; or more pathetic than the ultimate failure of [those who lack this special attribute]2547-those who lack this special attribute . The race may not be to the swift , nor the battle to the strong ; but both race and battle are , nine times out of ten , to [the man]3356-the man or [the woman who has mastered the art of first compelling devotion and then retaining it]2549-the woman who has mastered the art of first compelling devotion and then retaining it . It was the possession of this gift on the part of [King David]212-david , that made [men]445-men go in jeopardy of [their]445-men lives in order to satisfy [his]212-david slightest whim ; and it was because [the prophet Elijah]2551-the prophet elijah was [a solitary soul , commanding the fear rather than the love of]2552-a solitary soul , commanding the fear rather than the love of [men]445-men , that after [his]2551-the prophet elijah great triumph [he]2551-the prophet elijah fled into [the wilderness]3028-the wilderness and requested for [himself]2551-the prophet elijah that [he]2551-the prophet elijah might die . Nevertheless , it must not be forgotten that to [this lonely prophet]2555-this lonely prophet it was granted to see visions of angels and to hear [the still small Voice]2556-the still small voice ; and that , therefore , there are abundant compensations for [those men and [women who have not the knack of hearing and speaking the glib interchanges of affection]2558-women who have not the knack of hearing and speaking the glib interchanges of affection , current among [[their]2557-those men and women who have not the knack of hearing and speaking the glib interchanges of affection , current among their more attractive fellows more attractive fellows]2559-their more attractive fellows]2557-those men and women who have not the knack of hearing and speaking the glib interchanges of affection , current among their more attractive fellows . There is infinite pathos in the thought of [these solitary souls , yearning to hear and to speak words of loving greeting]2560-these solitary souls , yearning to hear and to speak words of loving greeting , and yet shut out — by some accident of mind or manner — from doing either the one or the other ; but when [their]2557-those men and women who have not the knack of hearing and speaking the glib interchanges of affection , current among their more attractive fellows turn comes to see visions of angels and to hear the still small Voice , [men]445-men need not pity [them]2557-those men and women who have not the knack of hearing and speaking the glib interchanges of affection , current among their more attractive fellows overmuch . When once [we]2562-we have seen [Him]2555-this lonely prophet as [He]2555-this lonely prophet is , it will matter but little to [us]2562-we whether [we]2562-we stood alone upon [the mountain]1833-the mountain in the wind and the earthquake and the fire , while [the Lord]2978-the lord passed by ; or whether [He]2555-this lonely prophet drew near and walked with [us]2562-we as [we]2562-we trod the busy ways of life , and was known of [us]2562-we , as [we]2562-we sat at meat , in breaking of bread . As [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth looked at [him]2555-this lonely prophet with eyes full of sympathy , [Cecil]233-cecil continued — " [I]233-cecil have had such a hard life , with [no one]3126-no one to care for [me]233-cecil ; and the hardness of [my]233-cecil lot has marred [my]233-cecil character , and — through that — [my]233-cecil art . "[233-cecil] " Tell [me]102-elisabeth about [your]2555-this lonely prophet life , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth said softly . " [I]102-elisabeth seem to know so little of [you]2555-this lonely prophet and yet to know [you]2555-this lonely prophet so well . "[102-elisabeth] " [You]2555-this lonely prophet shall read what back - numbers [I]233-cecil have , but most of them have been lost , so that [I]233-cecil have not read them [myself]233-cecil . [I]233-cecil really do n't know who [I]233-cecil am , as [[my]233-cecil father]1808-my father died when [I]233-cecil was [a baby]480-a baby , and [[my]233-cecil poor mother]4456-my poor mother followed [him]1808-my father in a few months , never having recovered from the shock of [his]1808-my father death . [I]233-cecil was born in [Australia]10-australia , at [Broken Hill]72-broken hill , and was [an only child]4457-an only child . As far as [I]233-cecil can make out , [[my]233-cecil parents]4458-my parents had [no relations]4459-no relations ; or , if [they]4458-my parents had , [they]4458-my parents had quarrelled with [them]4458-my parents all . [They]4458-my parents were very poor ; and when [they]4458-my parents died , leaving [one wretched little brat]4460-one wretched little brat behind [them]4458-my parents , [some kind friends]4461-some kind friends adopted [the poor beggar]4462-the poor beggar and carried [him]4462-the poor beggar off to [a sheep - farm]4463-a sheep - farm , where [they]4461-some kind friends brought [him]4462-the poor beggar up among [[their]4461-some kind friends own children]4464-their own children . "[233-cecil] " [Poor little lonely boy]4465-poor little lonely boy ! "[233-cecil] " [I]102-elisabeth was lonely — more lonely than [you]4466-you can imagine ; for , kind as [they]4461-some kind friends were to [me]102-elisabeth , [I]102-elisabeth was naturally not as dear to [them]4461-some kind friends as [[their]4461-some kind friends own children]4464-their own children . "[233-cecil] Here conversation was interrupted by [Lady Silverhampton]245-lady silverhampton 's voice calling [[her]245-lady silverhampton friends]464-her friends to lunch ; and [Cecil]233-cecil and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had to join [the others]3632-the others . " If any of [you]464-her friends are tired of life , "[4384-her ladyship] said [[her]245-lady silverhampton ladyship]4384-her ladyship , as [they]464-her friends sat down , " [I]257-lord bobby wish [you]464-her friends 'd try some of this lobster mayonnaise that [[my]257-lord bobby new cook]4490-my new cook has made , and report on it . To [me]257-lord bobby it looks the most promising prescription for death by torture . "[257-lord bobby] exclaimed [Lord Bobby]257-lord bobby , manfully helping [himself]257-lord bobby . And then the talk flowed on as pleasantly and easily as [the river]1149-the river , until it was time to land again and return to [town]4017-town . But for the rest of the day , and for many a day afterward , a certain uncomfortable suspicion haunted [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , which [she]102-elisabeth could not put away from [her]102-elisabeth , try as [she]102-elisabeth would ; a suspicion that , after all , [her]102-elisabeth throne was not as firmly fixed as [she]102-elisabeth had hoped and had learned to believe . The summer which brought fame to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , brought something better than fame to [Willie Tremaine]215-willie . All through the winter [the child]2988-the child had grown visibly feebler and frailer , and the warmer weather seemed to bring additional weakness rather than strength . In vain did [Alan]161-alan try to persuade [himself]161-alan that [Willie]215-willie was no worse this year than [he]215-willie had been other years , and that [he]215-willie soon would be all right again . As a matter of fact , [he]215-willie soon was all right again ; but not in the way which [[his]215-willie father]338-his father meant . [Caleb Bateson]127-caleb 's wisdom had been justified . Through [his]161-alan passionate love for [little Willie]215-willie , [Alan]161-alan had drawn near to [the kingdom of [God]105-god]2572-the kingdom of god ; not as yet to the extent of formulating any specific creed or attaching [himself]161-alan to [any special church]2573-any special church — that was to come later ; but [he]161-alan had learned , by the mystery of [his]161-alan own fatherhood , to stretch out groping hands toward the great Fatherhood that had called [him]161-alan into being ; and by [his]161-alan own love for [[his]161-alan suffering child]2574-his suffering child to know something of the Love that passeth knowledge . Therefore [Alan Tremaine]161-alan was [a better and wiser man]2575-a better and wiser man than [he]161-alan had been in times past . A strong friendship had gradually grown up between [himself]161-alan and [Christopher Thornley]121-christopher ; and it was a friendship which was good for both of [them]2576-them . Though [Christopher]121-christopher never talked about [his]121-christopher religious beliefs , [he]121-christopher lived them ; and it is living epistles such as this which are best known and read of [all thoughtful men]2577-all thoughtful men , and which — far more than all the books and sermons ever written — are gradually converting [the kingdoms of [this world]3177-this world]2578-the kingdoms of this world into [the kingdoms of [[our]2581-our Lord]2582-our lord and of [[His]2582-our lord Christ]2583-his christ]2580-the kingdoms of our lord and of his christ . [Alan]161-alan would have refuted — to [his]161-alan own satisfaction , if not to [Christopher's]265-christopher's — any arguments which [the latter]524-the latter might have brought forward in favour of Christianity ; but [he]161-alan could not refute the evidence of a life which could never have been lived but for that Other Life lived in [Judæa]86-judæa nineteen centuries ago . Perhaps [his]161-alan friendship with [Christopher]121-christopher did as much for [Alan]161-alan as [his]161-alan love for [Willie]215-willie in opening [his]161-alan eyes to the hidden things of [God]105-god . The intercourse with [the Tremaines]228-the tremaines was , on the other hand , of great advantage to [Christopher]121-christopher , as it afforded [him]121-christopher the opportunity of meeting and mixing with [men as clever]2585-men as clever and as cultivated as [himself]121-christopher , which is not always easy for [a lonely man in [a provincial town]2587-a provincial town who devotes [his]121-christopher loneliness to intellectual pursuits]2586-a lonely man in a provincial town who devotes his loneliness to intellectual pursuits . [Christopher]121-christopher was fast becoming [one of [the most influential men in [Mershire]2-mershire]2589-the most influential men in mershire]2588-one of the most influential men in mershire ; and [his]121-christopher able management of [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth had raised those works to a greater height of prosperity than [they]2590-they had ever attained before , even in the days of [William]98-william and [John Farringdon]97-john farringdon . But now the shadows were darkening around [Alan Tremaine]161-alan , as day by day [Willie]215-willie gradually faded away . [Felicia]231-felicia , too , at last awoke to the real state of the case , and , in [her]231-felicia way , was almost as anxious as [[her]231-felicia husband]490-her husband . During the spring - time , as [Willie]215-willie 's life grew shorter with the lengthening days , [the child]2988-the child 's chiefest delight lay in visits from [Christopher]121-christopher . For [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's sake [Christopher]121-christopher had always felt an interest in [little Willie]215-willie . Had not [her]102-elisabeth dear hands fondled [the child]2988-the child , before [they]2594-they were too busy to do anything but weave spells to charm [the whole world]3353-the whole world ? And had not [her]102-elisabeth warm heart enfolded [him]121-christopher , before [her]102-elisabeth success and [her]102-elisabeth fame had chilled its fires ? For the sake of [the Elisabeth]102-elisabeth that used to be , [Christopher]121-christopher would always be [a friend to [Willie]215-willie]2596-a friend to willie ; and [he]121-christopher did not find it hard to love [the child]2988-the child for [his]121-christopher own sake , since [Christopher]121-christopher had great powers of loving , and but little to expend them upon . As [Willie]215-willie continually asked for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , [Felicia]231-felicia wrote and told [her]102-elisabeth so ; and the moment [she]102-elisabeth found [she]102-elisabeth was wanted , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth came down to [the Willows]8-the willows for a week — though [her]102-elisabeth fame and the [London]15-london season were alike at [their]2598-their height — and went every day to see [Willie]215-willie at [the Moat House]762-the moat house . [He]215-willie loved to have [her]102-elisabeth with [him]215-willie , because [she]102-elisabeth talked to [him]215-willie about things that [[his]215-willie parents]983-his parents never mentioned to [him]215-willie ; and as these things were drawing nearer to [Willie]215-willie day by day , [his]215-willie interest in [them]2601-them unconsciously increased . [He]215-willie and [she]102-elisabeth had long talks together about [the country on the other side of the hills]2065-the country on the other side of the hills , and what delightful times [they]2603-they would have when [they]2603-they reached [it]2065-the country on the other side of the hills : how [Willie]215-willie would be able to walk as much as [he]215-willie liked , and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth would be able to love as much as [she]102-elisabeth wanted , and life generally would turn out to be a success — a thing which it so rarely does on [this side of [the hills]2074-the hills]2112-this side of the hills . [Christopher]121-christopher , as a rule , kept away from [the Moat House]762-the moat house when [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was [there]658-there ; [he]121-christopher thought [she]102-elisabeth did not wish to see [him]121-christopher , and [he]121-christopher was not [the type of man to go where [he]121-christopher imagined [he]121-christopher was not wanted]2608-the type of man to go where he imagined he was not wanted ; but one afternoon [they]2603-they met [there]658-there by accident , and [Christopher]121-christopher inwardly blessed the Fate which made [him]121-christopher do the very thing [he]121-christopher had so studiously refrained from doing . [He]121-christopher had been sitting with [Tremaine]215-willie , and [she]102-elisabeth with [Felicia]231-felicia and [Willie]215-willie ; and [they]2603-they met in [the hall]3059-the hall on [their]2603-they way out . " Are [you]121-christopher going [my]102-elisabeth way ? "[102-elisabeth] asked [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth graciously , when [they]2603-they had shaken hands . It was dull at [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill after [London]15-london , and the old flirting spirit woke up in [her]102-elisabeth and made [her]102-elisabeth want to flirt with [Christopher]121-christopher again , in spite of all that had happened . With [the born flirt]2611-the born flirt — as with [all born players of games]2612-all born players of games — the game itself is of more importance than the personality of [the other players]2613-the other players ; which sometimes leads to unfortunate mistakes on the part of [those players who do not rightly understand the rules of the game]2614-those players who do not rightly understand the rules of the game . " Yes , [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth , [I]121-christopher am , "[121-christopher] said [Christopher]121-christopher , who would have been going [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's way had that way led [him]121-christopher straight to ruin . With [him]121-christopher the personality of [the player]2615-the player — in this case , at least — mattered infinitely more than any game [she]102-elisabeth might choose to play . As long as [he]121-christopher was talking to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , [he]121-christopher did not care a straw what [they]2616-they were talking about ; which showed that [he]121-christopher really was culpably indifferent to — if not absolutely ignorant of — the rules of the game . " Then [we]2616-they might as well walk together . "[102-elisabeth] And [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth drew on [her]102-elisabeth long Suède gloves and leisurely opened [her]102-elisabeth parasol , as [they]2616-they strolled down [the drive]316-the drive after bidding farewell to [the Tremaines]228-the tremaines . [Christopher]121-christopher was silent from excess of happiness . It was so wonderful to be walking by [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's side again , and listening to [her]102-elisabeth voice , and watching the lights and shadows in those gray eyes of [hers]102-elisabeth which sometimes were so nearly blue . But [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth did not understand [his]121-christopher silence ; [she]102-elisabeth translated it , as [she]102-elisabeth would have translated silence on [her]102-elisabeth own part , into either boredom or ill - temper , and [she]102-elisabeth resented it accordingly . " [You]121-christopher are very quiet this afternoon . Are n't [you]121-christopher going to talk to [me]102-elisabeth ? "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said ; and [Christopher]121-christopher 's quick ear caught the sound of the irritation in [her]102-elisabeth voice , though [he]121-christopher could not for the life of [him]121-christopher imagine what [he]121-christopher had done to bring it there ; but it served to silence [him]121-christopher still further . " Yes — yes , of course [I]121-christopher am , "[121-christopher] [he]121-christopher said lamely ; " what shall [we]4491-we talk about ? [I]121-christopher am afraid there is nothing interesting to tell [you]102-elisabeth about [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth , things are going on so regularly there , and so well . "[121-christopher] How exactly like [Christopher]121-christopher to begin to talk about business when [she]102-elisabeth had given [him]121-christopher the chance to talk about more interesting subjects — [herself]102-elisabeth , for instance , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth thought ; but [he]121-christopher never had a mind above sordid details ! [She]102-elisabeth did not , of course , know that at that identical moment [he]121-christopher was wondering whether [her]102-elisabeth eyes were darker than they used to be , or whether [he]121-christopher had forgotten their exact shade ; [he]121-christopher could hardly have forgotten their colour , [he]121-christopher decided , as there had never been a day when [he]121-christopher had not remembered them since [he]121-christopher saw them last ; so they must actually be growing darker . " [I]102-elisabeth 'm glad of that , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth coldly , in [her]102-elisabeth most fine - ladylike manner . " It was distinctly kind of [you]121-christopher to find time to run down here , in the midst of [your]121-christopher [London]15-london life , to see [Willie]215-willie ! [He]121-christopher fretted after [you]121-christopher sadly , and [I]102-elisabeth am afraid [the poor little fellow]4492-the poor little fellow is not long for [this world]3177-this world . "[102-elisabeth] And [Christopher]121-christopher sighed . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth noted the sigh and approved of it . It was a comfort to find that [the man]3356-the man had feelings of any sort , [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth , even though only for [a child]3440-a child ; that was better than being entirely immersed in self - interest and business affairs . So [they]2620-they talked about [Willie]215-willie for a time , and the conversation ran more smoothly — almost pleasantly . Then [they]2620-they talked about books ; and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth — who had grown into the habit of thinking that [nobody outside [London]15-london]2621-nobody outside london knew anything — was surprised to find that [Christopher]121-christopher had read considerably more books than [she]102-elisabeth had read , and had understood them far more thoroughly . But this part of the conversation was inclined to be stormy ; since [Christopher]121-christopher as a rule disliked the books that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth liked , and this [she]102-elisabeth persisted in regarding as tantamount to disliking [herself]102-elisabeth . Whereupon [she]102-elisabeth became defiant , and told stories of [her]102-elisabeth life in [London]15-london of which [she]102-elisabeth knew [Christopher]121-christopher would disapprove . There was nothing in the facts that [he]121-christopher could possibly disapprove of , so [she]102-elisabeth coloured them up until there was ; and then , when [she]102-elisabeth had succeeded in securing [his]121-christopher disapproval , [she]102-elisabeth was furious with [him]121-christopher on account of it . Which was manifestly unfair , as [Christopher]121-christopher in no way showed the regret which [he]121-christopher could not refrain from experiencing , as [he]121-christopher listened to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth making [herself]102-elisabeth out so much more frivolous and heartless than [she]102-elisabeth really was . " This is the first time [I]121-christopher have had an opportunity of congratulating [you]102-elisabeth on [your]102-elisabeth success , "[121-christopher] [he]121-christopher said to [her]102-elisabeth at last ; " [we]4494-we are all very proud of it at [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill ; but , believe [me]121-christopher , there is [no one]3126-no one who rejoices in it a tithe as much as [I]121-christopher do , if [you]102-elisabeth will allow [me]121-christopher to say so . "[121-christopher] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was slightly mollified . [She]102-elisabeth had been trying all the time , as [she]102-elisabeth was so fond of trying years ago , to divert the conversation into more personal channels ; and [Christopher]121-christopher had been equally desirous of keeping it out of the same . But this sounded encouraging . " Thank [you]121-christopher so much , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth answered ; " it is very nice of [you]121-christopher all to be pleased with [me]102-elisabeth ! [I]102-elisabeth always adored being admired and praised , if [you]121-christopher remember . "[102-elisabeth] [Christopher]121-christopher remembered well enough ; but [he]121-christopher was not going to tell [this crushing fine lady]2622-this crushing fine lady how well [he]121-christopher remembered . If [he]121-christopher had not exposed [his]121-christopher heart for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth to peck at in the old days , [he]121-christopher certainly was not going to expose it now ; then [she]102-elisabeth would only have been scientifically interested — now [she]102-elisabeth would probably be disdainfully amused . " [I]102-elisabeth suppose [you]121-christopher saw [my]102-elisabeth picture in this year 's Academy , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth added . " Saw it ? [I]102-elisabeth should think [I]102-elisabeth did . [I]102-elisabeth went up to [town]4017-town on purpose to see it , as [I]102-elisabeth always do when [you]121-christopher have pictures on view at any of the shows . "[102-elisabeth] " And what did [you]121-christopher think of it ? "[121-christopher] [Christopher]121-christopher was silent for a moment ; then [he]121-christopher said — " Do [you]102-elisabeth want [me]121-christopher to say pretty things to [you]102-elisabeth or to tell [you]102-elisabeth the truth ? "[121-christopher] " Why , the truth , of course , "[102-elisabeth] replied [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , who considered that the two things were synonymous — or at any rate ought to be . " And [you]121-christopher wo n't be angry with [me]102-elisabeth , or think [me]102-elisabeth impertinent ? "[102-elisabeth] " Of course not , "[102-elisabeth] answered [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , who most certainly would ; and [Christopher — not having yet learned wisdom]121-christopher — believed [her]102-elisabeth . " [I]102-elisabeth thought it was a distinctly powerful picture — a distinctly remarkable picture — and if any one but [you]121-christopher had painted it , [I]102-elisabeth should have been delighted with it ; but somehow [I]102-elisabeth felt that it was not quite up to [your]121-christopher mark — that [you]121-christopher could do , and will do , better work . "[102-elisabeth] For a second [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was dumbfounded with amazement and indignation . How dare [this one man]2623-this one man dispute the verdict of [London]15-london ? Then [she]102-elisabeth said — " In what way do [you]2623-this one man think the work could have been done better ? "[102-elisabeth] " That is just what [I]102-elisabeth ca n't tell [you]121-christopher ; [I]102-elisabeth wish [I]102-elisabeth could ; but [I]102-elisabeth 'm not [an artist]567-an artist , unfortunately . It seems to [me]102-elisabeth that there are [other people]2980-other people ( not many , [I]102-elisabeth admit , but still some ) who could have painted that picture ; while [you]121-christopher are capable of doing work which [no one else in [the world]301-the world]4499-no one else in the world could possibly do . Naturally [I]102-elisabeth want to see [you]121-christopher do [your]121-christopher best , and am not satisfied when [you]121-christopher do anything less . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth tossed [her]102-elisabeth head . " [You]121-christopher are very hard to please , [Mr. Thornley]199-felicia . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth know [I]102-elisabeth am , where [your]121-christopher work is concerned ; but that is because [I]102-elisabeth have formed such a high ideal of [your]121-christopher powers . If [I]102-elisabeth admired [you]121-christopher less , [I]102-elisabeth should admire [your]121-christopher work more , do n't [you]121-christopher see ? "[102-elisabeth] But [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth did not see . [She]102-elisabeth possessed the true artist - spirit which craves for appreciation of its offspring more than for appreciation of itself — a feeling which perhaps [no one]3126-no one but [an artist]567-an artist or [a mother]1277-a mother really understands . [Christopher]121-christopher , being neither , did not understand it in the least , and erroneously concluded that adoration of [the creator]2627-the creator absolves [one]543-one from the necessity of admiration of the thing created . " [I]102-elisabeth shall never do a better piece of work than that , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth retorted , being imbued with the creative delusion that the latest creation is of necessity the finest creation . [No artist]2629-no artist could work at all if [he]2629-no artist did not believe that the work [he]2629-no artist was doing — or had just done — was the best piece of work [he]2629-no artist had ever done or ever should do . This is because [his]2629-no artist work , however good , always falls short of the ideal which inspired it ; and , while [he]2629-no artist is yet working , [he]2629-no artist can not disentangle the ideal from the reality . [He]2629-no artist must be at a little distance from [his]2629-no artist work until [he]2629-no artist can do this properly ; and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was as yet under the influence of that creative glamour which made [her]102-elisabeth see [her]102-elisabeth latest picture as it should be rather than as it was . " Oh , yes , [you]102-elisabeth will ; [you]102-elisabeth will fulfil [my]102-elisabeth ideal of [you]102-elisabeth yet . [I]102-elisabeth cherish no doubts on that score . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth ca n't think what [you]102-elisabeth see wrong in [my]102-elisabeth picture , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth somewhat pettishly . " [I]102-elisabeth do n't see anything wrong in it . Good gracious ! [I]102-elisabeth must have expressed [myself]102-elisabeth badly if [I]102-elisabeth conveyed such an impression to [you]102-elisabeth as that , and [you]102-elisabeth would indeed be justified in writing [me]102-elisabeth down an ass . [I]102-elisabeth think it is a wonderfully clever picture — so clever that [nobody]409-nobody but [you]102-elisabeth could ever paint a cleverer one . "[102-elisabeth] " Well , [I]102-elisabeth certainly could n't . [You]102-elisabeth must have formed an exaggerated estimate of [my]102-elisabeth artistic powers . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth think not ! [You]102-elisabeth can , and will , paint a distinctly better picture some day . "[102-elisabeth] " In what way better ? "[102-elisabeth] " Ah ! there [you]102-elisabeth have [me]102-elisabeth . But [I]102-elisabeth will try to tell [you]102-elisabeth what [I]102-elisabeth mean , though [I]102-elisabeth speak as [a fool]3876-a fool ; and if [I]102-elisabeth say anything very egregious , [you]102-elisabeth must let [my]102-elisabeth ignorance be [my]102-elisabeth excuse , and pardon the clumsy expression of [my]102-elisabeth intentions because they are so well meant . It does n't seem to [me]102-elisabeth to be enough for [anybody]376-anybody to do good work ; [they]376-anybody must go further , and do the best possible work in [their]376-anybody power . Nothing but one 's best is really worth the doing ; the cult of the second - best is always a degrading form of worship . Even though [one man]2021-one man 's second - best be intrinsically superior to the best work of [[his]2021-one man fellows]4505-his fellows , [he]2021-one man has nevertheless no right to offer it to [the world]301-the world . [He]2021-one man is guilty of an injustice both to [himself]2021-one man and [the world]301-the world in so doing . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth do n't agree with [you]102-elisabeth . This is an age of results ; and [the world]301-the world 's business is with the actual value of the thing done , rather than with the capabilities of [the man who did it]4509-the man who did it . "[102-elisabeth] " [You]102-elisabeth are right in calling this an age of results , [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth ; but that is the age 's weakness and not its strength . The moment [men]445-men begin to judge by results , [they]445-men judge unrighteous judgment . [They]445-men confound [the great man]577-the great man with [the successful man]4512-the successful man ; [the saint]4513-the saint with [the famous preacher]4514-the famous preacher ; the poet with [the writer of popular music - hall songs]4515-the writer of popular music - hall songs . "[102-elisabeth] " Then [you]102-elisabeth think that [we]4516-our should [all]3102-all do [our]4516-our best , and not bother [ourselves]4516-our too much as to results ? "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth go further than that ; [I]102-elisabeth think that the mere consideration of results incapacitates [us]4516-our from doing [our]4516-our best work at all . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth do n't agree with [you]102-elisabeth , "[102-elisabeth] repeated [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth haughtily . But , nevertheless , [she]102-elisabeth did . " [I]102-elisabeth daresay [I]102-elisabeth am wrong ; but [you]102-elisabeth asked [me]102-elisabeth for [my]102-elisabeth candid opinion and [I]102-elisabeth gave it to [you]102-elisabeth . It is a poor compliment to [flatter people]4518-flatter people — far too poor ever to be paid by [me]102-elisabeth to [you]102-elisabeth ; and in this case the simple truth is a far greater compliment than any flattery could be . [You]102-elisabeth can imagine what a high estimate [I]102-elisabeth have formed of [your]102-elisabeth powers , when so great a picture as [The Pillar of Cloud]266-the pillar of cloud fails to satisfy [me]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] The talk about [her]102-elisabeth picture brought to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's mind the remembrance of that other picture which had been almost as popular as [hers]102-elisabeth ; and , with it , the remembrance of [the man who had painted it]2630-the man who had painted it . " [I]102-elisabeth suppose [you]102-elisabeth have heard nothing more about [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth remarked , with apparent irrelevance . " [I]102-elisabeth wonder if [he]1997-george farringdon 's son will ever turn up ? "[102-elisabeth] " Oh ! "[121-christopher] For a moment [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth thought [she]102-elisabeth would tell [Christopher]121-christopher about [her]102-elisabeth suspicions as to the identity of [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil . But it was as yet merely a suspicion , and [she]102-elisabeth knew by experience how ruthlessly [Christopher]121-christopher pursued the line of duty whenever that line was pointed out to [him]121-christopher ; so [she]102-elisabeth decided to hold [her]102-elisabeth peace ( and [her]102-elisabeth property ) a little longer . But [she]102-elisabeth also knew that the influence of [Christopher]121-christopher was even yet so strong upon [her]102-elisabeth , that , when the time came , [she]102-elisabeth should do the right thing in spite of [herself]102-elisabeth and in defiance of [her]102-elisabeth own desires . And this knowledge , strange to say , irritated [her]102-elisabeth still further against [the innocent and unconscious Christopher]2631-the innocent and unconscious christopher . The walk from [the Moat House]762-the moat house to [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill was a failure as far as the re - establishment of friendly relations between [Christopher]121-christopher and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was concerned , for it left [her]102-elisabeth with the impression that [he]121-christopher was less appreciative of [her]102-elisabeth and more wrapped up in [himself]121-christopher and [his]121-christopher own opinions than ever ; while it conveyed to [his]121-christopher mind the idea that [her]102-elisabeth success had only served to widen the gulf between [them]2633-them , and that [she]102-elisabeth was more indifferent to and independent of [his]121-christopher friendship than [she]102-elisabeth had ever been before . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth went back to [London]15-london , and [Christopher]121-christopher to [his]121-christopher work again , and [little Willie]215-willie drew nearer and nearer to [the country on the other side of the hills]2065-the country on the other side of the hills ; until one day it happened that the gate which leads into [that country]3033-that country was left open by [the angels]1667-the angels , and [Willie]215-willie slipped through [it]2637-it and became strong and well . [[His]215-willie parents]983-his parents were left outside the gate , weeping , and at first [they]983-his parents refused to be comforted ; but after a time [Alan]161-alan learned the lesson which [Willie]215-willie had been sent to teach [him]215-willie , and saw plain . " [Dear]1798-dear , "[161-alan] [he]161-alan said to [[his]161-alan wife]3146-his wife at last , " [I]161-alan 've got to begin life over again so as to go the way that [Willie]215-willie went . It will be difficult for [us]4528-us , [I]161-alan know ; but [God]105-god will help [us]4528-us . "[161-alan] [Felicia]199-felicia looked at [him]161-alan with sad , despairing eyes . " There is [no God]4529-no god , "[3146-his wife] [she]3146-his wife said ; " [you]161-alan have often told [me]3146-his wife so . "[199-felicia] And then [Felicia]199-felicia laughed ; the first time that [she]2640-she had laughed since [Willie]215-willie 's death , and it was not a pleasant laugh to hear . " Do [you]199-felicia think [you]199-felicia can play pitch - and - toss with [a woman]469-a woman 's soul in that way ? Well , [you]199-felicia ca n't . "[161-alan] [Alan]161-alan 's face grew very white . " Good heavens ! [Felicia]199-felicia , did [I]161-alan do this ? "[199-felicia] " [You]199-felicia are wrong ; believe [me]161-alan , [you]199-felicia are wrong . "[161-alan] And [Alan]161-alan 's brow was damp with the anguish of [his]161-alan soul . " It is only what [you]199-felicia taught [me]161-alan . "[2641-i] And [she]2641-i went out of [the room]3736-the room in the patience of a great despair , and left [[her]2641-i husband]490-her husband alone with [his]490-her husband misery . The end of July was approaching , and the season was drawing to a close . [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had seen [each other]3364-each other frequently since [they]2645-they first met at [the Academy soirée]4326-the academy soirée , and had fallen into the habit of being much together ; consequently the thought of parting was pleasant to [neither of [them]2645-they]2647-neither of them . " How shall [I]233-cecil manage to live without [you]233-cecil ? "[233-cecil] asked [Cecil]233-cecil one day , as [they]2645-they were walking across [the Park]3636-the park together . " [I]233-cecil shall fall from [my]233-cecil ideals when [I]233-cecil am away from [your]233-cecil influence , and again become the grovelling worlding that [I]233-cecil was before [I]233-cecil met [you]233-cecil . "[233-cecil] " But [you]233-cecil must n't do anything of the kind . [I]233-cecil am not [the keeper of [your]233-cecil conscience]4538-the keeper of your conscience . "[233-cecil] " But [you]233-cecil are , and [you]233-cecil must be . [I]233-cecil feel [a good man]1600-a good man and [a strong one]4540-a strong one when [I]233-cecil am with [you]233-cecil , and as if all things were possible to [me]233-cecil ; and now that [I]233-cecil have once found [you]233-cecil , [I]233-cecil can not and will not let [you]233-cecil go . "[233-cecil] " [You]233-cecil will have to let [me]233-cecil go , [Mr. Farquhar]247-mr. farquhar ; for [I]233-cecil go down to [the Willows]8-the willows at the end of the month , and mean to stay there for some time . [I]233-cecil have enjoyed [my]233-cecil success immensely ; but it has tired [me]233-cecil rather , and made [me]233-cecil want to rest and be stupid again . "[233-cecil] " But [I]233-cecil can not spare [you]102-elisabeth , "[233-cecil] persisted [Cecil]233-cecil ; and there was real feeling in [his]233-cecil voice . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth represented so much to [him]233-cecil — wealth and power and the development of [his]233-cecil higher nature ; and although , had [she]102-elisabeth been [a poor woman]2649-a poor woman , [he]233-cecil would possibly never have cherished any intention of marrying [her]102-elisabeth , [his]233-cecil wish to do so was not entirely sordid . There are so few wishes in the hearts of any of [us]2650-us which are entirely sordid or entirely ideal ; yet [we]2650-us find it so difficult to allow for this in judging [one another]3051-one another . " Do n't [you]102-elisabeth understand , "[233-cecil] [Farquhar]233-cecil went on , " all that [you]102-elisabeth have been to [me]233-cecil : how [you]102-elisabeth have awakened the best that is in [me]233-cecil , and taught [me]233-cecil to be ashamed of the worst ?
