Not [I.]233-cecil "[233-cecil] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was silent . [She]102-elisabeth could not understand [herself]102-elisabeth , and this want of comprehension on [her]102-elisabeth part annoyed and disappointed [her]102-elisabeth . At last all [her]102-elisabeth girlish dreams had come true ; here was [the fairy prince for whom [she]102-elisabeth had waited for so long]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long — [a prince of [the kingdom [she]102-elisabeth loved]2654-the kingdom she loved above all others , the kingdom of art]2653-a prince of the kingdom she loved above all others , the kingdom of art ; and [he]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long came to [her]102-elisabeth in the spirit in which [she]102-elisabeth had always longed for [him]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long to come — the spirit of failure and of loneliness , begging [her]102-elisabeth to make up to [him]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long for all that [he]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long had hitherto missed in life . Yet — to [her]102-elisabeth surprise — [his]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long appeal found [her]102-elisabeth cold and unresponsive , as if [he]2652-the fairy prince for whom she had waited for so long were calling out for help to [another woman]1362-another woman and not to [her]102-elisabeth . [Cecil]233-cecil went on : " [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , wo n't [you]102-elisabeth be [[my]233-cecil wife]1113-my wife , and so make [me]233-cecil into the true artist which , with [you]102-elisabeth to help [me]233-cecil , [I]233-cecil feel [I]233-cecil am capable of becoming ; but of which , without [you]102-elisabeth , [I]233-cecil shall always fall short ? [You]102-elisabeth could do anything with [me]233-cecil — [you]102-elisabeth know [you]102-elisabeth could ; [you]102-elisabeth could make [me]233-cecil into [a great artist]3347-a great artist and [a good man]1600-a good man , but without [you]102-elisabeth [I]233-cecil can be neither . Surely [you]102-elisabeth will not give [me]233-cecil up now ! [You]102-elisabeth have opened to [me]233-cecil the door of [a paradise of which [I]233-cecil never dreamed before]4546-a paradise of which i never dreamed before , and now do n't shut it in [my]233-cecil face . "[233-cecil] " [I]102-elisabeth do n't want to shut it in [your]102-elisabeth face , "[102-elisabeth] replied [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth gently ; " surely [you]102-elisabeth know [me]102-elisabeth better than that . But [I]102-elisabeth feel that [you]102-elisabeth are expecting more of [me]102-elisabeth than [I]102-elisabeth can ever fulfil , and that some day [you]102-elisabeth will be sadly disappointed in [me]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] " No , no ; [I]102-elisabeth never shall . It is not in [you]102-elisabeth to disappoint [anybody]376-anybody , [you]102-elisabeth are so strong and good and true . Tell [me]102-elisabeth the truth : do n't [you]102-elisabeth feel that [I]102-elisabeth am as clay in [your]102-elisabeth hands , and that [you]102-elisabeth can do anything with [me]102-elisabeth that [you]102-elisabeth choose ? "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth looked [him]2656-him full in the face with [her]102-elisabeth clear gray eyes . " [I]102-elisabeth feel that [I]102-elisabeth could do anything with [you]102-elisabeth if only [I]102-elisabeth loved [you]102-elisabeth enough ; but [I]102-elisabeth also feel that [I]102-elisabeth do n't love [you]102-elisabeth , and that therefore [I]102-elisabeth can do nothing with [you]102-elisabeth at all . [I]102-elisabeth believe with [you]102-elisabeth that [a strong woman]1454-a strong woman can be the making of [a man [she]1454-a strong woman loves]4549-a man she loves ; but [she]1454-a strong woman must love [him]4549-a man she loves first , or else all [her]1454-a strong woman strength will be of no avail . "[102-elisabeth] [Farquhar]233-cecil 's face fell . " [I]233-cecil thought [you]102-elisabeth did love [me]233-cecil . [You]102-elisabeth always seemed so glad when [I]233-cecil came and sorry when [I]233-cecil left ; and [you]102-elisabeth enjoyed talking to [me]233-cecil , and [we]4550-we understood [each other]3364-each other , and were happy together . Can [you]102-elisabeth deny that ? "[233-cecil] " No ; it is all true . [I]102-elisabeth never enjoyed talking with [anybody]376-anybody more than with [you]102-elisabeth ; and [I]102-elisabeth certainly never in [my]102-elisabeth life met [any one who understood [my]102-elisabeth ways of looking at things as thoroughly as [you]102-elisabeth do , nor any one who entered so completely into all [my]102-elisabeth moods]4553-any one who understood my ways of looking at things as thoroughly as you do , nor any one who entered so completely into all my moods . As [a friend]1424-a friend [you]102-elisabeth are most satisfactory to [me]102-elisabeth , as [a comrade most delightful]4555-a comrade most delightful ; but [I]102-elisabeth can not help thinking that love is something more than that . "[102-elisabeth] " But it is n't , "[233-cecil] cried [Cecil]233-cecil eagerly ; " that is just where [lots of women]4556-lots of women make such a mistake . [They]4556-lots of women wait and wait for love all [their]4556-lots of women lives ; and find out too late that [they]4556-lots of women passed [him]4557-him by years ago , without recognising [him]4557-him , but called [him]4557-him by some wrong name , such as friendship and the like . "[233-cecil] " [I]102-elisabeth wonder if [you]233-cecil are right . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth am sure that [I]102-elisabeth am . [Women who are at all romantic]4558-women who are at all romantic , have such exaggerated ideas as to what love really is . Like [the leper of old]4559-the leper of old , [they]4558-women who are at all romantic ask for some great thing to work the wonderful miracle upon [their]4558-women who are at all romantic lives ; and so [they]4558-women who are at all romantic miss the simple way which would lead [them]4558-women who are at all romantic to happiness . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth felt troubled and perplexed . " [I]102-elisabeth enjoy [your]233-cecil society , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said , " and [I]102-elisabeth adore [your]233-cecil genius , and [I]102-elisabeth pity [your]233-cecil loneliness , and [I]102-elisabeth long to help [your]233-cecil weakness . Is this love , do [you]233-cecil think ? "[102-elisabeth] " Yes , yes ; [I]102-elisabeth am certain of it . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth thought it would be different , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth sadly ; " [I]102-elisabeth thought that when it did come it would transform [the whole world]3353-the whole world , just as religion does , and that all things would become new . [I]102-elisabeth thought it would turn out to be the thing that [we]4561-we are longing for when the beauty of nature makes [us]4561-we feel sad with a longing [we]4561-we know not for what . [I]102-elisabeth thought it would change life 's dusty paths into golden pavements , and [earth]614-earth 's commonest bramble - bush into a magic briar - rose . "[102-elisabeth] " And it has n't ? "[102-elisabeth] " No ; everything is just the same as it was before [I]233-cecil met [you]233-cecil . As far as [I]233-cecil can see , there is no livelier emerald twinkling in the grass of [the Park]3636-the park than there ever is at the end of July , and no purer sapphire melting into [the Serpentine]87-the serpentine . "[233-cecil] [Cecil]233-cecil laughed lightly . " [You]233-cecil are as absurdly romantic as [a school - girl]4564-a school - girl ! Surely [people of [our]4561-we age]4565-people of our age ought to know better than still to believe in fairyland ; but , as [I]233-cecil have told [you]233-cecil before , [you]233-cecil are dreadfully young for [your]233-cecil age in some things . "[233-cecil] " [I]102-elisabeth suppose [I]102-elisabeth am . [I]102-elisabeth still do believe in [fairyland]2084-fairyland — at least [I]102-elisabeth did until ten minutes ago . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth assure [you]233-cecil there is no such place . "[102-elisabeth] " Not for [anybody]376-anybody ? "[233-cecil] " Not for [anybody over twenty - one]4568-anybody over twenty - one . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]102-elisabeth wish there was , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth with a sigh . " [I]102-elisabeth should have liked to believe it was there , even if [I]102-elisabeth had never found it . "[102-elisabeth] " Do n't be silly , [lady mine]4569-lady mine . [You]4569-lady mine are so great and wise and clever that [I]102-elisabeth can not bear to hear [you]4569-lady mine say foolish things . And [I]102-elisabeth want [us]4570-us to talk about how [you]4569-lady mine are going to help [me]102-elisabeth to be [a great painter]4571-a great painter , and how [we]4570-us will sit together as [gods]4572-gods , and create [new worlds]4573-new worlds . There is nothing that [I]102-elisabeth can not do with [you]4569-lady mine to help [me]102-elisabeth , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . [You]4569-lady mine must be good to [me]102-elisabeth and hard upon [me]102-elisabeth at the same time . [You]4569-lady mine must never let [me]102-elisabeth be content with anything short of [my]102-elisabeth best , or willing to do second - rate work for the sake of money ; [you]4569-lady mine must keep the sacredness of art ever before [my]102-elisabeth eyes , but [you]4569-lady mine must also be very gentle to [me]102-elisabeth when [I]102-elisabeth am weary , and very tender to [me]102-elisabeth when [I]102-elisabeth am sad ; [you]4569-lady mine must encourage [me]102-elisabeth when [my]102-elisabeth spirit fails [me]102-elisabeth , and comfort [me]102-elisabeth when [the world]301-the world is harsh . All these things [you]4569-lady mine can do , and [you]4569-lady mine are the only woman who can . Promise [me]102-elisabeth , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , that [you]4569-lady mine will . "[102-elisabeth] " [I]233-cecil can not promise anything now . [You]4569-lady mine must let [me]233-cecil think it over for a time . [I]233-cecil am so puzzled by it all . [I]233-cecil thought that when [the right man]4239-the right man came and told [a woman]469-a woman that [he]4239-the right man loved [her]469-a woman , [she]469-a woman would know at once that it was for [him]4239-the right man — and for [him]4239-the right man only — that [she]469-a woman had been waiting all [her]469-a woman life ; and that [she]469-a woman would never have another doubt upon the subject , but would feel convinced that it was settled for all time and eternity . And this is so different ! "[233-cecil] Again [Cecil]233-cecil laughed [his]233-cecil light laugh . " [I]233-cecil suppose [girls]519-girls sometimes feel like that when [they]519-girls are very young ; but not [women of [your]102-elisabeth age]4578-women of your age , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . "[233-cecil] " Well , [you]102-elisabeth must let [me]233-cecil think about it . [I]233-cecil can not make up [my]233-cecil mind yet . "[233-cecil] And for whole days and nights [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth thought about it , and could come to no definite conclusion . There was no doubt in [her]102-elisabeth mind that [she]102-elisabeth liked [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil infinitely better than [she]102-elisabeth had liked [any of [the other men who had asked [her]102-elisabeth to marry [them]2659-them]2658-the other men who had asked her to marry them]2657-any of the other men who had asked her to marry them ; also that [no one]3126-no one could possibly be more companionable to [her]102-elisabeth than [he]233-cecil was , or more sympathetic with and interested in [her]102-elisabeth work — and this is no small thing to [the man or [woman who possesses the creative faculty]2662-woman who possesses the creative faculty]2661-the man or woman who possesses the creative faculty . Then [she]102-elisabeth was lonely in [her]102-elisabeth greatness , and longed for companionship ; and [Cecil]233-cecil had touched [her]102-elisabeth in [her]102-elisabeth tenderest point by [his]233-cecil constant appeals to [her]102-elisabeth to help and comfort [him]233-cecil . Nevertheless the fact remained that , though [he]233-cecil interested [her]102-elisabeth , [he]233-cecil did not touch [her]102-elisabeth heart ; that remained a closed door to [him]233-cecil . But supposing that [[her]102-elisabeth friends]464-her friends were right , and that [she]102-elisabeth was too cold by nature ever to feel the ecstasies which transfigure life for [some women]4250-some women , should [she]102-elisabeth therefore shut [herself]102-elisabeth out from ordinary domestic joys and interests ? Because [she]102-elisabeth was incapable of attaining to the ideal , must the commonplace pleasures of the real also be denied [her]102-elisabeth ? If the best was not for [her]102-elisabeth , would it not be wise to accept the second - best , and extract as much happiness from it as possible ? Moreover , [she]102-elisabeth knew that [Cecil]233-cecil was right when [he]233-cecil said that [she]102-elisabeth could make of [him]233-cecil whatsoever [she]102-elisabeth wished ; and this was no slight temptation to [a woman who loved power]2665-a woman who loved power as much as [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth loved it . There was also another consideration which had some weight with [her]102-elisabeth ; and that was the impression , gradually gaining strength in [her]102-elisabeth mind , that [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil was [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son . [She]102-elisabeth could take no steps in the way of proving this just then , as [Christopher]121-christopher was away for [his]121-christopher holiday somewhere in [the Black Forest]88-the black forest , and nothing could be done without [him]121-christopher ; but [she]102-elisabeth intended , as soon as [he]121-christopher returned , to tell [him]121-christopher of [her]102-elisabeth suspicion , and to set [him]121-christopher to discover whether or not [Cecil]233-cecil was indeed [the lost heir]4128-the lost heir . Although it never seriously occurred to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth to hold [her]102-elisabeth peace upon this matter and so keep [her]102-elisabeth fortune to [herself]102-elisabeth , [she]102-elisabeth was still human enough not altogether to despise a course of action which enabled [her]102-elisabeth to be rich and righteous at the same time , and to go on with [her]102-elisabeth old life at [the Willows]8-the willows and [her]102-elisabeth work among [the people at [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth]4213-the people at the osierfield , even after [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son had come into [his]1997-george farringdon 's son own . Although the balance of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's judgment was upon the side of [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil and [his]233-cecil suit , [she]102-elisabeth could not altogether stifle — try as [she]102-elisabeth might — [her]102-elisabeth sense of disappointment at finding how grossly poets and [such people]3821-such people had exaggerated the truth in [their]2671-their description of the feeling [men]445-men call love . It was all so much less exalted and so much more commonplace than [she]102-elisabeth had expected . [She]102-elisabeth had long ago come to the conclusion — from comparisons between [Christopher]121-christopher and [the men who had wanted to marry [her]102-elisabeth]2673-the men who had wanted to marry her — that [a man]310-a man 's friendship is a better thing than [a man]310-a man 's love ; but [she]102-elisabeth had always clung to the belief that [a woman]469-a woman 's love would prove a better thing than [a woman]469-a woman 's friendship : yet now [she]102-elisabeth [herself]102-elisabeth was in love with [Cecil]233-cecil — at least [he]233-cecil said that [she]102-elisabeth was , and [she]102-elisabeth was inclined to agree with [him]233-cecil — and [she]102-elisabeth was bound to admit that , as an emotion , this fell far short of [her]102-elisabeth old attachment to [Cousin Anne]120-cousin anne or [Christopher]121-christopher or even [Felicia]199-felicia . But that was because now [she]102-elisabeth was getting old , [she]102-elisabeth supposed , and [her]102-elisabeth heart had lost its early warmth and freshness ; and [she]102-elisabeth experienced a weary ache of regret that [Cecil]233-cecil had not come across [her]102-elisabeth path in those dear old days when [she]102-elisabeth was still young enough to make [a fairyland]2678-a fairyland for [herself]102-elisabeth , and to abide therein for ever . " The things that come too late are almost as bad as the things that never come at all , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth thought with a sigh ; not knowing that there is no such word as " too late "[105-god] in [God]105-god 's Vocabulary . At the end of the week [she]102-elisabeth had made up [her]102-elisabeth mind to marry [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil . [Women]446-women , after all , can not pick and choose what lives [they]446-women shall lead ; [they]446-women can only take such goods as [the gods]336-the gods choose to provide , and make the best of the same ; and if [they]446-women let the possible slip while [they]446-women are waiting for the impossible , [they]446-women have only [themselves]446-women to blame that [they]446-women extract no good at all out of life . So [she]102-elisabeth wrote to [Cecil]233-cecil , asking [him]233-cecil to come and see [her]102-elisabeth the following day ; and then [she]102-elisabeth sat down and wondered why [women]446-women are allowed to see visions and to dream dreams , if the actual is to fall so far short of the imaginary . Brick walls and [cobbled streets]2682-cobbled streets are all very well in [their]2683-their way ; but they make but dreary dwelling - places for those who have promised [themselves]2684-themselves [cities where the walls are of jasper and the pavements of gold]2685-cities where the walls are of jasper and the pavements of gold . " If [one]543-one is doomed to live always on [this side of the hills]2112-this side of the hills , it is a waste of time to think too much about the life on [the other side]4581-the other side , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth reasoned with [herself]102-elisabeth , " and [I]102-elisabeth have wasted a lot of time in this way ; but [I]102-elisabeth can not help wondering why [we]4582-we are allowed to think such lovely thoughts , and to believe in such beautiful things , if [our]4582-we dreams are never to come true , but are only to spoil [us]4582-we for the realities of life . Now [I]102-elisabeth must bury all [my]102-elisabeth dear , silly , childish idols , as [Jacob]116-jacob did ; and [I]102-elisabeth will not have any stone to mark [the place]691-the place , because [I]102-elisabeth want to forget where [it]691-the place is . "[102-elisabeth] [Poor Elisabeth]102-elisabeth ! The grave of what has been , may be kept green with tears ; but the grave of what never could have been , is best forgotten . [We]2686-we may not hide away the dear old gnomes and pixies and fairies in [consecrated ground]2687-consecrated ground — that is reserved for what has once existed , and so has the right to live again ; but for what never existed [we]2686-we can find no sepulchre , for it came out of nothingness , and to nothingness must it return . After [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had posted [her]102-elisabeth letter to [Cecil]233-cecil , and while [she]102-elisabeth was still musing over the problem as to whether life 's fulfilment must always fall short of its promise , [the drawing - room]1850-the drawing - room door was thrown open and [a visitor]2689-a visitor announced . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was tired and depressed , and did not feel in the mood for keeping up [her]102-elisabeth reputation for brilliancy ; so it was with a sigh of weariness that [she]102-elisabeth rose to receive [Quenelda Carson]267-quenelda , [a struggling little artist whom [she]102-elisabeth had known slightly for years]2690-a struggling little artist whom she had known slightly for years . But [her]102-elisabeth interest was immediately aroused when [she]102-elisabeth saw that [Quenelda]267-quenelda 's usually rosy face was white with anguish , and [the girl]629-the girl 's pretty eyes swollen with many tears . " What is the matter , [dear]1798-dear ? "[102-elisabeth] asked [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , with that sound in [her]102-elisabeth voice which made all weak things turn to [her]102-elisabeth . " [You]1798-dear are in trouble , and [you]1798-dear must let [me]102-elisabeth help [you]1798-dear . "[102-elisabeth] [Quenelda]267-quenelda broke out into bitter weeping . " Oh ! give [him]629-the girl back to [me]267-quenelda — give [him]629-the girl back to [me]267-quenelda , "[267-quenelda] [she]267-quenelda cried ; " [you]1798-dear can never love [him]629-the girl as [I]267-quenelda do , [you]1798-dear are too cold and proud and brilliant . "[267-quenelda] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth stood as if transfixed . " Whatever do [you]267-quenelda mean ? "[102-elisabeth] " [You]1798-dear have everything , "[267-quenelda] [Quenelda]267-quenelda went on , in spite of the sobs which shook [her]267-quenelda slender frame ; " [you]1798-dear had money and position to begin with , and [everybody]3055-everybody thought well of [you]1798-dear and admired [you]1798-dear and made life easy for [you]1798-dear . And then [you]1798-dear came out of [[your]1798-dear world]4586-your world into [ours]4587-we , and carried away the prizes which [we]4587-we had been striving after for years , and beat [us]4587-we on [our]4587-we own ground ; but [we]4587-we were n't jealous of [you]1798-dear — [you]1798-dear know that [we]4587-we were n't ; [we]4587-we were glad of [your]1798-dear success , and proud of [you]1798-dear , and [we]4587-we admired [your]1798-dear genius as much as [the outside world]4588-the outside world did , and never minded a bit that it was greater than [ours]4587-we . But even then [you]1798-dear were not content — [you]1798-dear must have everything , and leave [us]4587-we nothing , just to satisfy [your]1798-dear pride . [You]1798-dear are like [the rich man who had everything]4589-the rich man who had everything , and yet took from [the poor man [his]4589-the rich man who had everything one ewe lamb]4590-the poor man his one ewe lamb ; and [I]267-quenelda am sure that [God]105-god — if there is [a God]1373-a god — will punish [you]1798-dear as [He]105-god punished [that rich man]4592-that rich man . "[267-quenelda] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth turned rather pale ; whatever had [she]102-elisabeth done that [any one]639-any one dared to say such things to [her]102-elisabeth as this ? " [I]102-elisabeth still do n't understand [you]102-elisabeth , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said . " [I]629-the girl never had anything nice in [my]629-the girl life till [I]629-the girl met [him]105-god , "[629-the girl] [the girl]629-the girl continued incoherently—"I had always been poor and pinched and wretched and second - rate ; even [my]629-the girl pictures were never first - rate , though [I]629-the girl worked and worked all [I]629-the girl knew to make them so . And then [I]629-the girl met [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil , and [I]629-the girl loved [him]105-god , and everything became different , and [I]629-the girl did n't mind being second - rate if only [he]105-god would care for [me]629-the girl . And [he]105-god did ; and [I]629-the girl thought that [I]629-the girl should always be as happy as [I]629-the girl was then , and that nothing would ever be able to hurt [me]629-the girl any more . Oh ! [I]629-the girl was so happy — so happy — and [I]629-the girl was such [a fool]3876-a fool , [I]629-the girl thought it would last forever ! [I]629-the girl worked hard and saved every penny that [I]629-the girl could , and so did [he]105-god ; and [we]4594-we should have been married next year if [you]4595-you had n't come and spoiled it all , and taken [him]105-god away from [me]629-the girl . And what is it to [you]4595-you now that [you]4595-you have got [him]105-god ? [You]4595-you are too proud and cold to love [him]105-god , or [anybody else]2032-anybody else , and [he]105-god does n't care for [you]4595-you a millionth part as much as [he]105-god cares for [me]629-the girl ; yet just because [you]4595-you have money and fame [he]105-god has left [me]629-the girl for [you]4595-you . And [I]629-the girl love [him]105-god so — [I]629-the girl love [him]105-god so ! "[629-the girl] Here [Quenelda]267-quenelda 's sobs choked [her]267-quenelda utterance , and [her]267-quenelda torrent of words was stopped by tears . " Come and sit down beside [me]102-elisabeth and tell [me]102-elisabeth quietly what is the matter , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth gently ; " [I]102-elisabeth can do nothing and understand nothing while [you]4595-you go on like this . But [you]4595-you are wrong in supposing that [I]102-elisabeth took [[your]4595-you lover]4597-your lover from [you]4595-you purposely ; [I]102-elisabeth did not even know that [he]105-god was [a friend of [yours]4595-you]4598-a friend of yours . [He]105-god ought to have told [me]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] " No , no ; [he]105-god could n't tell [you]4595-you . Do n't [you]4595-you see that the temptation was too strong for [him]105-god ? [He]105-god cares so much for rank and money , and things like that , [[my]102-elisabeth poor [Cecil]233-cecil]4599-my poor cecil ! And all [his]105-god life [he]105-god has had to do without [them]4600-them . So when [he]105-god met [you]4595-you , and realized that if [he]105-god married [you]4595-you [he]105-god would have all the things [he]105-god wanted most in [the world]301-the world , [he]105-god could n't resist it . The fault was [yours]4595-you for tempting [him]105-god , and letting [him]105-god see that [he]105-god could have [you]4595-you for the asking ; [you]4595-you knew [him]105-god well enough to see how weak [he]105-god was , and what a hold worldly things had over [him]105-god ; and [you]4595-you ought to have allowed for this in dealing with [him]105-god . "[102-elisabeth] A great wave of self - contempt swept over [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth , who had prided [herself]102-elisabeth upon the fact that [no man]521-no man was strong enough to win [her]102-elisabeth love , to be accused of openly running after [a man who did not care for [her]102-elisabeth but only for [her]102-elisabeth money]2695-a man who did not care for her but only for her money ! It was unendurable , and stung [her]102-elisabeth to the quick ! And yet , through all [her]102-elisabeth indignation , [she]102-elisabeth recognised the justice of [her]102-elisabeth punishment . [She]102-elisabeth had not done what [Quenelda]267-quenelda had reproached [her]102-elisabeth for doing , it was true ; but [she]102-elisabeth had deliberately lowered [her]102-elisabeth ideal : [she]102-elisabeth had wearied of striving after the best , and had decided that the second - best should suffice [her]102-elisabeth ; and for this [she]102-elisabeth was now being chastised . [No men]2696-no men or women who wilfully turn away from the ideal which [God]105-god has set before [them]2696-no men , and make to [themselves]2696-no men graven images of the things which [they]2696-no men know to be unworthy , can escape the punishment which is sure , sooner or later , to follow [their]2696-no men apostasy ; and [they]2696-no men do well to recognise this , ere [they]2696-no men grow weary of waiting for the revelation from [Sinai]268-sinai , and begin to build altars unto [false gods]2697-false gods . For now , as of old , the idols which [they]2696-no men make are ground into powder , and strawed upon the water , and given [them]2696-no men to drink ; the cup has to be drained to the dregs , and it is exceeding bitter . " [I]102-elisabeth still think [he]105-god ought to have told [me]102-elisabeth there was [another woman]1362-another woman , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth said . " Not [he]105-god . [He]105-god knew well enough that [your]4603-you pride could not have endured the thought of [another woman]1362-another woman , and that that would have spoiled [his]105-god chance with [you]4603-you forever . There always is [another woman]1362-another woman , [you]4603-you know ; and [[you]4603-you women , who are too proud to endure the thought of [her]1362-another woman]4606-you women , who are too proud to endure the thought of her , have to be deceived and blinded . And [you]4603-you have only [yourselves]4603-you to thank for it ; if [you]4603-you were a little more human and a little more tender , there would be no necessity for deceiving [you]4603-you . Why , [I]102-elisabeth should have loved [him]105-god just the same if there had been [a hundred other women]4607-a hundred other women , so [he]105-god always told [me]102-elisabeth the truth ; but [he]105-god lied to [you]4603-you , and it was [your]4603-you fault and not [his]105-god that [he]105-god was obliged to lie . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth shuddered . It was to help [such a man as this]2698-such a man as this that [she]102-elisabeth had been willing to sacrifice [her]102-elisabeth youthful ideals and [her]102-elisabeth girlish dreams . What [a fool]3876-a fool [she]102-elisabeth had been ! " If [you]4603-you do not believe [me]267-quenelda , here is [his]105-god letter , "[267-quenelda] [Quenelda]267-quenelda went on ; " [I]267-quenelda brought it on purpose for [you]4603-you to read , just to show [you]4603-you how little [you]4603-you are to [him]105-god . If [you]4603-you had loved [him]105-god as [I]267-quenelda love [him]105-god , [I]267-quenelda would have let [you]4603-you keep [him]105-god , because [you]4603-you could have given [him]105-god so many of the things that [he]105-god thinks most about . But [you]4603-you do n't . [You]4603-you are [one of [the cold , hard women]4609-the cold , hard women , who only care for [people]2982-people as long as [they]2982-people are good and do what [you]4603-you think [they]2982-people ought to do]4608-one of the cold , hard women , who only care for people as long as they are good and do what you think they ought to do ; [Cecil]233-cecil never could do what [anybody]376-anybody thought [he]233-cecil ought to do for long , and then [you]4603-you would have despised [him]105-god and grown tired of [him]105-god . But [I]267-quenelda go on loving [him]105-god just the same , whatever [he]105-god does ; and that 's the sort of love that [a man]310-a man wants — at any rate , [such a man as [Cecil]233-cecil]4613-such a man as cecil . "[267-quenelda] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth held out [her]102-elisabeth hand for the letter ; [she]102-elisabeth felt that speech was of no avail at such a crisis as this ; and , as [she]102-elisabeth read , every word burned itself into [her]102-elisabeth soul , and hurt [her]102-elisabeth pride to the quick . " [Dearest Quenelda]269-quenelda "[267-quenelda] ( the letter ran , in the slightly affected handwriting which [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had learned to know so well , and to welcome with so much interest ) , " [I]267-quenelda have something to say to [you]4603-you which it cuts [me]267-quenelda to the heart to say , but which has to be said at all costs . [We]4614-we must break off [our]4614-we engagement at once ; for the terrible truth has at last dawned upon [me]267-quenelda that [we]4614-we can never afford to marry [each other]3364-each other , and that therefore it is only prolonging [our]4614-we agony to go on with it . [You]4603-you know [me]267-quenelda so well , [dear little girl]4616-dear little girl , that [you]4603-you will quite understand how the thought of life - long poverty has proved too much for [me]267-quenelda . [I]267-quenelda am not made of such coarse fibre as [most men]3848-most men — [those men who can face squalor and privation , and lack all the little accessories that make life endurable , without being any the worse for it]4618-those men who can face squalor and privation , and lack all the little accessories that make life endurable , without being any the worse for it . [I]267-quenelda am too refined , too highly strung , too sensitive , to enter upon such a weary struggle with circumstances as [my]267-quenelda marriage with [a woman as poor as [myself]267-quenelda]4619-a woman as poor as myself would entail ; therefore , [[my]267-quenelda darling]1772-my darling [Quenelda]269-quenelda , much as [I]267-quenelda love [you]269-quenelda [I]267-quenelda feel it is [my]267-quenelda duty to renounce [you]269-quenelda ; and as [you]269-quenelda grow older and wiser [you]269-quenelda will see that [I]267-quenelda am right . "[267-quenelda] Since [I]0-i can not marry [you]2700-you whom [I]0-i love , [I]0-i have put romance and sentiment forever out of [my]0-i life ; it is a bitter sacrifice for [a man of [my]0-i nature]2701-a man of my nature to make , but it must be done ; and [I]0-i have decided to enter upon a mariage de convenance with [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth , [the Black Country heiress]2702-the black country heiress . Of course [I]0-i do not love [her]102-elisabeth as [I]0-i love [you]2700-you , [[my]0-i sweet]2703-my sweet — what [man]603-man could love [a genius]2299-a genius as [he]603-man loves [a beauty]2706-a beauty ? And [she]102-elisabeth is as cold as [she]102-elisabeth is clever . But [I]0-i feel respect for [her]102-elisabeth moral characteristics , and interest in [her]102-elisabeth mental ones ; and , when youth and romance are over and done with , that is all [one]543-one need ask in [a wife]311-a wife . As for [her]102-elisabeth fortune , it will keep [me]0-i forever out of the reach of that poverty which has always so deleterious an effect upon natures such as [mine]0-i ; and , being thus set above those pecuniary anxieties which are the death of true art , [I]0-i shall be able fully to develop the power that is in [me]0-i , and to do the work that [I]0-i feel [myself]0-i called to do . " Good - bye , [[my]2709-my sweetest]4621-my sweetest . [I]2709-my can not write any more ; [my]2709-my heart is breaking . How cruel it is that poverty should have power to separate forever such [true lovers]4622-true lovers as [you]269-quenelda and [I]2709-my ! "[2709-my] [Your]2709-my heartbroken " [Cecil]233-cecil . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth gave back the letter to [Quenelda]269-quenelda . " Do [you]269-quenelda mean to tell [me]102-elisabeth that [you]269-quenelda do n't despise [the man who sent this]4623-the man who sent this ? "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth asked . " No ; because [I]102-elisabeth love [him]4623-the man who sent this , [you]269-quenelda see . [You]269-quenelda never did . "[102-elisabeth] " [You]269-quenelda are right there . [I]629-the girl never loved [him]4623-the man who sent this . [I]629-the girl tried to love [him]4623-the man who sent this , but [I]629-the girl could n't . "[629-the girl] " [I]102-elisabeth know [you]269-quenelda did n't . As [I]102-elisabeth told [you]269-quenelda before , if [you]269-quenelda had loved [him]4623-the man who sent this [I]102-elisabeth would have given [him]4623-the man who sent this up to [you]269-quenelda . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth looked at [the girl]629-the girl before [her]102-elisabeth with wonder . What a strange thing this love was , which could make [a woman]469-a woman forgive such a letter as that , and still cling to [the man who wrote it]2712-the man who wrote it ! So there was such [a place as fairyland]2713-a place as fairyland after all , and [poor little Quenelda]269-quenelda had found [it]2713-a place as fairyland ; while [she]269-quenelda , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , had never so much as peeped through the gate . It had brought [Quenelda]269-quenelda much sorrow , it was true ; but still it was good to have been [there]658-there ; and a chilly feeling crept across [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's heart as [she]102-elisabeth realized how much [she]102-elisabeth had missed in life . " [I]102-elisabeth think if [one]543-one loved [another person]3077-another person as much as that , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth , " [one]543-one would understand a little of how [God]105-god feels about [us]4627-us . "[102-elisabeth] Aloud [she]102-elisabeth said : " [Dear]1798-dear , what do [you]1798-dear want [me]102-elisabeth to do ? [I]102-elisabeth will do anything in [the world]301-the world that [you]1798-dear wish . "[102-elisabeth] [Quenelda]269-quenelda seized [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's hand and kissed it . " How good [you]102-elisabeth are ! And [I]269-quenelda do n't deserve it a bit , for [I]269-quenelda 've been horrid to [you]102-elisabeth and said vile things . "[269-quenelda] There was a vast pity in [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's eyes . " [I]102-elisabeth did [you]1798-dear a great wrong , [poor child]3675-poor child ! "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said ; " and [I]102-elisabeth want to make every reparation in [my]102-elisabeth power .
