"[102-elisabeth] " Oh ! no ; please not . [He]233-cecil would never forgive [me]102-elisabeth for having spoiled [his]233-cecil life , and taken away [his]233-cecil chance of being rich . "[102-elisabeth] And [Quenelda]269-quenelda 's tears flowed afresh . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth put [her]102-elisabeth strong arm round [the girl]629-the girl 's slim waist . " Do n't cry , [dear]1798-dear ; [I]102-elisabeth will make it all right . [I]102-elisabeth will just tell [him]233-cecil that [I]102-elisabeth ca n't marry [him]233-cecil because [I]102-elisabeth do n't love [him]233-cecil ; and [he]233-cecil need never know that [I]102-elisabeth have heard about [you]1798-dear at all . "[102-elisabeth] And [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth continued to comfort [Quenelda]269-quenelda until the pale cheeks grew pink again , and half [the girl]629-the girl 's beauty came back ; and [she]269-quenelda went away at last believing in [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's power of setting everything right again , as [one]543-one believes in [[one]543-one 's mother]2719-one 's mother 's power of setting everything right again when [one]543-one is [a child]3440-a child . After [she]269-quenelda had gone , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth sat down and calmly looked [facts]2722-facts in the face ; and the prospect was by no means an agreeable one . Of course there was no question now of marrying [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil ; and in the midst of [her]102-elisabeth confusion [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth felt a distinct sense of relief that this at any rate was impossible . [She]102-elisabeth could still go on believing in [fairyland]2084-fairyland , even though [she]102-elisabeth never found it ; and it is always far better not to find [a place]2724-a place than to find there is [no such place]2725-no such place at all . But [she]102-elisabeth would have to give up [the Willows]8-the willows and [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth , and all the wealth and position that these had brought [her]102-elisabeth ; and this was a bitter draught to drink . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth felt no doubt in [her]102-elisabeth own mind that [Cecil]233-cecil was indeed [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son ; [she]102-elisabeth had guessed it when first [he]233-cecil told [her]102-elisabeth the story of [his]233-cecil birth , and subsequent conversations with [him]233-cecil had only served to confirm [her]102-elisabeth in the belief ; and it was this conviction which had influenced [her]102-elisabeth to some extent in [her]102-elisabeth decision to accept [him]233-cecil . But now everything was changed . [Cecil]233-cecil would rule at [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth and [Quenelda]269-quenelda at [the Willows]8-the willows instead of [herself]102-elisabeth , and those dearly loved places would know [her]102-elisabeth no more . At this thought [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth broke down . How [she]102-elisabeth loved [every stone of [the Black Country]18-the black country]2727-every stone of the black country , and how closely all [her]102-elisabeth childish fancies and girlish dreams were bound up in it ! Now the cloud of smoke would hang over [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill , and [she]102-elisabeth would not be there to interpret its message ; and the sun would set beyond [the distant mountains]2728-the distant mountains , and [she]102-elisabeth would no longer catch glimpses of [the country]3528-the country over [the hills]2074-the hills . Even the rustic seat , where [she]102-elisabeth and [Christopher]121-christopher had sat so often , would be [hers]102-elisabeth no longer ; and [he]121-christopher and [she]102-elisabeth would never walk together in [the woods]3637-the woods as [they]2732-they had so often walked as [children]553-children . And as [she]102-elisabeth cried softly to [herself]102-elisabeth , with [no one]3126-no one to comfort [her]102-elisabeth , the memory of [Christopher]121-christopher swept over [her]102-elisabeth , and with it all the old anger against [him]121-christopher . [He]121-christopher would be glad to see [her]102-elisabeth dethroned at last , [she]102-elisabeth supposed , as that was what [he]121-christopher had striven for all those years ago ; but , perhaps , when [he]121-christopher saw [a stranger]766-a stranger reigning at [the Willows]8-the willows and [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth in [her]102-elisabeth stead , [he]121-christopher would be sorry to find [the new government]2736-the new government so much less beneficial to [the work - people]1681-the work - people than [the old one]674-the old one had been ; for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth knew [Cecil]233-cecil quite well enough to be aware that [he]233-cecil would spend all [his]233-cecil money on [himself]233-cecil and [his]233-cecil own pleasures ; and [she]102-elisabeth could not help indulging in an unholy hope that , whereas [she]102-elisabeth had beaten [Christopher]121-christopher with whips , [[her]102-elisabeth successor]2739-her successor would beat [him]121-christopher with scorpions . In fact [she]102-elisabeth was almost glad , for the moment , that [Farquhar]233-cecil was so unfit for the position to which [he]233-cecil was now called , when [she]102-elisabeth realized how sorely that unfitness would try [Christopher]121-christopher . " It will serve [him]121-christopher right for leaving [me]102-elisabeth and going off after [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth , " to discover how little worth the finding [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son really was ! [Christopher]121-christopher is so self - centred , that a thing is never properly brought [home]399-home to [him]121-christopher until it affects [himself]121-christopher ; [no other person]4636-no other person can ever convince [him]121-christopher that [he]121-christopher is in the wrong . But this will affect [himself]121-christopher ; [he]121-christopher will hate to serve under [such a man as [Cecil]233-cecil]4613-such a man as cecil ; [I]102-elisabeth know [he]121-christopher will ; because [Cecil]233-cecil is just the type of person that [Christopher]121-christopher has always looked down upon , for [Christopher]121-christopher is [a gentleman]517-a gentleman and [Cecil]233-cecil is not . Perhaps when [he]121-christopher finds out how inferior [an iron - master Cecil]4639-an iron - master cecil is to [me]102-elisabeth , [Christopher]121-christopher will wish that [he]121-christopher had liked [me]102-elisabeth better and been kinder to [me]102-elisabeth when [he]121-christopher had a chance . [I]102-elisabeth hope [he]121-christopher will , and that it will make [him]121-christopher miserable ; for [those hard , self - righteous people]4640-those hard , self - righteous people really deserve to be punished in the end . "[102-elisabeth] And [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth derived so much comfort from the prospect of [Christopher]121-christopher 's coming trials , that [she]102-elisabeth almost forgot [her]102-elisabeth own . That night [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth wrote to [Christopher Thornley]121-christopher , telling [him]121-christopher that [she]102-elisabeth believed [she]102-elisabeth had found [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son at last , and asking [him]121-christopher to come up to [London]15-london in order to facilitate the giving up of [[her]102-elisabeth kingdom]4086-her kingdom into the hands of [the rightful owner]2742-the rightful owner . And , in so doing , [she]102-elisabeth was conscious of a feeling of satisfaction that [Christopher]121-christopher should see for [himself]121-christopher that [she]102-elisabeth was not as mercenary as [he]121-christopher had once imagined [her]102-elisabeth to be , but that [she]102-elisabeth was as ready as [he]121-christopher had ever been to enable [the king]3605-the king to enjoy [his]121-christopher own again as soon as [that king]2744-that king appeared upon the scene . To forsake [the reigning queen]2745-the reigning queen in order to search for [that king]2744-that king , was , of course , a different matter , and one about which [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth declined to see eye to eye with [[her]102-elisabeth manager]2747-her manager even now . Doubtless [he]121-christopher had been in the right all through , and [she]102-elisabeth in the wrong , as [all honourable people]2748-all honourable people could see for [themselves]2748-all honourable people ; but when [one]543-one happens to be [the queen]637-the queen [one]543-one 's self , [one]543-one 's perspective is apt to become blurred and [one]543-one 's sense of abstract justice confused . It is so easy for all of [us]2754-us to judge righteous judgment concerning matters which in no way affect [ourselves]2754-us . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was still angry with [Christopher]121-christopher because [she]102-elisabeth had deliberately made the worst of [herself]102-elisabeth in [his]121-christopher eyes . It was totally unjust — and entirely feminine — to lay the blame of this on [his]121-christopher shoulders ; as a matter of fact , [he]121-christopher had had nothing at all to do with it . [She]102-elisabeth had purposely chosen a path of life of which [she]102-elisabeth knew [he]121-christopher would disapprove , principally in order to annoy [him]121-christopher ; and then [she]102-elisabeth had refused to forgive [him]121-christopher for feeling the annoyance which [she]102-elisabeth had gone out of [her]102-elisabeth way to inflict . From the purely feminine standpoint [her]102-elisabeth behaviour was thoroughly consistent ; [a man]310-a man , however , might in [his]310-a man ignorance have accused [her]102-elisabeth of inconsistency . But [men]445-men know so little about some things ! The following afternoon [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil came to see [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , as [she]102-elisabeth had bidden [him]233-cecil ; and [she]102-elisabeth smiled grimly to [herself]102-elisabeth as [she]102-elisabeth realized the difference between what [she]102-elisabeth had intended to say to [him]233-cecil when [she]102-elisabeth told [him]233-cecil to come , and what [she]102-elisabeth was actually going to say . As for [him]233-cecil , [he]233-cecil was full of hope . Evidently [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth meant to marry [him]233-cecil and make [him]233-cecil into [a rich man]2757-a rich man ; and money was the thing [he]233-cecil loved best in [the world]301-the world . Which of [us]2759-we would not be happy if [we]2759-we thought [we]2759-we were about to win the thing [we]2759-we loved best ? And is it altogether [our]2759-we own fault if the thing [we]2759-we happen to love best be unworthy of love , or is it only [our]2759-we misfortune ? Because [he]233-cecil was triumphant , [Cecil]233-cecil looked handsomer than usual , for there are few things more be coming than happiness ; and as [he]233-cecil entered [the room]3736-the room , radiant with that vitality which is so irresistibly attractive , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth recognised [his]233-cecil charm without feeling it , just as [one]543-one sees [people speaking and gesticulating in the distance without hearing a word of what is said]2762-people speaking and gesticulating in the distance without hearing a word of what is said . " [[My]102-elisabeth dear lady]4641-my dear lady , [you]102-elisabeth are going to say yes to [me]102-elisabeth ; [I]102-elisabeth know that [you]102-elisabeth are ; [you]102-elisabeth would not have sent for [me]102-elisabeth if [you]102-elisabeth were not , for [you]102-elisabeth are far too tender - hearted to enjoy seeing pain which [you]102-elisabeth are forced to give . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth looked grave , and did not take [his]233-cecil outstretched hand . " Will [you]233-cecil sit down ? "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said ; " there is much that [I]102-elisabeth want to talk over with [you]233-cecil . "[102-elisabeth] [Cecil]233-cecil 's face fell . In a superficial way [he]233-cecil was wonderfully quick in interpreting moods and reading character ; and [he]233-cecil knew in a moment that , through some influence of which [he]233-cecil was as yet in ignorance , such slight hold as [he]233-cecil had once had upon [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had snapped and broken since [he]233-cecil saw [her]102-elisabeth last . " Surely [you]102-elisabeth are not going to refuse to marry [me]233-cecil and so spoil [my]233-cecil life . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , [you]102-elisabeth can not be as cruel as this , after all that [we]4642-we have been to [each other]3364-each other . "[233-cecil] " [I]233-cecil am going to refuse to marry [you]102-elisabeth , but [I]233-cecil am not going to spoil [your]102-elisabeth life . Believe [me]233-cecil , [I]233-cecil am not . There are other things in [the world]301-the world besides love and marriage . "[233-cecil] [Cecil]233-cecil sank down into a seat , and [his]233-cecil chin twitched . " Then [you]102-elisabeth have played with [me]233-cecil most abominably . [The world]301-the world was right when it called [you]102-elisabeth [a heartless flirt]4646-a heartless flirt , and said that [you]102-elisabeth were too cold to care for anything save pleasure and admiration . [I]233-cecil thought [I]233-cecil knew [you]102-elisabeth better , more fool [I]233-cecil ! But [the world]301-the world was right and [I]233-cecil was wrong . "[233-cecil] " [I]102-elisabeth do n't think that [we]4648-we need discuss [my]102-elisabeth character , "[102-elisabeth] said [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth was very angry with [herself]102-elisabeth that [she]102-elisabeth had placed [herself]102-elisabeth in such a position that [any man]1066-any man dared to sit in judgment upon [her]102-elisabeth ; but even then [she]102-elisabeth could not elevate [Cecil]233-cecil into the object of [her]102-elisabeth indignation . [He]233-cecil went on like [a querulous child]2764-a querulous child . " It is desperately hard on [me]233-cecil that [you]102-elisabeth have treated [me]233-cecil in this way ! [You]102-elisabeth might have snubbed [me]233-cecil at once if [you]102-elisabeth had wished to do so , and not have made [me]233-cecil a laughing - stock in the eyes of [the world]301-the world . [I]233-cecil made no secret of the fact that [I]233-cecil intended to marry [you]102-elisabeth ; [I]233-cecil talked about it to [everybody]3055-everybody ; and now [everybody]3055-everybody will laugh at [me]233-cecil for having been [[your]102-elisabeth dupe]4652-your dupe . "[233-cecil] So [he]233-cecil had boasted to [[his]233-cecil friends]3588-his friends of the fortune [he]233-cecil was going to annex , and had already openly plumed [himself]233-cecil upon securing [her]2766-her money ! [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth understood perfectly , and was distinctly amused . [She]102-elisabeth wondered if [he]233-cecil would remember to remind [her]102-elisabeth how [she]2766-her was going to elevate [him]233-cecil by [her]2766-her influence , or if the loss of [her]2766-her money would make [him]233-cecil forget even to simulate sorrow at the loss of [herself]2766-her . " [I]233-cecil do n't know what [I]233-cecil shall do , "[233-cecil] [he]233-cecil continued , with tears of vexation in [his]233-cecil eyes ; " [everybody]3055-everybody is expecting [our]4654-our engagement to be announced , and [I]233-cecil can not think what excuses [I]233-cecil shall invent . [A man]310-a man looks such a fool when [he]310-a man has made too sure of [a woman]469-a woman ! "[233-cecil] " Doubtless . But that is n't [the woman]3411-the woman 's fault altogether . "[233-cecil] " Yes ; it is . If [the woman]3411-the woman had n't led [him]233-cecil on , [the man]3356-the man would n't have made sure of [her]3411-the woman . [You]233-cecil have been unutterably cruel to [me]102-elisabeth — unpardonably cruel ; and [I]102-elisabeth will never forgive [you]233-cecil as long as [I]102-elisabeth live . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth winced at this — not at [Cecil]233-cecil 's refusal to forgive [her]102-elisabeth , but at the thought that [she]102-elisabeth had placed [herself]102-elisabeth within the reach of [his]233-cecil forgiveness . But [she]102-elisabeth was not penitent — [she]102-elisabeth was only annoyed . Penitence is the last experience that comes to [strong - willed , light - hearted people , such as [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth]2767-strong - willed , light - hearted people , such as elisabeth ; [they]2767-strong - willed , light - hearted people , such as elisabeth are so sure [they]2767-strong - willed , light - hearted people , such as elisabeth are right at the time , and [they]2767-strong - willed , light - hearted people , such as elisabeth so soon forget about it afterward , that [they]2767-strong - willed , light - hearted people , such as elisabeth find no interval for remorse . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was beginning to forgive [herself]102-elisabeth for having fallen for a time from [her]102-elisabeth high ideal , because [she]102-elisabeth was already beginning to forget that [she]102-elisabeth had so fallen ; life had taught [her]102-elisabeth many things , but [she]102-elisabeth took it too easily even yet . " [I]102-elisabeth have a story to tell [you]233-cecil , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said ; " a story that will interest [you]233-cecil , if [you]233-cecil will listen . "[102-elisabeth] By this time [Cecil]233-cecil 's anger was settling down into sulkiness . " [I]102-elisabeth have no alternative , [I]102-elisabeth suppose . "[102-elisabeth] Then [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth told [him]233-cecil , as briefly as [she]102-elisabeth could , the story of [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son ; and , as [she]102-elisabeth spoke , [she]102-elisabeth watched the sulkiness in [his]233-cecil face give place to interest , and the interest to hope , and the hope to triumph , until [the naughty child]2769-the naughty child gradually grew once more into the similitude of [a Greek god]2425-a greek god . " [You]102-elisabeth are right — [I]233-cecil am sure [you]102-elisabeth are right , "[233-cecil] [he]233-cecil said when [she]102-elisabeth had finished ; " it all fits in — the date and place of [my]233-cecil birth , [[my]233-cecil parents]4458-my parents ' poverty and friendlessness , and the mystery concerning [them]4458-my parents . Oh ! [you]102-elisabeth can not think what this means to [me]233-cecil . To be forever beyond the reach of poverty — to be able to do whatever [I]233-cecil like for the rest of [my]233-cecil life — to be counted among the great of [the earth]466-the earth ! It is wonderful — wonderful ! "[233-cecil] And [he]233-cecil walked up and down [the room]3736-the room in [his]233-cecil excitement , while [his]233-cecil voice shook with emotion . " [I]233-cecil shall have such a glorious time , "[233-cecil] [he]233-cecil went on—"the most glorious time [man]603-man ever had ! Of course , [I]102-elisabeth shall not live in [that horrid Black Country]4663-that horrid black country — [nobody]409-nobody could expect [me]102-elisabeth to make such a sacrifice as that ; but [I]102-elisabeth shall spend [my]102-elisabeth winters in [Italy]89-italy and [my]102-elisabeth summers in [Mayfair]90-mayfair , and [I]102-elisabeth shall forget that [the world]301-the world was ever cold and hard and cruel to [me]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth watched [him]233-cecil curiously . So [he]233-cecil never even thought of [her]102-elisabeth and of what [she]102-elisabeth was giving up . That [his]233-cecil gain was [her]102-elisabeth loss was a matter of no moment to [him]233-cecil — it did not enter into [his]233-cecil calculations . [She]102-elisabeth wondered if [he]233-cecil even remembered [Quenelda]269-quenelda , and what this would mean to [her]102-elisabeth ; [she]102-elisabeth thought not . And this was [the man [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had once delighted to honour]2772-the man elisabeth had once delighted to honour ! [She]102-elisabeth could have laughed aloud as [she]102-elisabeth realized what [a blind fool]4530-a blind fool [she]102-elisabeth had been . Were [all men]2774-all men like this ? [she]102-elisabeth asked [herself]102-elisabeth ; for , if so , [she]102-elisabeth was glad [she]102-elisabeth was too cold to fall in love . It would be terrible indeed to lay down [one]543-one 's life at the feet of [a creature such as this]2776-a creature such as this ; it was bad enough to have to lay down one 's fortune there ! Throughout the rest of the interview [Cecil]233-cecil lived up to the estimate that [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had just formed of [his]233-cecil character : [he]233-cecil never once remembered [her]102-elisabeth — never once forgot [himself]233-cecil . [She]102-elisabeth explained to [him]233-cecil that [Christopher Thornley]121-christopher was [the man who would manage all the business part of the affair for [him]233-cecil , and give up the papers , and establish [his]233-cecil identity]2777-the man who would manage all the business part of the affair for him , and give up the papers , and establish his identity ; and [she]102-elisabeth promised to communicate with [Cecil]233-cecil as soon as [she]102-elisabeth received an answer to the letter [she]102-elisabeth had written to [Christopher]121-christopher informing [the latter]524-the latter that [she]102-elisabeth believed [she]102-elisabeth had at last discovered [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son . Amidst all [her]102-elisabeth sorrow at the anticipation of giving up [[her]102-elisabeth kingdom]4086-her kingdom into the hands of [so unfitting a ruler as [Cecil]233-cecil]2781-so unfitting a ruler as cecil , there lurked a pleasurable consciousness that at last [Christopher]121-christopher would recognise [her]102-elisabeth worth , when [he]121-christopher found how inferior [[her]102-elisabeth successor]2739-her successor was to [herself]102-elisabeth . It was strange how this desire to compel the regard which [she]102-elisabeth had voluntarily forfeited , had haunted [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth for so many years . [Christopher]121-christopher had offended [her]102-elisabeth past all pardon , [she]102-elisabeth said to [herself]102-elisabeth ; nevertheless it annoyed [her]102-elisabeth to feel that the friendship , which [she]102-elisabeth had taken from [him]121-christopher for punitive purposes , was but a secondary consideration in [his]121-christopher eyes after all . [She]102-elisabeth had long ago succeeded in convincing [herself]102-elisabeth that the grapes of [his]121-christopher affection were too sour to be worth fretting after ; but [she]102-elisabeth still wanted to make [him]121-christopher admire [her]102-elisabeth in spite of [himself]121-christopher , and to realize that [Miss Elisabeth Farringdon of the Osierfield]102-elisabeth was [a more important personage]2783-a more important personage than [he]121-christopher had considered [her]102-elisabeth to be . Half the pleasure of [her]102-elisabeth success as [an artist]567-an artist had lain in the thought that this at last would convince [Christopher]121-christopher of [her]102-elisabeth right to be admired and obeyed ; but [she]102-elisabeth was never sure that it had actually done so . Through all [her]102-elisabeth triumphal progress [he]121-christopher had been [the Mordecai at [her]102-elisabeth gates]2785-the mordecai at her gates . [She]102-elisabeth did not often see [him]121-christopher , it is true ; but when [she]102-elisabeth did , [she]102-elisabeth was acutely conscious that [his]121-christopher attitude toward [her]102-elisabeth was different from the attitude of [the rest of [the world]301-the world]2786-the rest of the world , and that — instead of offering [her]102-elisabeth unlimited praise and adulation — [he]121-christopher saw [her]102-elisabeth weaknesses as clearly now [she]102-elisabeth was [a great lady]2788-a great lady as [he]121-christopher had done when [she]102-elisabeth was [a little girl]3044-a little girl . And herein [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's intuition was not at fault ; [her]102-elisabeth failings were actually more patent to [Christopher]121-christopher than to [the world]301-the world at large . But here [her]102-elisabeth perception ended ; and [she]102-elisabeth did not see , further , that it was because [Christopher]121-christopher had formed such a high ideal of [her]102-elisabeth , that [he]121-christopher minded so much when [she]102-elisabeth fell short of it . [She]102-elisabeth had not yet grasped the truth that whereas the more [a woman]469-a woman loves [a man]310-a man the easier [she]469-a woman finds it to forgive [his]310-a man faults , the more [a man]310-a man loves [a woman]469-a woman the harder [he]310-a man finds it to overlook [her]469-a woman shortcomings . [A woman]469-a woman merely requires [the man [she]469-a woman loves]2796-the man she loves to be true to [her]469-a woman ; while [a man]310-a man demands that [the woman [he]310-a man loves]2798-the woman he loves shall be true to [herself]2798-the woman he loves — or , rather , to that ideal of [her]469-a woman which in [his]310-a man own mind [he]310-a man has set up and worshipped . [Her]102-elisabeth consciousness of [Christopher]121-christopher 's disapproval of the easy - going , Bohemian fashion in which [she]102-elisabeth had chosen to walk through life , made [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth intensely angry ; though [she]102-elisabeth would have died rather than let [him]121-christopher know it . How dared [this one man]2623-this one man show [himself]2623-this one man superior to [her]102-elisabeth , when [she]102-elisabeth had [the world]301-the world at [her]102-elisabeth feet ? It was insupportable ! [She]102-elisabeth said but little to [him]121-christopher , and [he]121-christopher said still less to [her]102-elisabeth , and what [they]2801-they did say was usually limited to the affairs of [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth ; nevertheless [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth persistently weighed [herself]102-elisabeth in [Christopher]121-christopher 's balances , and measured [herself]102-elisabeth according to [Christopher]121-christopher 's measures ; and , as [she]102-elisabeth did so , wrote [Tekel]270-tekel opposite [her]102-elisabeth own name . And for this [she]102-elisabeth refused to forgive [him]121-christopher . [She]102-elisabeth assured [herself]102-elisabeth that [his]121-christopher balances were false , and [his]121-christopher measures impossible , and [his]121-christopher judgments hard in the extreme ; and when [she]102-elisabeth had done so , [she]102-elisabeth began to try [herself]102-elisabeth thereby again , and hated [him]121-christopher afresh because [she]102-elisabeth fell so far short of [them]2802-them . But now [he]121-christopher was going to see [her]102-elisabeth in a new light ; if [he]121-christopher declined to admire [her]102-elisabeth in prosperity , [he]121-christopher should be compelled to respect [her]102-elisabeth in adversity ; for [she]102-elisabeth made up [her]102-elisabeth mind [she]102-elisabeth would bear [her]102-elisabeth reverses like [a Spartan]2803-a spartan , if only for the sake of proving to [him]121-christopher that [she]102-elisabeth was made of better material than [he]121-christopher , in [his]121-christopher calm superiority , had supposed . When [he]121-christopher saw for [himself]121-christopher how plucky [she]102-elisabeth could be , and how little [she]102-elisabeth really cared for outside things , [he]121-christopher might at last discover that [she]102-elisabeth was not as unworthy of [his]121-christopher regard as [he]121-christopher had once assumed , and might even want to be [friends]3544-friends with [her]102-elisabeth again ; and then [she]102-elisabeth would throw [his]121-christopher friendship back again in [his]121-christopher face , as [he]121-christopher had once thrown [hers]102-elisabeth , and teach [him]121-christopher that it was possible even for [self - righteous people]2805-self - righteous people to make mistakes which were past repairing . It would do [him]121-christopher a world of good , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth thought , to find out — too late — that [he]121-christopher had misjudged [her]102-elisabeth , and that [other people]2980-other people besides [himself]121-christopher had virtues and excellences ; and it comforted [her]102-elisabeth , in the midst of [her]102-elisabeth adversities , to contemplate the punishment which was being reserved for [Christopher]121-christopher , when [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son came into [his]121-christopher own . And [she]102-elisabeth never guessed — how could she?—that when at last [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son did come into [his]121-christopher own , there would be no [Christopher Thornley]121-christopher serving under [him]121-christopher at [the Osierfield]2809-the osierfield ; and that the cup of remorse , which [she]102-elisabeth was so busily preparing , was for [her]102-elisabeth own drinking and not for [Christopher]121-christopher 's . [Christopher]121-christopher 's expected answer to [her]102-elisabeth epistle was , however , not forthcoming . The following morning [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth received a letter from [one of [the clerks at [the Osierfield]2809-the osierfield]2811-the clerks at the osierfield]2810-one of the clerks at the osierfield , informing [her]102-elisabeth that [Mr. Thornley]199-felicia returned from [his]199-felicia tour in [Germany]28-germany a week ago ; and that immediately on [his]199-felicia return [he]199-felicia was seized with a severe attack of pneumonia — the result of a neglected cold — and was now lying seriously ill at [[his]199-felicia house in [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill]2813-his house in sedgehill . In order to complete the purchase of a piece of land for the enlargement of [the works]353-the works , which [Mr. Thornley]199-felicia had arranged to buy before [he]199-felicia went away , it was necessary ( [the clerk]2815-the clerk went on to say ) to see the plans of [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth ; and these were locked up in the private safe at [[the manager]3419-the manager 's house]2817-the manager 's house , to which only [Christopher]121-christopher and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth possessed keys . Therefore , as [the manager]3419-the manager was delirious and quite incapable of attending to business of any kind , [the clerk]2815-the clerk begged [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth to come down at once and take the plans out of [the safe]2820-the safe ; as the negotiations could not be completed until this was done . For an instant the old instinct of tenderness toward [any one who was weak or suffering]2821-any one who was weak or suffering welled up in [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's soul , and [she]102-elisabeth longed to go to [[her]102-elisabeth old playmate]3952-her old playmate and help and comfort [him]3952-her old playmate ; but then came the remembrance of how once before , long ago , [she]102-elisabeth had been ready to help and comfort [Christopher]121-christopher , and [he]3952-her old playmate had wanted neither [her]102-elisabeth help nor [her]102-elisabeth comfort ; so [she]102-elisabeth hardened [her]102-elisabeth heart against [him]3952-her old playmate , and proudly said to [herself]102-elisabeth that if [Christopher]121-christopher could do without [her]102-elisabeth [she]102-elisabeth could do without [Christopher]121-christopher . That summer 's day was one which [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth could never forget as long as [she]102-elisabeth lived ; it stood out from the rest of [her]102-elisabeth life , and would so stand out forever . [We]2823-we all know such days as this — days which place a gulf , that can never be passed over , between [their]2824-their before and after . [She]102-elisabeth travelled down to [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill by [a morning train]2825-a morning train ; and [her]102-elisabeth heart was heavy within [her]102-elisabeth as [she]102-elisabeth saw how beautiful [the country]3528-the country looked in the summer sunshine , and realized that [the home [she]102-elisabeth loved]2827-the home she loved was to be taken away from [her]102-elisabeth and given to [another]2022-another . Somehow life had not brought [her]102-elisabeth all that [she]102-elisabeth had expected from it , and yet [she]102-elisabeth did not see wherein [she]102-elisabeth [herself]102-elisabeth had been to blame . [She]102-elisabeth had neither loved nor hoarded [her]102-elisabeth money , but had used it for the good of [others]3096-others to the best of [her]102-elisabeth knowledge ; yet it was to be taken from [her]102-elisabeth . [She]102-elisabeth had not hidden [her]102-elisabeth talent in a napkin , but had cultivated it to the height of [her]102-elisabeth powers ; yet [her]102-elisabeth fame was cold and dreary to [her]102-elisabeth , and [her]102-elisabeth greatness turned to ashes in [her]102-elisabeth hands . [She]102-elisabeth had been ready to give love in full measure and running over to [any one who needed it]2830-any one who needed it ; yet [her]102-elisabeth heart had asked in vain for something to fill it , and in spite of all its longings had been sent empty away . [She]102-elisabeth had failed all along the line to get the best out of life ; and yet [she]102-elisabeth did not see how [she]102-elisabeth could have acted differently . Surely it was [Fate]122-fate , and not [herself]102-elisabeth , that was to blame for [her]102-elisabeth failure . When [she]102-elisabeth arrived at [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill [she]102-elisabeth drove straight to [[Christopher]121-christopher 's house]2831-christopher 's house , and learned from [the nurse who was attending [him]121-christopher how serious [his]121-christopher illness was]2832-the nurse who was attending him how serious his illness was — not so much on account of the violence of the cold which [he]121-christopher had taken in [Germany]28-germany , as from the fact that [his]121-christopher vitality was too feeble to resist it . But [she]102-elisabeth could not guess — and there was [no one]3126-no one to tell [her]102-elisabeth — that [his]121-christopher vitality had been lowered by [her]102-elisabeth unkindness to [him]121-christopher , and that it was [she]102-elisabeth who had deliberately snapped the mainspring of [Christopher]121-christopher 's life . It was no use [anybody]376-anybody 's seeing [him]121-christopher , [the nurse]1788-the nurse said , as [he]121-christopher was delirious and knew [no one]3126-no one ; but if [he]121-christopher regained consciousness , [she]102-elisabeth would summon [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth at once . Then [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth went alone into [the big , oak - panelled dining - room]2837-the big , oak - panelled dining - room , with the crape masks before [its]2837-the big , oak - panelled dining - room windows , and opened the safe . [She]102-elisabeth could not find the plans at once , as [she]102-elisabeth did not know exactly where to look for them ; and as [she]102-elisabeth was searching for them among various papers , [she]102-elisabeth came upon a letter addressed to [herself]102-elisabeth in [Christopher]121-christopher 's handwriting . [She]102-elisabeth opened it with [her]102-elisabeth usual carelessness , without perceiving that it bore the inscription " Not to be given to [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth until after [my]102-elisabeth death "[102-elisabeth] ; and when [she]102-elisabeth had begun to read it , [she]102-elisabeth could not have left off to save [her]102-elisabeth life — being [a woman]469-a woman . And this was what [she]102-elisabeth read : " [[My]102-elisabeth Darling]1772-my darling — for so [I]102-elisabeth may call [you]2839-you at last , since [you]2839-you will not read this letter until after [I]102-elisabeth am dead ; "[102-elisabeth] There are two things that [I]0-i want to tell [you]2839-you . First , that [I]0-i love [you]2839-you , and always have loved [you]2839-you , and always shall love [you]2839-you to all eternity . But how could [I]0-i say this to [you]2839-you , [sweetheart]2840-sweetheart , in the days when [my]0-i love spelled poverty for [[us]2841-us both]2842-us both ? And how could [I]0-i say it when [you]2839-you became [one of [the richest women in [Mershire]2-mershire]2844-the richest women in mershire]2843-one of the richest women in mershire , and [I]0-i only [the paid manager of [your]2839-you works]2845-the paid manager of your works ? Nevertheless [I]0-i should have said it in time , when [you]2839-you had seen more of [the world]301-the world and were capable of choosing [your]2839-you own life for [yourself]2839-you , had [I]0-i thought there was any chance of [your]2839-you caring for [me]0-i ; for [no man]521-no man has ever loved [you]2839-you as [I]0-i have loved [you]2839-you , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , nor ever will . [You]2839-you had a right to know what was [yours]2839-you , when [you]2839-you were old enough to decide what to do with it , and to take or leave it as [you]2839-you thought fit ; and [no one else]592-no one else had the right to decide this for [you]2839-you . But when [you]2839-you so misjudged [me]0-i about [my]0-i journey to [Australia]10-australia , [I]0-i understood that it was [I]0-i [myself]0-i , and not [my]0-i position , that stood between [us]2849-us ; and that [your]2839-you nature and [mine]0-i were so different , and [our]2849-us ideas so far apart , that it was not in [my]0-i power to make [you]2839-you happy , though [I]0-i would have died to do so . So [I]0-i went out of [your]2839-you life , for fear [I]0-i should spoil it ; and [I]0-i have kept out of [your]2839-you life ever since , because [I]0-i know [you]2839-you are happier without [me]0-i ; for [I]0-i do so want [you]2839-you to be happy , [dear]1798-dear . " There is one other thing [I]0-i have to tell [you]2839-you : [I]0-i am [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son . [I]0-i should n't have bothered [you]2839-you with this , only [I]0-i feel it is necessary — after [I]0-i am gone — for [you]2839-you to know the truth , lest [any impostor]4668-any impostor should turn up and take [your]2839-you property from [you]2839-you . Of course , as long as [I]0-i am alive [I]0-i can keep the secret , and yet take care that [no one else]592-no one else comes forward in [my]0-i place ; and [I]0-i have made a will leaving everything [I]0-i possess to [you]2839-you . But when [I]0-i am gone , [you]2839-you must hold the proofs of who was really [the person who stood between [you]2839-you and [the Farringdon property]4671-the farringdon property]4670-the person who stood between you and the farringdon property . [I]0-i never found it out until [[my]0-i uncle]4672-my uncle died ; [I]0-i believed , as [everybody else]3282-everybody else believed , that [the lost heir]4128-the lost heir was somewhere in [Australia]10-australia . But on [[my]0-i uncle]4672-my uncle 's death [I]0-i found a confession from [him]4672-my uncle — which is in this safe , along with [[my]0-i parents]4458-my parents ' marriage certificate and all the other proofs of [my]0-i identity — saying how [[his]4672-my uncle sister]4677-his sister told [him]4672-my uncle on [her]4677-his sister death - bed that , when [George Farringdon]99-george farringdon ran away from [home]399-home , [he]4672-my uncle married [her]4677-his sister , and took [her]4677-his sister out with [him]4672-my uncle to [Australia]10-australia . [They]4458-my parents had a hard life , and lost all [[their]4458-my parents children]4679-their children except [myself]0-i ; and then [[my]0-i father]1808-my father died , leaving [[my]0-i poor mother]4456-my poor mother almost penniless . [She]4456-my poor mother survived [him]4672-my uncle only long enough to come back to [England]3-england , and give [[her]4456-my poor mother child]4682-her child into [[her]4456-my poor mother brother]496-her brother 's charge . [[My]0-i uncle]4672-my uncle went on to say that [he]4672-my uncle kept [my]0-i identity a secret , and called [me]0-i by an assumed name , as [he]4672-my uncle was afraid that [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth would send both [him]4672-my uncle and [me]0-i about [our]4685-our business if [she]4456-my poor mother knew the truth ; as in those days [she]4456-my poor mother was very bitter against [the man who had jilted [her]4456-my poor mother]4686-the man who had jilted her , and would have been still bitterer had [she]4456-my poor mother known [he]4672-my uncle had thrown [her]4456-my poor mother over for [the daughter of [[her]4456-my poor mother father 's manager]4688-her father 's manager]4687-the daughter of her father 's manager . When [Maria Farringdon]101-maria farringdon died and showed , by [her]101-maria farringdon will , that at last [she]101-maria farringdon had forgiven [[her]101-maria farringdon old lover]4689-her old lover , [[my]0-i uncle]4672-my uncle 's mind was completely gone ; and it was not until after [his]4672-my uncle death that [I]0-i discovered the papers which put [me]0-i in possession of the facts of the case . "[0-i] By that time [I]0-i had learned , beyond all disputing , that [I]0-i was too dull and stupid ever to win [your]2851-you love . [I]0-i only cared for money that it might enable [me]0-i to make [you]2851-you happy ; and if [you]2851-you could be happier without [me]0-i than with [me]0-i , who was [I]0-i that [I]0-i should complain ? At any rate , it was given to [me]0-i to insure [your]2851-you happiness ; and that was enough for [me]0-i . And [you]2851-you said that [I]0-i did n't care what became of [you]2851-you , as long as [I]0-i laid up for [myself]0-i a nice little nest - egg in heaven ! [Sweetheart]271-sweetheart , [I]0-i think [you]2851-you did [me]0-i an injustice . So be happy , [[my]0-i dearest]4536-my dearest , with [the Willows]8-the willows and [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth and all the dear old things which [you]2851-you and [I]0-i have loved so well ; and remember that [you]2851-you must never pity [me]0-i . [I]0-i wanted [you]2851-you to be happy more than [I]0-i wanted anything else in [the world]301-the world , and [no man]521-no man is to be pitied who has succeeded in getting what [he]521-no man wanted most . " [Yours]2851-you , [[my]121-christopher darling]1772-my darling , for time and eternity , [Christopher Farringdon]121-christopher . "[121-christopher] Then at last [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's eyes were opened , and for the first time in [her]102-elisabeth life [she]102-elisabeth saw clearly . So [Christopher]121-christopher had loved [her]102-elisabeth all along ; [she]102-elisabeth knew the truth at last , and with it [she]102-elisabeth also knew that [she]102-elisabeth had always loved [him]121-christopher ; that throughout [her]102-elisabeth life 's story there never had been — never could be — [any man]1066-any man but [Christopher]121-christopher . Until [he]121-christopher told [her]102-elisabeth that [he]121-christopher loved [her]102-elisabeth , [her]102-elisabeth love for [him]121-christopher had been a fountain sealed ; but at [his]121-christopher word it became a well of living water , flooding [her]102-elisabeth whole soul and turning the desert of [her]102-elisabeth life into [a garden]676-a garden . At first [she]102-elisabeth was overpowered with the joy of it ; [she]102-elisabeth was upheld by that strange feeling of exaltation which comes to all of [us]2857-us when [we]2857-us realize for a moment [our]2857-us immortality , and feel that even death itself is powerless to hurt [us]2857-us . [Christopher]121-christopher was dying , but what did that signify ? [He]121-christopher loved [her]102-elisabeth — that was the only thing that really mattered — and [they]2858-they would have the whole of eternity in which to tell [their]2858-they love . For the second time in [her]102-elisabeth life [she]102-elisabeth came face to face with the fact that there was a stronger Will than [her]102-elisabeth own guiding and ruling [her]102-elisabeth ; that , in spite of all [her]102-elisabeth power and ability and self - reliance , the best things in [her]102-elisabeth life were not of [herself]102-elisabeth but were from outside . As long ago in [[St. Peter]203-st. peter 's Church]2859-st. peter 's church [she]102-elisabeth had learned that religion was [God]105-god 's Voice calling to [her]102-elisabeth , [she]102-elisabeth now learned that love was [Christopher]121-christopher 's voice calling to [her]102-elisabeth ; and that [her]102-elisabeth own strength and cleverness , of which [she]102-elisabeth had been so proud , counted for less than nothing . To [her]102-elisabeth who longed to give , was given ; [she]102-elisabeth who desired to love , was beloved ; [she]102-elisabeth who aspired to teach , had been taught . That strong will of [hers]102-elisabeth , which had once been so dominant , had suddenly fallen down powerless ; [she]102-elisabeth no longer wanted to have [her]102-elisabeth own way — [she]102-elisabeth wanted to have [Christopher]121-christopher 's . [Her]102-elisabeth warfare against [him]121-christopher was at last accomplished . To the end of [her]102-elisabeth days [she]102-elisabeth knew [she]102-elisabeth would go on weighing [herself]102-elisabeth in [his]121-christopher balances , and measuring [herself]102-elisabeth according to [his]121-christopher measures ; but now [she]102-elisabeth would do so willingly , choosing to be guided by [his]121-christopher wisdom rather than [her]102-elisabeth own , for [she]102-elisabeth no more belonged to [herself]102-elisabeth but to [him]121-christopher . The feeling of unrest , which had oppressed [her]102-elisabeth for so many years , now fell from [her]102-elisabeth like a cast - off garment . [Christopher]121-christopher was the answer to [her]102-elisabeth life 's problem , the fulfilment of [her]102-elisabeth heart 's desire ; and although [she]102-elisabeth might be obliged to go down again into [the valley of the shadow]2860-the valley of the shadow , [she]102-elisabeth could never forget that [she]102-elisabeth had once stood upon [the mountain - top]2861-the mountain - top and had beheld the glory of [the promised land]968-the promised land . And [she]102-elisabeth never remembered that now [her]102-elisabeth fortune was secured to [her]102-elisabeth , and that [the Willows]328-the willows and [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth would always be [hers]102-elisabeth ; even these were henceforth of no moment to [her]102-elisabeth , save as monuments of [Christopher]121-christopher 's love . So in [the dingy dining - room]2864-the dingy dining - room , on that hot summer 's afternoon , [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth became [a new creature]2865-a new creature . The old domineering arrogance passed away forever ; and from its ashes there arose [another [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , who out of weakness was made stronger than [she]102-elisabeth had ever been in [her]102-elisabeth strength]102-elisabeth — [an Elisabeth who had attained to the victory of the vanquished , and who had tasted the triumph of defeat]2866-an elisabeth who had attained to the victory of the vanquished , and who had tasted the triumph of defeat . But in all [her]102-elisabeth exaltation [she]102-elisabeth knew — though for the moment the knowledge could not hurt [her]102-elisabeth — that [her]102-elisabeth heart would be broken by [Christopher]121-christopher 's death . Through the long night of [her]102-elisabeth ignorance and self - will and unsatisfied idealism [she]102-elisabeth had wrestled with [the angel]2867-the angel that [she]102-elisabeth might behold the Best , and had prayed that it might be granted unto [her]102-elisabeth to see the Vision Beautiful . At last [she]102-elisabeth had prevailed ; and the day for which [she]102-elisabeth had so longed was breaking , and transfiguring the common world with its marvellous light . But the angel - hand had touched [her]102-elisabeth , and [she]102-elisabeth no longer stood upright and self - reliant , but was bound to halt and walk lamely on [her]102-elisabeth way until [she]102-elisabeth stood by [Christopher]121-christopher 's side again . This exalted mood did not last for long . As [she]102-elisabeth sat in [the gloomy room]2868-the gloomy room and watched the blazing sunshine forcing its way through the darkened windows , [her]102-elisabeth eye suddenly fell upon two notches cut in the doorway , where [she]102-elisabeth and [Christopher]121-christopher had once measured [themselves]2869-themselves when [they]2869-themselves were [children]553-children ; and the familiar sight of these two little notches , made by [Christopher]121-christopher 's knife so long ago , awoke in [her]102-elisabeth heart the purely human longing for [him]121-christopher as [the friend and comrade [she]102-elisabeth had known and looked up to all [her]102-elisabeth life]2871-the friend and comrade she had known and looked up to all her life . And with this longing came the terrible thought of how [she]102-elisabeth had hurt and misunderstood and misjudged [him]121-christopher , and of how it was now too late for [her]102-elisabeth to make up to [him]121-christopher in this life for all the happiness of which [she]102-elisabeth had defrauded [him]121-christopher in [her]102-elisabeth careless pride . Then , for the first time since [she]102-elisabeth was born , [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth put [her]102-elisabeth lips to the cup of remorse , and found it very bitter to the taste . [She]102-elisabeth had been so full of plans for comforting [mankind]3785-mankind and helping [the whole world]3353-the whole world ; yet [she]102-elisabeth had utterly failed toward [the only person whom it had been in [her]102-elisabeth power]2874-the only person whom it had been in her power actually to help and comfort ; and [her]102-elisabeth heart echoed the wail of the most beautiful love - song ever written—"They made [me]1788-the nurse [the keeper of [the vineyards]4693-the vineyards]4692-the keeper of the vineyards ; but [[mine]1788-the nurse own vineyard]4694-mine own vineyard have [I]1788-the nurse not kept . "[1788-the nurse] As [she]102-elisabeth was sitting , bowed down in utter anguish of spirit while the waves of remorse flooded [her]102-elisabeth soul , the door opened and [the nurse]1788-the nurse came in . " [Mr. Thornley]199-felicia is conscious now , and is asking for [you]102-elisabeth , [Miss Farringdon]102-elisabeth , "[1788-the nurse] [she]1788-the nurse said . " [I]102-elisabeth can see now , "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth went on , " how much more important it is what [a man]310-a man is than what [a man]310-a man says , though [I]102-elisabeth used to think that words were everything , and that [people]2982-people did n't feel what [they]2982-people did n't talk about . "[102-elisabeth] But by that time the stupendous effort which [Christopher]121-christopher had made for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's sake had exhausted itself , and [he]121-christopher fell back upon [his]121-christopher pillows , white to the lips , and too weak to say another word . Yet not even the great Shadow could cloud the love that shone in [his]121-christopher eyes , as [he]121-christopher looked at [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's eager face , and listened to the voice for which [his]121-christopher soul had hungered so long . The sight of [his]121-christopher weakness brought [her]102-elisabeth down to [earth]614-earth again more effectually than any words could have done ; and with an exceeding bitter cry [she]102-elisabeth hid [her]102-elisabeth face in [her]102-elisabeth arms and sobbed aloud — " Oh ! [[my]102-elisabeth darling]1772-my darling , [[my]102-elisabeth darling]1772-my darling , come back to [me]102-elisabeth ; [I]102-elisabeth love [you]1772-my darling so that [I]102-elisabeth can not let [you]1772-my darling go . [The angels]1667-the angels can do quite well without [you]1772-my darling in [heaven]415-heaven , but [I]102-elisabeth can not do without [you]1772-my darling here . Oh ! "[102-elisabeth] [Christopher]121-christopher made another great effort to take [her]2884-her in [his]121-christopher arms and comfort [her]2884-her ; but it was too much for [him]121-christopher , and [he]121-christopher fainted away . Whether [the doctors]2885-the doctors were right when [they]2885-the doctors talked of the renewed desire to live producing fresh vitality , or whether [the wise man]2886-the wise man knew best after all when [he]2886-the wise man said that love is stronger than death , who can say ? Anyway , the fact remained that [Christopher]121-christopher responded — as [he]121-christopher had ever responded — to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's cry for help , and came back from the very gates of the grave at [her]102-elisabeth bidding . [He]121-christopher had never failed [her]102-elisabeth yet , and [he]121-christopher did not fail [her]102-elisabeth now . The days of [his]121-christopher recovery were wonderful days to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . It was so strange and new to [her]102-elisabeth to be doing [another person]3077-another person 's will , and thinking [another person]3077-another person 's thoughts , and seeing life through [another person]3077-another person 's eyes ; it completely altered the perspective of everything . And there was nothing strained about it , which was a good thing , as [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was too light - hearted to stand any strain for long ; the old comradeship still existed between [them]2890-them , giving breadth to a love which the new relationship had made so deep . And it was very wonderful to [Christopher]121-christopher , also , to find [himself]121-christopher in the sunshine at last after so many years of shadowland . At first the light almost dazzled [him]121-christopher , [he]121-christopher was so unaccustomed to it ; but as [he]121-christopher gradually became used to the new feeling of being happy , [his]121-christopher nature responded to the atmosphere of warmth and brightness , and opened as a flower in the sun . As it was strange to [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth to find [herself]102-elisabeth living and moving and having [her]102-elisabeth being in another 's personality , so it was strange to [Christopher]121-christopher to find another 's personality merged in [his]121-christopher . [He]121-christopher had lived so entirely for [other people]2980-other people that it was a great change to find [another person]3077-another person living entirely for [him]121-christopher ; and it was a change that was wholly beneficial . As [his]121-christopher nature deepened [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's , so [her]102-elisabeth nature expanded [his]121-christopher ; and each was the better for the influence of the other , as each was the complement of [the other]4352-the other . So after a time [Christopher]121-christopher grew almost as light - hearted as [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , while [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth grew almost as tender - hearted as [Christopher]121-christopher . For both of [them]2894-them the former things had passed away , and all things were made new . It was beautiful weather , too , which helped to increase [their]2894-them happiness ; that still , full , green weather , which sometimes comes in the late summer , satisfying [men]445-men 's souls with its peaceful perfectness ; when the year is too old to be disturbed by the restless hope of spring , too young to be depressed by the chilling dread of autumn , and so just touches the fringe of that eternity which has no end neither any beginning . The fine weather hastened [Christopher]121-christopher 's recovery ; and , as [he]121-christopher gained strength , [he]121-christopher and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth spent much time in [the old garden]2896-the old garden , looking toward [the Welsh mountains]2897-the welsh mountains . " So [we]2894-them have come to [the country]3528-the country on [the other side of [the hills]2074-the hills]2117-the other side of the hills at last , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said to [him]121-christopher , as [they]2894-them were watching one of the wonderful Mershire sunsets and drinking in [its]2898-its beauty . " [I]102-elisabeth always knew it was there , but sometimes [I]102-elisabeth gave up all hope of ever finding it for [myself]102-elisabeth . "[102-elisabeth] [Christopher]121-christopher took [her]102-elisabeth hand and began playing with the capable artist - fingers . " And is it as nice [a country]4109-a country as [you]102-elisabeth expected , [sweetheart]2840-sweetheart ? "[121-christopher] " As nice as [I]102-elisabeth expected ? [I]102-elisabeth should just think it is . [I]102-elisabeth knew that in [the country over [the hills]2074-the hills]4526-the country over the hills [I]102-elisabeth should find all the beautiful things [I]102-elisabeth had imagined as [a child]3440-a child and all the lovely things [I]102-elisabeth had longed for as [a woman]469-a woman ; and that , if only [I]102-elisabeth could reach it , all the fairy - tales would come true . But now that [I]102-elisabeth have reached it , [I]102-elisabeth find that the fairy - tales fell far short of the reality , and that it is a million times nicer than [I]102-elisabeth ever imagined anything could be . "[102-elisabeth] " [Darling]1703-darling , [I]121-christopher am glad [you]1703-darling are so happy . But it beats [me]121-christopher how [such a stupid fellow]4730-such a stupid fellow as [I]121-christopher am can make [you]1703-darling so . "[121-christopher] " Well , [you]1703-darling do , and that 's all that matters . [Nobody]409-nobody can tell how [they]409-nobody do things ; [they]409-nobody only know that [they]409-nobody can do them . [I]121-christopher do n't know how [I]121-christopher can paint pictures any more than [you]1703-darling know how [you]1703-darling can turn [smoky ironworks]4732-smoky ironworks into [the country]3528-the country over [the hills]2074-the hills . "[121-christopher] " [I]102-elisabeth think the cleverness lies with [you]1703-darling in both cases — in [your]1703-darling wonderful powers of imagination , [[my]102-elisabeth dear]3103-my dear . "[102-elisabeth] " Do [you]1703-darling ? Then that shows how little [you]1703-darling know about it . "[121-christopher] [Christopher]121-christopher put [his]121-christopher arm round [her]2899-her . " [I]121-christopher always was stupid , [you]1703-darling know ; [you]1703-darling have told [me]121-christopher so with considerable frequency . "[121-christopher] " Oh ! so [you]1703-darling were ; but [you]1703-darling were never worse than stupid . "[121-christopher] " That 's a good thing ; for stupidity is a misfortune rather than a fault . "[121-christopher] " Now [I]102-elisabeth was worse than stupid — much worse , "[102-elisabeth] continued [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth gravely ; " but [I]102-elisabeth never was actually stupid . "[102-elisabeth] " Were n't [you]1703-darling ? Do n't be too sure of that . [I]121-christopher no longer care about being happy [myself]121-christopher ; [I]121-christopher only want [you]102-elisabeth to be happy ; and yet [I]121-christopher know that for ten long years [I]121-christopher deliberately prevented [you]102-elisabeth from being happy . "[102-elisabeth] But while [Christopher]121-christopher and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth were walking across [enchanted ground]2907-enchanted ground , [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil was having a hard time . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had written to tell [him]2906-he the actual facts of the case almost as soon as [she]102-elisabeth knew them [herself]102-elisabeth ; and [he]2906-he could not forgive [her]102-elisabeth for first raising [his]2906-he hopes and then dashing them to the ground . And there is no denying that [he]2906-he had somewhat against [her]102-elisabeth ; for [she]102-elisabeth had twice played [him]2906-he this trick — first as regarded [herself]102-elisabeth , and then as regarded [her]102-elisabeth fortune . That [she]102-elisabeth had not been altogether to blame — that [she]102-elisabeth had deluded [herself]102-elisabeth in both cases as effectually as [she]102-elisabeth had deluded [him]2906-he — was no consolation as far as [he]2906-he was concerned ; [his]2906-he egoism took no account of [her]102-elisabeth motives — it only resented the results . [Quenelda]269-quenelda did all in [her]269-quenelda power to comfort [him]2906-he , but [she]269-quenelda found it uphill work . [She]269-quenelda gave [him]2906-he love in full measure ; but , as it happened , money and not love was the thing [he]2906-he most wanted , and that was not [hers]102-elisabeth to bestow . [He]2906-he still cared for [her]102-elisabeth more than [he]2906-he cared for [anybody]376-anybody ( though not for anything ) else in [the world]301-the world ; it was not that [he]2906-he loved [Cæsar]276-cæsar less but [Rome]277-rome more , [Cecil]233-cecil 's being one of the natures to whom [Rome]277-rome would always appeal more powerfully than [Cæsar]276-cæsar . [His]2906-he life did consist in the things which [he]2906-he had ; and , when these failed , nothing else could make up to [him]2906-he for [them]2910-them . [Neither Christopher]121-christopher nor [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was capable of understanding how much mere money meant to [Farquhar]233-cecil ; [they]2911-they had no conception of how bitter was [his]2906-he disappointment on knowing that [he]2906-he was not , after all , [the lost heir to the [Farringdon]30-farringdon property]2912-the lost heir to the farringdon property . And who would blame [them]2911-they for this ? Does [one]543-one blame [a man]310-a man , who takes a dirty bone away from a dog , for not entering into the dog 's feelings on the matter ? Nevertheless , that bone is to the dog what fame is to [the poet]807-the poet and glory to [the soldier]2916-the soldier . [One]543-one can but enjoy and suffer according to [one]543-one 's nature . It happened , by an odd coincidence , that the mystery of [Cecil]233-cecil 's parentage was cleared up shortly after [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth 's false alarm on that score ; and [[his]2906-he paternal grandfather]2919-his paternal grandfather was discovered in the shape of [a retired shopkeeper at [Surbiton]95-surbiton of the name of [Biggs]278-biggs , who had been cursed with [an unsatisfactory son]2921-an unsatisfactory son]2920-a retired shopkeeper at surbiton of the name of biggs , who had been cursed with an unsatisfactory son . When in due time [this worthy man]2922-this worthy man was gathered to [[his]2922-this worthy man fathers]2923-his fathers , [he]2922-this worthy man left a comfortable little fortune to [[his]2922-this worthy man long - lost grandson]2924-his long - lost grandson ; whereupon [Cecil]233-cecil married [Quenelda]269-quenelda , and continued to make art [his]233-cecil profession , while [[his]233-cecil recreation]2925-his recreation took the form of believing — and retailing [his]233-cecil belief to [anybody who had time and patience to listen to it]2926-anybody who had time and patience to listen to it — that [the Farringdons of Sedgehill]201-sedgehill had , by foul means , ousted [him]233-cecil from [his]233-cecil rightful position , and that , but for [their]2927-their dishonesty , [he]233-cecil would have been [one of [the richest men in [Mershire]2-mershire]2929-the richest men in mershire]2928-one of the richest men in mershire . And this grievance — as is the way of grievances — never failed to be a source of unlimited pleasure and comfort to [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil . But in the meantime , when the shock of disappointment was still fresh , [he]233-cecil wrote sundry scathing letters to [Miss Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth , which [she]102-elisabeth in turn showed to [Christopher]121-christopher , rousing the fury of [the latter thereby]2930-the latter thereby . " [He]233-cecil is [a cad]4794-a cad — [a low cad]4795-a low cad ! "[121-christopher] exclaimed [Christopher]121-christopher , after the perusal of one of these epistles ; " and [I]121-christopher should like to tell [him]233-cecil what [I]121-christopher think of [him]233-cecil , and then kick [him]233-cecil . "[121-christopher] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth laughed ; [she]102-elisabeth always enjoyed making [Christopher]121-christopher angry . " [He]233-cecil wanted to marry [me]102-elisabeth , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth remarked , by way of adding fuel to the flames . " Confounded impudence on [his]233-cecil part ! "[121-christopher] muttered [Christopher]121-christopher . " But [he]233-cecil left off when [he]233-cecil found out that [I]102-elisabeth had n't got any money . "[102-elisabeth] " Worse impudence , confound [him]233-cecil ! "[102-elisabeth] " Oh ! [I]102-elisabeth wish [you]121-christopher could have seen [him]233-cecil when [I]102-elisabeth told [him]233-cecil that the money was not really [mine]102-elisabeth , "[102-elisabeth] continued [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , bubbling over with mirth at the recollection ; " [he]233-cecil cooled down so very quickly , and so rapidly turned [his]233-cecil thoughts in another direction . Do n't [you]121-christopher know what it is to bite a gooseberry at the front door while it pops out at the back ? Well , [Cecil Farquhar]233-cecil 's love - making was just like that . It really was a fine sight ! "[102-elisabeth] " [The brute]4796-the brute ! "[102-elisabeth] " Never mind about [him]233-cecil , [dear]1798-dear ! [I]102-elisabeth 'm tired of [him]233-cecil . "[102-elisabeth] " But [I]121-christopher do mind when [people]2982-people dare to be impertinent to [you]121-christopher . [I]121-christopher ca n't help minding , "[121-christopher] [Christopher]121-christopher persisted . " Then go on minding , if [you]121-christopher want to , [darling]1703-darling — only do n't let [us]4800-we waste [our]4800-we time in talking about [him]233-cecil . There 's such a lot to talk about that is really important — why [you]121-christopher said so - and - so , and how [you]121-christopher felt when [I]121-christopher said so - and - so , ten years ago ; and how [you]121-christopher feel about [me]121-christopher to - day , and whether [you]121-christopher like [me]121-christopher as much this afternoon as [you]121-christopher did this morning ; and what colour [my]121-christopher eyes are , and what colour [you]121-christopher think [my]121-christopher new frock should be ; and heaps of really serious things like that . "[121-christopher] " All right , [Betty]102-elisabeth ; where shall [we]4800-we begin ? "[102-elisabeth] " [We]4800-we shall begin by making a plan . "[121-christopher] " Well , then , [you]121-christopher are coming with [me]102-elisabeth to have tea at [[Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson 's]4801-mrs. bateson 's , just as [we]4800-we used to do when [we]4800-we were little ; and [I]102-elisabeth have told [her]123-mrs. bateson to invite [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey as well , to make it seem just the same as it used to be . "[121-christopher] " Wo n't it be fun to pretend [we]4800-we are [children]553-children again ? "[102-elisabeth] [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth exclaimed . " Great fun ; and [I]121-christopher do n't think it will need much pretending , do [you]102-elisabeth know ? "[121-christopher] replied [Christopher]121-christopher , who saw deeper sometimes than [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth did , and now realized that it was only when [they]2931-they two became as [little children]1065-little children — [he]121-christopher by ceasing to play [Providence]136-providence to [her]102-elisabeth , and [she]102-elisabeth by ceasing to play [Providence]136-providence to [herself]102-elisabeth — that [they]2931-they had at last caught glimpses of [the kingdom of heaven]2933-the kingdom of heaven . So [they]2931-they walked hand in hand to [[Caleb Bateson]127-caleb 's cottage]2934-caleb bateson 's cottage , as [they]2931-they had so often walked in far - off , childish days ; and [the cottage]2935-the cottage looked so exactly the same as [it]2935-the cottage used to look , and [Caleb]127-caleb and [[his]127-caleb wife]3146-his wife and [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey were so little altered by the passage of time , that it seemed as if the shadow had indeed been put back ten degrees . And so , in a way , it was , by the new spring - time which had come to [Christopher]121-christopher and [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth . [They]2931-they were both among [those beloved of [the gods who are destined to die young — not in years but in spirit]2938-the gods who are destined to die young — not in years but in spirit]2937-those beloved of the gods who are destined to die young — not in years but in spirit ; [[her]102-elisabeth lover]779-her lover as well as [herself]102-elisabeth was what [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth called " [a fourth - dimension person]4803-a fourth - dimension person , "[102-elisabeth] and there is no growing old for [fourth - dimension people]2940-fourth - dimension people ; because it has already been given to [them]2940-fourth - dimension people to behold the vision of [the cloud - clad angel , who stands upon [the sea]2942-the sea and upon [the earth]466-the earth]2941-the cloud - clad angel , who stands upon the sea and upon the earth and swears that there shall be time no longer . [They]2940-fourth - dimension people see [him]2941-the cloud - clad angel , who stands upon the sea and upon the earth in [the far distances of [the sunlit hills]2945-the sunlit hills]2944-the far distances of the sunlit hills , in [the mysteries of the unfathomed ocean]2946-the mysteries of the unfathomed ocean , and [their]2940-fourth - dimension people ears are opened to the message that [he]2941-the cloud - clad angel , who stands upon the sea and upon the earth brings ; for [they]2940-fourth - dimension people know that in all beauty — be it of [earth]614-earth , or [sea]548-sea , or sky , or [human souls]2949-human souls — there is something indestructible , immortal , and that [those who have once looked upon it]2950-those who have once looked upon it shall never see death . Such of [us]2951-us as make [our]2951-us dwelling - place in [the world of the three dimensions]2952-the world of the three dimensions , grow weary of the sameness and the staleness of it all , and drearily echo [the Preacher]797-the preacher 's Vanitas vanitatum ; but such of [us]2951-us as have entered into [the fourth dimension]2954-the fourth dimension , and have caught glimpses of the ideal which is concealed in all reality , do not trouble [ourselves]2951-us over the flight of time , for [we]2951-us know [we]2951-us have eternity before [us]2951-us ; and so [we]2951-us are content to wait patiently and joyfully , in sure and certain hope of that better thing which , without [us]2951-us , can not be made perfect . It was with pride and pleasure that [Mr.]2955-mr. and [Mrs. Bateson]123-mrs. bateson received [[their]2940-fourth - dimension people guests]2956-their guests . The double announcement that [Christopher]121-christopher was [the lost heir of [the Farringdons]201-sedgehill]2957-the lost heir of the farringdons ( for [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth had insisted on [his]121-christopher making this known ) , and that [he]121-christopher was about to marry [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , had given great delight all through [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill . [The Osierfield people]850-the osierfield people were proud of [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth , but [they]850-the osierfield people had learned to love [Christopher]121-christopher ; [they]850-the osierfield people had heard of [her]102-elisabeth glory from afar , but [they]850-the osierfield people had been eye - witnesses of the uprightness and unselfishness and nobility of [his]121-christopher life ; and , on the whole , [he]121-christopher was more popular than [she]102-elisabeth . [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth was quite conscious of this ; and — what was more — [she]102-elisabeth was glad of it . [She]102-elisabeth , who had so loved popularity and admiration , now wanted [people]2982-people to think more of [Christopher]121-christopher than of [her]102-elisabeth . Once [she]102-elisabeth had gloried in the thought that [[George Farringdon]99-george farringdon 's son]1997-george farringdon 's son would never fill [her]102-elisabeth place in the hearts of [the people of [the Osierfield]102-elisabeth]2961-the people of the osierfield ; now [her]102-elisabeth greatest happiness lay in the fact that [he]121-christopher filled it more completely than [she]102-elisabeth could ever have done , and that at [Sedgehill]1-sedgehill [she]102-elisabeth would always be second to [him]121-christopher . ' [The Lord]2978-the lord does n't look on the outward appearance , as [we]2966-the two matrons all know ; and it ' ud be a sight better for [men]445-men if [they]445-men did n't , like [Master Christopher]135-christopher [there]658-there ; there 'd be fewer unhappy marriages , mark [my]134-mrs. hankey words . "[134-mrs. hankey] " Certainly not , "[135-christopher] [Christopher]135-christopher agreed . " If there is any pretence at all , let it be in the opposite direction , and let [us]2966-the two matrons all try to appear wiser than [we]2966-the two matrons are ! "[135-christopher] " And that 's easy enough for some of [us]2966-the two matrons , such as [Hankey]134-mrs. hankey , for instance , "[134-mrs. hankey] added [Hankey]134-mrs. hankey 's better half . " And there ai n't as much wisdom to look at as [you]4877-you could put on the point of a knife even then . "[134-mrs. hankey] So [the women]2175-the women talked and [the men]3428-the men listened — as is the way of [men]445-men and women all [the world]301-the world over — until tea was finished and it was time for [the guests]2972-the guests to depart . [They]3428-the men left amid a shower of heartfelt congratulations , and loving wishes for the future opening out before [them]3428-the men . Just as [Elisabeth]102-elisabeth passed through the doorway into the evening sunshine , which was flooding [the whole land]2973-the whole land and turning even the smoke - clouds into windows of agate whereby [men]445-men caught faint glimmerings of a dim glory as yet to be revealed , [she]102-elisabeth turned and held out [her]102-elisabeth hands once more to [[her]102-elisabeth friends]464-her friends . " It is very good to come back to [you]464-her friends all , and to dwell among [[mine]102-elisabeth own people]4879-mine own people , "[102-elisabeth] [she]102-elisabeth said , [her]102-elisabeth voice thrilling with emotion ; " and [I]102-elisabeth am glad that [Mrs. Hankey]134-mrs. hankey 's prophecy has come true , and that [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth will be [Elisabeth Farringdon]102-elisabeth to the end of the chapter .
